sourceString: Preliminary Estimates of the Prevalence of Selected Underlying Health Conditions Among Patients with Coronavirus Disease 2019 — United States, February 12–March 28, 2020
targetString: Imibare y'ibanze igereranyije y'ibipimo byatoranyijwe by'abarwaye izindi ndwara mu barwaye indwara ya koronavirusi yo mu 2019; Amerika, 12 Gashyantare –28 Werurwe 2020

sourceString: On March 11, 2020, the World Health Organization declared Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) a pandemic.
targetString: Tariki ya 11 Werurwe 2020, Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku buzima ryatangaje ko indwara ya koronavirusi yo mu 2019 (COVID-19) ari icyorezo.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 571,678 confirmed COVID-19 cases and 26,494 deaths have been reported worldwide.
targetString: Kugeza tariki ya 28 Werurwe 2020, abantu bose 571 678 bemejwe ko banduye COVID-19 naho abantu 26 494 ni bo bapfuye ku isi.

sourceString: Reports from China and Italy suggest that risk factors for severe disease include older age and the presence of at least one of several underlying health conditions.
targetString: Amakuru aturuka mu Bushinwa n'Ubutaliyani avuga ko abantu baremba kubera gusaza no kuba basanzwe barwaye byibuze indwara imwe ikomeye.

sourceString: U.S. older adults, including those aged ≥65 years and particularly those aged ≥85 years, also appear to be at higher risk for severe COVID-19–associated outcomes; however, data describing underlying health conditions among U.S. COVID-19 patients have not yet been reported.
targetString: Abanyamerika bashaje, harimo abafite cyangwa barengeje imyaka 65 by'umwihariko abafite cyangwa barengeje imyaka 85, na bo basa nk'abafite ibyago byo kuzahazwa n'indwara iterwa na COVID-19; ariko, amakuru agaragaza abarwaye izindi ndwara mu barwaye COVID-19 muri Amerika ntaratangazwa.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, U.S. states and territories have reported 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases to CDC, including 7,162 (5.8%) for whom data on underlying health conditions and other known risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections were reported.
targetString: Kugeza tariki ya 28 Werurwe 2020, leta n'intara by'Amerika byamenyesheje Ikigo gishinzwe kugenzura no gukumira indwara cyo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika (CDC) ko hari abarwayi ba COVID-19 122 653; muri bo 7 162 (5,8%) byavuzwe ko bafite izindi ndwara n'ibyago byo kurwara indwara zikomeye z'ubuhumekero.

sourceString: Among these 7,162 cases, 2,692 (37.6%) patients had one or more underlying health condition or risk factor, and 4,470 (62.4%) had none of these conditions reported.
targetString: Muri abo barwayi 7 162, abarwayi 2 692 (37,6%) bari barwaye izindi ndwara cyangwa bafite ibyago byo kuzirwara, naho 4 470 (62,4%) byavuzwe ko nta bundi burwayi bari bafite.

sourceString: The percentage of COVID-19 patients with at least one underlying health condition or risk factor was higher among those requiring intensive care unit (ICU) admission (358 of 457, 78%) and those requiring hospitalization without ICU admission (732 of 1,037, 71%) than that among those who were not hospitalized (1,388 of 5,143, 27%).
targetString: Ijanisha ry'abarwayi ba COVID-19 barwaye byibuze indi ndwara imwe cyangwa ibyago byo kuyirwara ryari hejuru mu bagiye mu bitaro bakeneye ubuvuzi bw'indembe (358 muri 457, 78%) naho abagiye mu bitaro badakeneye ubuvuzi bw'indembe (732 muri 1 037, 71%) kurusha abataragiye mu bitaro (1 388 muri 5 143, 27%).

sourceString: The most commonly reported conditions were diabetes mellitus, chronic lung disease, and cardiovascular disease.
targetString: Izindi ndwara abarwayi bari bwaraye zakunze kuvugwa cyane harimo diyabete, indwara y'ibihaha idakira n'indwara y'umutima.

sourceString: These preliminary findings suggest that in the United States, persons with underlying health conditions or other recognized risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections appear to be at a higher risk for severe disease from COVID-19 than are persons without these conditions.
targetString: Iby'ibanze byavuye mu bushakashatsi bigaragaza ko muri Amerika abantu bafite izindi ndwara cyangwa bazwi ko bafite ibyago byo kuzahazwa n'indwara z'ubuhumekero bafite ibyago byinshi byo kurwara COVID-19 kurusha abatarwaye izo ndwara.

sourceString: Data from laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases reported to CDC from 50 states, four U.S. territories and affiliated islands, the District of Columbia, and New York City with February 12–March 28, 2020 onset dates were analyzed.
targetString: Hasuzumwe amakuru y'abarwayi byemejwe na laburatwari ko barwaye COVID-19 yahawe CDC yo muri leta 50, intara enye n'ibirwa bishamikiye kuri Amerika, Akarere ka Kolombiya, n'Umujyi wa New York City yo ku matariki ya 12 Gashyantare–28 Werurwe 28 2020.

sourceString: Cases among persons repatriated to the United States from Wuhan, China, and the Diamond Princess cruise ship were excluded.
targetString: Abanduye baragarutse muri Amerika bavuye muri Wuhan mu Bushinwa n'abari mu bwato bwa Diamond Princess ntibarimo.

sourceString: For cases with missing onset dates, date of onset was estimated by subtracting 4 days (median interval from symptom onset to specimen collection date among cases with known dates in these data) from the earliest specimen collection.
targetString: Ku banduye bitazwi amatariki byatangiriye, itariki byatangiriyeho yaragereranyijwe hakurwaho iminsi 4 (intera y'impuzandengo y'igihe cyo gutangira kugaragaza ibimenyetso n'itariki ibipimo byafatiweho) uhereye igihe ibipimo byafatiweho bwa mbere.

sourceString: Public health departments reported cases to CDC using a standardized case report form that captures information (yes, no, or unknown) on the following conditions and potential risk factors: chronic lung disease (inclusive of asthma, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease [COPD], and emphysema); diabetes mellitus; cardiovascular disease; chronic renal disease; chronic liver disease; immunocompromised condition; neurologic disorder, neurodevelopmental, or intellectual disability; pregnancy; current smoking status; former smoking status; or other chronic disease.
targetString: Amashami y'ubuzima yamenyesheje CDC abarwaye hakoreshejwe ifishi isanzwe yandikwamo abanduye ikubiyemo amakuru (abarwaye, abatarwaye cyangwa ntibizwi) ku bafite uburwayi n'ibyago byo kurwara bikurikira: Indwara y'ibihaha idakira (harimo asima, indwara idakira y'ibihaha [COPD], n'ibibazo byo guhumeka); diyabete, indwara y'umutima, indwara idakira y'impyiko; indwara idakira y'umwijima; indwara y'abasirikare batabasha kurwanya indwara, indwara y'imitsi, indwara y'urwungano rw'imyakura, ubumuga bwo mu mutwe; abatwite; abanywa itabi; abavuye ku itabi; cyangwa indi ndwara idakira.

sourceString: Data reported to CDC are preliminary and can be updated by health departments over time; critical data elements might be missing at the time of initial report; thus, this analysis is descriptive, and no statistical comparisons could be made.
targetString: Amakuru yahawe CDC ni ay'ibanze kandi ashobora kugenda avugururwa n'amashami y'ubuzima; hashobora kuba hari amakuru y'ingenzi atarimo mu gutanga raporo ya mbere; bityo, iri sesengura rirasobanura gusa, nta kugereranya imibare bishobora gukorwa.

sourceString: The percentages of patients of all ages with underlying health conditions who were not hospitalized, hospitalized without ICU admission, and hospitalized with ICU admission were calculated.
targetString: Habazwe ijanisha ry'abarwayi b'imyaka bose bafite izindi ndwara batajyanwe mu bitaro, abajyanwe mu bitaro ariko ntibashyirwe mu ndembe, n'abajyanwe mu bitaro bagashyirwa mu ndembe.

sourceString: Percentages of hospitalizations with and without ICU admission were estimated for persons aged ≥19 years with and without underlying health conditions.
targetString: Ijanisha ry'abajyanwe mu bitaro ariko ntibashyirwe cyangwa bagashyirwa mu ndembe byaragereranyijwe ku bafite cyangwa barengeje imyaka 19 bafite cyangwa badafite izindi ndwara.

sourceString: This part of the analysis was limited to persons aged ≥19 years because of the small sample size of cases in children with reported underlying health conditions (N = 32).
targetString: Iki gice cy'isesengura cyagarukiye gusa ku bafite cyangwa barengeje imyaka 19 kubera ko hari abana bake byavuzwe ko bafite izindi ndwara (Umubare = 32).

sourceString: To account for missing data among these preliminary reports, ranges were estimated with a lower bound including cases with both known and unknown status for hospitalization with and without ICU admission as the denominator and an upper bound using only cases with known outcome status as the denominator.
targetString: Mu kuzirikana amakuru abura muri izo raporo z'ibanze, hagereranyijwe ibyiciro hakoreshejwe imibare yo hasi harimo abarwayi bizwi cyangwa bitazwi ko bagiye mu bitaro bagashyirwa cyangwa ntibashyirwe mu ndembe nk'icyita rusange ndetse n'umubare wo hejuru hakoreshejwe abarwaye gusa bizwi uko bahagaze nk'icyita rusange.

sourceString: Because of small sample size and missing data on underlying health conditions among COVID-19 patients who died, case-fatality rates for persons with and without underlying conditions were not estimated.
targetString: Kubera ingano nto y'ibipimo n'amakuru adahari ku barwaye izindi ndwara banarwaye COVID-19 ikabahitana, ibipimo by'abahitanwa n'indwara bafite cyangwa badafite izindi barwaye ntibyabazwe.

sourceString: As of March 28, 2020, a total of 122,653 laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases (Figure) and 2,112 deaths were reported to CDC.
targetString: Kugeza tariki ya 28 Werurwe 2020, igiteranyo cy'abantu 122 653 bemejwe na laburatwari ko barwaye COVID-19 (Igishushanyo) n'abapfuye 2 112 byamenyeshejwe CDC.

sourceString: Case report forms were submitted to CDC for 74,439 (60.7%) cases.
targetString: Amafishi atangazwamo abarwaye yahawe CDC arimo abarwayi 74 439 (60,7%).

sourceString: Data on presence or absence of underlying health conditions and other recognized risk factors for severe outcomes from respiratory infections (i.e., smoking and pregnancy) were available for 7,162 (5.8%) patients (Table 1).
targetString: Amakuru ku kuba hari cyangwa hatari izindi ndwara n'abafite ibyago byo kurwara indwara z'ubuhumekero zikomeye (ni ukuvuga kunywa itabi no gutwita) byagaragaye mu barwayi 7 162 (5,8%) (Imbonerahamwe ya 1).

sourceString: Approximately one third of these patients (2,692, 37.6%), had at least one underlying condition or risk factor.
targetString: Hafi kimwe cya gatatu cy'abo barwayi (2 692, 37,6%), byibuze bari barwaye indi ndwara cyangwa bafite ibyago byo kurwara.

sourceString: Diabetes mellitus (784, 10.9%), chronic lung disease (656, 9.2%), and cardiovascular disease (647, 9.0%) were the most frequently reported conditions among all cases.
targetString: Diyabete (784, 10,9%), indwara idakira y'ibihaha (656, 9,2%), n'indwara y'umutima (647, 9,0%) ni zo zavuzwe cyane muri abo barwayi bose.

sourceString: Among 457 ICU admissions and 1,037 non-ICU hospitalizations, 358 (78%) and 732 (71%), respectively occurred among persons with one or more reported underlying health condition.
targetString: Mu barwayi 457 bashyizwe mu ndembe naho 1 037 bajyanwe mu bitaro ariko ntibashyirwe mu ndembe, 358 (78%) naho 732 (71%), byanabaye mu bantu bafite indi ndwara imwe cyangwa irenze yatangajwe.

sourceString: In contrast, 1,388 of 5,143 (27%) COVID-19 patients who were not hospitalized were reported to have at least one underlying health condition.
targetString: Ku bitandukanye, 1 388 muri 5 143 (27%) by'abarwayi ba COVID-19 batajyanwe mu bitaro byavuzwe ko byibuze bafite indi ndwara imwe.

sourceString: Among patients aged ≥19 years, the percentage of non-ICU hospitalizations was higher among those with underlying health conditions (27.3%–29.8%) than among those without underlying health conditions (7.2%–7.8%); the percentage of cases that resulted in an ICU admission was also higher for those with underlying health conditions (13.3%–14.5%) than those without these conditions (2.2%–2.4%) (Table 2).
targetString: Mu barwayi bafite cyangwa barengeje imyaka 19, ijanisha ry'abarwayi bajyanwe mu bitaro ariko batagiye mu ndembe ryari hejuru ku bafite izindi ndwara (27,3%–29,8%) kurusha abadafite izindi ndwara (7,2%–7,8%); ijanisha ry'abarwaye bashyizwe mu ndembe na ryo ryari hejuru ku bafite izindi ndwara (13,3%–14,5%) kurusha abadafite izindi ndwara (2,2%–2,4%) (Imbonerahamwe ya 2).

sourceString: Small numbers of COVID-19 patients aged < 19 years were reported to be hospitalized (48) or admitted to an ICU (eight).
targetString: Umubare muto w'abarwayi ba COVID-19 batagejeje ku myaka 19 byavuzwe ko bashyizwe mu bitaro (48) cyangwa bagashyirwa mu ndembe (umunani).

sourceString: In contrast, 335 patients aged < 19 years were not hospitalized and 1,342 had missing data on hospitalization.
targetString: Bikaba bitandukanye n'abarwayi 335 batagejeje ku myaka 19 batajyanwe mu bitaro naho 1 342 ntibari bafite amakuru ku kujyanwa mu bitaro.

sourceString: Among all COVID-19 patients with complete information on underlying conditions or risk factors, 184 deaths occurred (all among patients aged ≥19 years); 173 deaths (94%) were reported among patients with at least one underlying condition.
targetString: Mu barwayi bose ba COVID-19 bafite amakuru yuzuye yerekeye izindi ndwara barwaye cyangwa ibyago byo kurwara, muri bo 184 barapfuye (muri abo barwayi bose bafite cyangwa barengeje imyaka 19); naho abapfuye 173 (94%) byavuzwe ko muri bo bari bafite byibuze indi ndwara imwe.

sourceString: Among 122,653 U.S. COVID-19 cases reported to CDC as of March 28, 2020, 7,162 (5.8%) patients had data available pertaining to underlying health conditions or potential risk factors; among these patients, higher percentages of patients with underlying conditions were admitted to the hospital and to an ICU than patients without reported underlying conditions.
targetString: Mu barwayi 122 653 bo muri Amerika barwaye COVID-19 bamenyeshejwe CDC kugeza tariki ya 28 Werurwe 2020, abarwayi 7 162 (5,8%) bafite amakuru ajyanye n'uko bafite izindi ndwara cyangwa ibyago byo kuba bashobora kurwara; muri abo barwayi, ijanisha ryo hejuru ry'abarwayi bafite izindi ndwara bajyanwe mu bitaro banashyirwa mu ndembe kurusha abarwayi badafite izindi ndwara.

sourceString: These results are consistent with findings from China and Italy, which suggest that patients with underlying health conditions and risk factors, including, but not limited to, diabetes mellitus, hypertension, COPD, coronary artery disease, cerebrovascular disease, chronic renal disease, and smoking, might be at higher risk for severe disease or death from COVID-19.
targetString: Ibyo bisubizo bijyanye neza n'ibyavuye mu bushakashatsi bwakorewe mu Bushinwa n'Ubutaliyani buvuga ko abarwayi bafite izindi ndwara cyangwa ibyago byo kurwara harimo, ariko bitagarukiye gusa ku barwaye diyabete, umuvuduko mwinshi w'amaraso, COPD, indwara y'imijyana y'umutima, indwara y'impyiko idakira, no kunywa itabi, bashobora kuba bafite ibyago byo kuzahazwa cyangwa kwica na COVID-19.

sourceString: This analysis was limited by small numbers and missing data because of the burden placed on reporting health departments with rapidly rising case counts, and these findings might change as additional data become available.
targetString: Iri sesengura ryibanze gusa ku mibare mito n'amakuru adahari kubera amashami y'ubuzima afite ibibazo bijyanye n'umubare munini w'abarwayi wiyongera vuba, ibi byagaragaye bishobora guhinduka uko andi makuru agenda aboneka.

sourceString: It is not yet known whether the severity or level of control of underlying health conditions affects the risk for severe disease associated with COVID-19.
targetString: Ntibyari byamenyekana neza niba ubukana cyangwa kuvura izindi ndwara bituma habaho ibyago byo kuzahazwa n'indwara iterwa na COVID-19.

sourceString: Many of these underlying health conditions are common in the United States: based on self-reported 2018 data, the prevalence of diagnosed diabetes among U.S. adults was 10.1%, and the U.S. age-adjusted prevalence of all types of heart disease (excluding hypertension without other heart disease) was 10.6% in 2017.
targetString: Inyinshi muri izo ndwara zindi zisanzwe muri Amerika: hashingiwe ku makuru y'abivugiye ko barwaye izindi ndwara yo mu 2018, imibare y'abapimwe diyabete mu banyamerika bakuze yari 10,1%, naho iby'Abanyamerika bapimwe indwara y'umutima bafite imyaka igereranyije (hatarimo abafite umuvuduko mwinshi w'amaraso n'izindi ndwara z'umutima) bari 10,6% mu 2017.

sourceString: The age-adjusted prevalence of COPD among U.S. adults is 5.9%, and in 2018, the U.S. estimated prevalence of current asthma among persons of all ages was 7.9%.
targetString: Ibipimo by'abafite imyaka igereranyije barwaye COPD mu banyamerika bakuze ni 5,9%, naho mu 2018, Amerika yagaragaje ko imibare y'ibipimo by'abarwaye asima mu bantu b'imyaka yose yari 7,9%.

sourceString: CDC continues to develop and update resources for persons with underlying health conditions to reduce the risk of acquiring COVID-19.
targetString: CDC ikomeza kandi no gutegura inyandiko zigenewe abantu bafite izindi ndwara kugira ngo hagabanywe ibyago byo kwandura COVID-19.

sourceString: The estimated higher prevalence of these conditions among those in this early group of U.S. COVID-19 patients and the potentially higher risk for more severe disease from COVID-19 associated with the presence of underlying conditions highlight the importance of COVID-19 prevention in persons with underlying conditions.
targetString: Imibare y'ibipimo byo hejuru y'itsinda ry'abarwayi bo muri Amerika barwaye COVID-19 banafite ibyago byo hejuru byo kuzahazwa n'indwara iterwa na COVID-19 bitewe ni uko bafite izindi ndwara bigaragaza akamaro ko kurinda COVID-19 abarwaye izindi ndwara.

sourceString: The findings in this report are subject to at least six limitations.
targetString: Ibyavuye mu bushakashatsi biri muri iyi raporo byibuze byibanda ku ngingo esheshatu.

sourceString: First, these data are preliminary, and the analysis was limited by missing data related to the health department reporting burden associated with rapidly rising case counts and delays in completion of information requiring medical chart review; these findings might change as additional data become available.
targetString: Icya mbere, ayo makuru ni ay'ibanze, kandi isesengura ntirisesuye bitewe n'amakuru abura ajyanye n'ibivugwa n'ishami ry'ubuzima ryo kugira ibibazo by'umubare munini w'abarwayi wiyongera vuba no gutinda kuzuza amakuru asabwa gusuzumwa mu rwego rw'ubuvuzi, ibyo byavuye mu bushakashatsi bishobora guhinduka igihe habonetse andi makuru.

sourceString: Information on underlying conditions was only available for 7,162 (5.8%) of 122,653 cases reported to CDC.
targetString: Amakuru ku zindi ndwara aboneka gusa ku barwayi 7 162 (5,8%) muri 122 653 bamenyeshejwe CDC.

sourceString: It cannot be assumed that those with missing information are similar to those with data on either hospitalizations or underlying health conditions.
targetString: Ntibyafatwa ko abo barwayi badafitiwe amakuru bafite ibibazo bimwe nk'iby'abarwayi bajyanwe mu bitaro cyangwa bafite izindi ndwara.

sourceString: Second, these data are subject to bias in outcome ascertainment because of short follow-up time.
targetString: Icya kabiri, ayo makuru ashobora kuba arimo amakosa mu kumenya neza ibiyakubiyemo kubera igihe gito cyo kuyakurikirana.

sourceString: Some outcomes might be underestimated, and long-term outcomes cannot be assessed in this analysis.
targetString: Bimwe mu byavuyemo bishobora kudahabwa agaciro ku buryo ibisubizo by'igihe kirekire bitasuzumwa muri iri risesengura.

sourceString: Third, because of the limited availability of testing in many jurisdictions during this period, this analysis is likely biased toward more severe cases, and findings might change as testing becomes more widespread.
targetString: Icya gatatu, kubera ko ibikorwa byo gupima bidahagije mu bice byinshi muri iki gihe, iri sesengura rishobora kuba ririmo amakosa mu gutangaza abarembye cyane, kandi ibyavuye mu bushakashatsi bishobora guhinduka kuko ibikorwa byo gupima biri kugenda bigera mu duce twinshi.

sourceString: Fourth, because of the descriptive nature of these data, attack rates among persons with and without underlying health conditions could not be compared, and thus the risk difference of severe disease with COVID-19 between these groups could not be estimated.
targetString: Icya kane, kubera imiterere y'ibisobanuro by'aya makuru, ibipimo by'uko indwara zibasira abantu bafite n'abadafite izindi ndwara ntibyagereranywa, mukumenya itandukaniro ry'ibyago byo kuzahazwa n'indwara ya COVID-19 muri ayo matsinda ntibishobora kubarwa.

sourceString: Fifth, no conclusions could be drawn about underlying conditions that were not included in the case report form or about different conditions that were reported in a single, umbrella category.
targetString: Icya gatanu, nta mwanzuro ushobora gufatwa ku byerekeye izindi ndwara zitashyizwe muri raporo y'abanduye cyangwa ubundi burwayi butavuzwe ku murwayi umwe cyangwa icyiciro cy'abarwayi.

sourceString: For example, asthma and COPD were included in a chronic lung disease category.
targetString: Urugero: Asima na COPD byashyizwe mu cyiciro cy'indwara y'ibihaha idakira.

sourceString: Finally, for some underlying health conditions and risk factors, including neurologic disorders, chronic liver disease, being a current smoker, and pregnancy, few severe outcomes were reported; therefore, conclusions cannot be drawn about the risk for severe COVID-19 among persons in these groups.
targetString: Hanyuma, ku zindi ndwara n'ibyago byo kwandura indwara harimo indwara z'imitsi, indwara y'umwijima idakira, kuba unywa itabi no kuba utwite harimo bake barembye; bityo, nta mwanzuro wafatwa ko abantu bari muri ayo matsinda bafite ibyago byo kurembywa na COVID-19.

sourceString: Persons in the United States with underlying health conditions appear to be at higher risk for more severe COVID-19, consistent with findings from other countries.
targetString: Abo muri Amerika bafite izindi ndwara basa nk'aho bafite ibyago byo kuzahazwa cyane na COVID-19, bikaba bihuye neza n'ibyavuye mu bushakashatsi bwakorewe mu bindi bihugu.

sourceString: Persons with underlying health conditions who have symptoms of COVID-19, including fever, cough, or shortness of breath, should immediately contact their health care provider.
targetString: Abantu bafite izindi ndwara banafite ibimenyetso bya COVID-19, harimo kugira umuriro, inkorora, cyangwa guhumeka nabi, bagomba guhita babimenyesha ubaha serivisi z'ubuvuzi.

sourceString: These persons should take steps to protect themselves from COVID-19, through washing their hands; cleaning and disinfecting high-touch surfaces; and social distancing, including staying at home, avoiding crowds, gatherings, and travel, and avoiding contact with persons who are ill.
targetString: Abo bantu bagomba gufata ingamba zo kwirinda COVID-19, bakaraba intoki, basukura bakanica udukoko turi ahantu hakunda gukorwaho, kwirinda kwegerana, harimo kuguma mu rugo, kwirinda ahari abantu benshi, amateraniro, ingendo no kwirinda kwegera abantu barwaye.

sourceString: Maintaining at least a 30-day supply of medication, a 2-week supply of food and other necessities, and knowledge of COVID-19 symptoms are recommended for those with underlying health conditions.
targetString: Kugira imiti yakumaza iminsi 30, ibiribwa byakumaza ibyumweru 2 n'ibindi bikoresho bya ngombwa, no kumenya ibimenyetso bya COVID-19 ni ngombwa kuri abo bafite izindi ndwara.

sourceString: All persons should take steps to protect themselves from COVID-19 and to protect others.
targetString: Abantu bose bagomba gufata ingamba zo kwirinda COVID-19 no kurinda abandi.

sourceString: All persons who are ill should stay home, except to get medical care; should not go to work; and should stay away from others.
targetString: Abantu bose barwaye bagomba kuguma mu rugo, keretse abagiye kwivuza, ntibagomba kujya ku kazi, kandi bagomba kutegera abandi.

sourceString: This is especially important for those who work with persons with underlying conditions or who otherwise are at high risk for severe outcomes from COVID-19.
targetString: By'umwihariko, ni ngombwa ku bantu bakorana n'abarwaye izindi ndwara cyangwa bafite ibyago byo kuzahazwa na COVID-19.

sourceString: Community mitigation strategies, which aim to slow the spread of COVID-19, are important to protect all persons from COVID-19, especially persons with underlying health conditions and other persons at risk for severe COVID-19–associated disease (https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/community-mitigation-strategy.pdf).
targetString: Ingamba zo kugabanya ubwandu mu baturage, zigamije kugabanya ikwirakwira rya COVID-19, ni ngombwa ko zirinda abantu bose indwara ya COVID-19, by'umwihariko abantu bafite izindi ndwara n'abafite ibyago byo kuzahazwa n'indwara iterwa na COVID-19 (https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/downloads/community-mitigation-strategy.pdf).

sourceString: What is already known about this topic?
targetString: Ni iki gisanzwe kizwi kuri iki kibazo?

sourceString: Published reports from China and Italy suggest that risk factors for severe COVID-19 disease include underlying health conditions, but data describing underlying health conditions among U.S. COVID-19 patients have not yet been reported.
targetString: Raporo zatangajwe ziturutse mu Bushinwa n'Ubutaliyani zivuga ko ibyago byo kuzahazwa n'indwara ya COVID-19 harimo kuba ufite izindi ndwara, ariko amakuru asobanura izindi ndwara mu barwaye COVID-19 muri Amerika ntaratangazwa.

sourceString: What is added by this report?
targetString: Ni iki kindi izi raporo zivuga?

sourceString: Based on preliminary U.S. data, persons with underlying health conditions such as diabetes mellitus, chronic lung disease, and cardiovascular disease, appear to be at higher risk for severe COVID-19–associated disease than persons without these conditions.
targetString: Hashingiwe ku makuru y'ibanze yo muri Amerika, abantu bafite izindi ndwara nka diyabete, indwara y'ibihaha idakira, n'indwara y'umutima ni bo bafite ibyago byinshi byo kuzahazwa n'indwara iterwa na COVID-19 kurusha abadafite izo ndwara.

sourceString: What are the implications for public health practice?
targetString: Bifite izihe ngaruka ku bikorwa by'inzego z'ubuzima?

sourceString: Strategies to protect all persons and especially those with underlying health conditions, including social distancing and handwashing, should be implemented by all communities and all persons to help slow the spread of COVID-19.
targetString: Ingamba zo kurinda abantu bose by'umwihariko abafite izindi ndwara, harimo kwirinda kutegerena no koga intoki, bigomba gushyirwa mu bikorwa n'inzego zose n'abantu bose kugira ngo bifashe mu kugabanya ikwirakwira rya COVID-19.

sourceString: Emergence of a Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19): Protocol for Extending Surveillance Used by the Royal College of General Practitioners Research and Surveillance Centre and Public Health England
targetString: Kugaragara k'ubwoko bushya bwa koronavirusi (COVID-19): Porotokore yo kwagura ubugenzuzi bwakoreshejwe n'Ikigo cya Royal College of General Practitioners Research and Surveillance Center na Minisiteri y'ubuzima mu Bwongereza

sourceString: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) and Public Health England (PHE) have successfully worked together on the surveillance of influenza and other infectious diseases for over 50 years, including three previous pandemics.
targetString: Ikigo cya Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) na Ministeri y'ubuzima mu Bwongereza (PHE) byakoranye neza mu kugenzura ibicurane n'izindi ndwara zandura mu myaka irenga 50 ishize, harimo ibyorezo bitatu biheruka.

sourceString: With the emergence of the international outbreak of the coronavirus infection (COVID-19), a UK national approach to containment has been established to test people suspected of exposure to COVID-19.
targetString: Kugaragara kw'icyorezo mpuzamahanga cy'indwara ya koronavirusi (COVID-19), Ubwongereza bwashyizeho amabwiriza yo gupima abantu bikekwa ko hari aho bahuriye na COVID-19.

sourceString: At the same time and separately, the RCGP RSC's surveillance has been extended to monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community as well as assess the effectiveness of the containment strategy.
targetString: Mu gihe kimwe ariko mu bikorwa bitandukanye, ubugenzuzi bw'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC bwaraguwe kugira ngo bukurikirane aho indwara ya COVID-19 mu duce igumamo by'igihe gito n'igihe kirekire ndetse no gusuzuma imikorere y'ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo.

sourceString: The aims of this study are to surveil COVID-19 in both asymptomatic populations and ambulatory cases with respiratory infections, ascertain both the rate and pattern of COVID-19 spread, and assess the effectiveness of the containment policy.
targetString: Ubu bushakashatsi bugamije kugenzura COVID-19 mu bantu batagaragaza ibimenyetso n'abarwaye bakunda gukora ingendo bafite indwara z'ubuhumekero, hakemezwa ibipimo n'ishusho y'ikwirakwira rya COVID-19 no gusuzuma imikorere y'amabwiriza yo kurwanya icyorezo.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC, a network of over 500 general practices in England, extract pseudonymized data weekly.
targetString: Ikigo cya RCGP RSC, ihuriro ry'abaganga barenga 500 bo mu Bwongereza, buri cyumweru babona amakuru aho abayatanze batagaragazwa.

sourceString: This extended surveillance comprises of five components: (1) Recording in medical records of anyone suspected to have or who has been exposed to COVID-19.
targetString: Ubu bugenzuzi bwagutse bugizwe n'ibice bitanu: (1) Kubika amakuru y'ubuvuzi y'umuntu wese bikekwa ko arwaye cyangwa afite aho yahuriye na COVID-19.

sourceString: Computerized medical records suppliers have within a week of request created new codes to support this.
targetString: Abatanga amakuru y'ubuvuzi hakoreshejwe mudasobwa mu cyumweru kimwe bashyizeho kode nshya zitanga ubufasha.

sourceString: (2) Extension of current virological surveillance and testing people with influenza-like illness or lower respiratory tract infections (LRTI)—with the caveat that people suspected to have or who have been exposed to COVID-19 should be referred to the national containment pathway and not seen in primary care.
targetString: (2) Kwagura ubugenzuzi bwa virusi buri gukorwa no gusuzuma abantu bafite uburwayi bumeze nk'ibicurane cyangwa indwara zibasira inzira z'ubuhumekero (LRTI), harimo kuba abantu bikekwa ko barwaye cyangwa bafite aho bahuriye na COVID-19 boherezwa mu bigo by'igihugu byabugenewe ntiboherezwe mu bigo nderabuzima.

sourceString: (3) Serology sample collection across all age groups.
targetString: (3) Gufata ibipimo by'amaraso ku bantu by'imyaka yose.

sourceString: This will be an extra blood sample taken from people who are attending their general practice for a scheduled blood test.
targetString: Hafatwa ibindi bizamini by'amaraso by'abantu bajya kwa muganga usanzwe ubavura akabafata amaraso hakurikijwe gahunda.

sourceString: The 100 general practices currently undertaking annual influenza virology surveillance will be involved in the extended virological and serological surveillance.
targetString: Kuri ubu, abaganga 100 bakora mu by'ubugenzuzi bwa virusi y'ibicurane buri mwaka bari mu bugenzuzi bwagutse bwo gukurikirana virusi n'ibizamini by'amaraso.

sourceString: (4) Collecting convalescent serum samples.
targetString: (4) Gufata ibipimo by'amaraso y'abarwayi bari koroherwa.

sourceString: We have the opportunity to escalate the data extraction to twice weekly if needed.
targetString: Dufite amahirwe yo gutanga amakuru y'ibipimo byafashwe kabiri buri cyumweru niba ari ngombwa.

sourceString: Swabs and sera will be analyzed in PHE reference laboratories.
targetString: Ibipimo byo mu mazuru, mu kanwa n'amaraso bisuzumwa na laburatwari z'ibanze za PHE.

sourceString: General practice clinical system providers have introduced an emergency new set of clinical codes to support COVID-19 surveillance.
targetString: Serivisi z'abanga zashyizweho kode nshya z'ubutabazi bwihutirwa mu gufasha kugenzura COVID-19.

sourceString: Additionally, practices participating in current virology surveillance are now taking samples for COVID-19 surveillance from low-risk patients presenting with LRTIs.
targetString: Kandi, abaganga bari gukora mu byo kugenzura virusi ubu bari gufata ibipimo byifashishwa mu kugenzura COVID-19 babikuye ku barwayi bafite ibyago bike byo kurwara LRTI.

sourceString: Within the first 2 weeks of setup of this surveillance, we have identified 3 cases: 1 through the new coding system, the other 2 through the extended virology sampling.
targetString: Mu byumweru 2 bya mbere iyi gahunda y'ubugenzuzi imaze gushyirwaho, hatahuwe abarwayi 3: 1 yatahuwe na sisitemu nshya yo kohereza kode naho abandi 2 baturuka mu gufata ibipimo bya virusi ku buryo bwagutse .

sourceString: We have rapidly converted the established national RCGP RSC influenza surveillance system into one that can test the effectiveness of the COVID-19 containment policy.
targetString: Twahinduye mu buryo bwihuse ingamba zisanzwe zo gukurikirana indwara z'ibicurane bw'Ikigo cy'igihugu cya RCGP RSC mo ingamba zikomeye zo kurwanya icyorezo cya COVID-19.

sourceString: The extended surveillance has already seen the use of new codes with 3 cases reported.
targetString: Ubugenzuzi bwagutse bwamaze gukoresha kode nshya aho byatumye hatahurwa abarwayi 3.

sourceString: Rapid sharing of this protocol should enable scientific critique and shared learning.
targetString: Gusangira vuba iyi porotokore bigomba gutuma habaho isesengura rya siyansi no gusangira ubumenyi.

sourceString: The Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) is a network of general practices (GPs) with a nationally representative population that provides pseudonymized data for weekly surveillance of infectious diseases.
targetString: Ikigo cya Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) Research and Surveillance Centre (RSC) ni itsinda ry'abaganga (GP) bakorera mu bice bitandukanye by'igihugu batanga amakuru mu ibanga mu bugenzuzi bw'indwara zandura bukorwa buri cyumweru.

sourceString: The disease surveillance program is commissioned by Public Health England (PHE) and covers 37 infectious diseases, including influenza.
targetString: Porogaramu y'ubugenzuzi bw'indwara iyoborwa na Minisiteri y'ubuzima mu Bwongereza (PHE) ikaba ikurikirana indwara 37 zandura harimo n'ibicurane.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC and PHE have an established collaboration of over 50 years in influenza and respiratory disease surveillance and are now in their 53rd season of surveillance and analysis.
targetString: Ikigo cya RCGP RSC na PHE bifitanye ubufatanye bumaze imyaka 50 mu kugenzura ibicurane n'indwara z'ubuhumekero none ubu ubwo bufatanye bugeze ku mwaka wa 53.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC extracts pseudonymized data from a nationally representative sample of over 500 urban and nonurban GPs each week covering a population of over 4 million.
targetString: Ikigo cya RCGP RSC gikura amakuru mu ibanga mu bipimo byafashwe mu gihugu birenga 500 byafashwe n'abaganga bakorera mu mijyi no mu byaro buri cyumweru by'abaturage barenga 4 million.

sourceString: Data from these practices are reported online in a weekly return, which includes monitoring weekly rates of influenza-like illness (ILI) and other communicable and respiratory diseases in England.
targetString: Amakuru y'ibyo bipimo atangirwa kuri interineti buri cyumweru, harimo gukurikirana buri cyumweru ibipimo by'indwara zimeze nk'ibicurane (ILI) n'izindi ndwara zandura n'iz'ubuhumekero mu Bwongereza.

sourceString: We also produce an annual report.
targetString: Tunakora raporo ngarukamwaka.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC data set includes all coded data and all prescribed items including vaccine exposure.
targetString: Itsinda ry'amakuru y'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC anarimo amakuru asobetse n'imiti yose yandikiwe abarwayi harimo n'abatewe inkingo.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC conducts virology surveillance each influenza season, with 100 GPs participating in the 2019-2020 season (Figure 1).
targetString: Ikigo cya RCGP RSC gikora ubugenzuzi bwa virusi kuri buri bicurane, aho abaganga 100 bitabiriye icyiciro cya 2019-2020 (Igishushanyo cya 1).

sourceString: These virology sampling practices are also recruited to be nationally representative (Figure 1).
targetString: Abo bafata ibipimo bya virusi batoranywa ku rwego rw'igihugu (Igishushanyo cya 1).

sourceString: GPs take nasopharyngeal swabs from persons showing acute respiratory illness within 7 days of the onset of symptoms.
targetString: Abaganga bafata ibipimo byo mu mazuru babikuye mu bantu bafite indwara z'ibicurane by'igikatu iminsi 7 batangiye kugaragaza ibimenyetso.

sourceString: Nasopharyngeal swabs are taken from children younger than 5 years showing symptoms of acute bronchitis or bronchiolitis.
targetString: Ibipimo byo mu mazuru bifatwa abana batagejeje imyaka 5 baragaraza ibimenyetso by'anjine y'igikatu cyangwa anjine.

sourceString: Additionally, nasopharyngeal samples are taken from anyone 5 years and older showing acute onset of ILI and respiratory synctial virus.
targetString: Kandi, ibipimo byo mu mazuru bifatwa abantu bafite imyaka 5 cyangwa bayirengeje bagaragaza ibimenyetso bikomeye by'indwara z'ubuhumekero ziterwa na virusi.

sourceString: Swabs are tested at the PHE Respiratory Virus Unit for influenza to monitor positivity rates and circulating strains, as well as for measuring vaccine effectiveness.
targetString: Ibyo bipimo byo mu mazuru bipimirwa mu Ishami rirwanya virusi zifata imyanya y'ubuhumekero n'ibicurane rya PHE kugira ngo hakurikiranwe neza ibipimo na virusi ziri kwanduza abantu no gupima ko urukingo rukora neza.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC successfully conducted a pilot collecting serological samples from adults and linking them to a patient's medical records during the 2018-2019 influenza season.
targetString: Ikigo cya RCGP RSC cyakoze neza igerageza ry'ibanze ryo gufata ibipimo by'amaraso bikuwe mu bantu bakuru no kubihuza n'amakuru y'abarwayi mu gihe cy'icyorezo cy'ibicurane cyo mu 2018-2019.

sourceString: This pilot was in collaboration with the PHE Seroepidemiology Unit and added to the residual blood samples submitted to PHE by National Health Service (NHS) laboratories.
targetString: Igerageza ry'ibanze ryakozwe mu bufatanye n'Ishami rirwanya ibyorezo rya PHE ryiyongera ku bipimo by'amaraso byasigaye mu byoherejwe kuri PHE na laburatwari z'Ikigo cy'igihugu cy'ubuzima mu Bwongereza (NHS).

sourceString: Serology can provide important information about background population immunity, and sentinel networks can provide a mechanism for systematic data collection and linkage to medical records and health outcomes.
targetString: Gupima ubwandu bishobora gutanga amakuru y'ingenzi yerekeye ubudahangarwa abantu bafite noneho ibigo bishinzwe kurwanya ubwandu bigatanga uburyo bwo gukusanya amakuru no guhuza amakuru y'ubuvuzi n'ay'ubuzima.

sourceString: The serology pilot has demonstrated the ability of the network to collect serology samples in adults.
targetString: Igerageza ry'ibanze ryo gupima ubwandu ryagaragaje ubushobozi bw'ibyo bigo bwo gukusanya ibipimo by'ubwandu mu bantu bakuru.

sourceString: With the COVID-19 outbreak, PHE and RCGP RSC have adapted existing influenza surveillance to monitor the spread of COVID-19 in the community, and this protocol sets out the basis for that collaboration.
targetString: Mu gihe cy'icyorezo cya COVID-19, PHE n'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC byahinduye ubugenzuzi bw'indwara y'ibicurane busanzweho maze bukurikirana ikwirakwira rya COVID-19 mu baturage, kandi iyi porotokore ni yo yashingiweho muri iyo mikoranire.

sourceString: The primary national strategy for COVID-19 infection is containment, with patients who are at high risk managed via the telephone help system NHS111 and the PHE health protection teams, but the RCGP RSC surveillance is entirely separate.
targetString: Ingamba z'ibanze z'igihugu mu kurwanya indwara ya COVID-19 ni ukuyikumira aho abarwayi bafite ibyago byinshi byo kuyandura bakurikiranwa hakoreshejwe ubufasha bwo kuri telefone butangirwa kuri NHS111 n'amatsinda abungabunga ubuzima ya PHE, ariko ubugenzuzi bw'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC buratandukanye cyane.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC, by extending its established work, will provide virological and serological surveillance to monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community, and assess the effectiveness of the containment strategy.
targetString: Mu kwagura ibikorwa gisanzwe gikora, Ikigo cya RCGP RSC gitanga ubugenzuzi ku gukurikirana virusi n'ubwandu kugira ngo gikurikirane COVID-19 mu duce igumamo by'igihe gito n'igihe kirekire no gusuzuma imikorere y'ingamba zo kurwanya icyorezo.

sourceString: We would not be working in isolation on this research.
targetString: Ntitwakora twenyine kuri ubu bushakashatsi.

sourceString: We will share the protocol with UK colleagues and the I-MOVE consortium who have recently obtained EU Horizon 2020 funding from the stream “Advancing knowledge for the clinical and public health response to the novel coronavirus epidemic”.
targetString: Tuzasangira porotokore n'abavandimwe b'abongereza b'ihuriro rya I-MOVE baherutse kubona inkunga y'Umuryango w'ubumwe bw'Uburayi yo mu 2020 yo “Gukomeza ubumenyi bw'abaturage mu kurwanya icyorezo cy'ubwoko bushya bwa koronavirusi”.

sourceString: It is anticipated that great efficiencies in project management will result through this collaboration than that obtained from countries acting alone.
targetString: Biteganywa ko imibare ihamye mu micungire y'umushinga izatuma habaho ubufatanye bwavuye muri iyi mikoranire kurusha ubwavuye mu bihugu bikora byonyine.

sourceString: The aim of this study is to identify whether there is undetected community transmission of COVID-19, estimate population susceptibility, and monitor the temporal and geographical distribution of COVID-19 infection in the community.
targetString: Icyo ubu bushakashatsi bugamije ni ukugaragaza niba hari kwanduzanya COVID-19 bitigeze bitahurwa , kugereranya umubare w'abantu bikekwa ko banduye no gukurirana ikwirakwira mu gice igumamo by'igihe gito n'igihe kirekire rya COVID-19 mu baturage.

sourceString: The objectives of this study are as follows:
targetString: Icyo ubu bushakashatsi bugamije ni ibi bikurikira:

sourceString: To monitor the burden of suspected COVID-19 activity in the community through primary care surveillance and clinical coding of possible COVID-19 cases referred into the containment pathway
targetString: Mu rwego rwo gukurikirana abakekwaho COVID-19 mu baturage binyuze mu kugenzura abatanga ubuvuzi bw'ibanze no gutanga kode kw'ibitaro ku banduye COVID-19 bajyanwe mu gufungirwa mu kato

sourceString: To provide virological evidence on the presence and extent of undetected community transmission of COVID-19 and monitor positivity rates among individuals presenting ILI or acute respiratory tract infections to primary care
targetString: Mu rwego rwo gutanga ibimenyetso bya virusi ku migaragarire n'urwego virusi igenda idatahuwemo mu kwanduzanya mubaturage kwa COVID-19 no gukurikiranya ibimenyetso bihamye mu bantu bagaragaza indwara za ILI cyangwa kwereka abavuzi b'ibanze indwara z'ubuhumekero z'igikatu

sourceString: To estimate baseline susceptibility to COVID-19 in the community and estimate both symptomatic and asymptomatic exposure rates in the population through seroprevalence monitoring
targetString: Kugereranya ubwandu bwa COVID-19 mu baturage no kugereranya ibipimo by'abahuye n'indwara bagaragaza n'abatagaragaza ibimenyetso mu baturage hifashishijwe gukurikirana abanduye

sourceString: To pilot implementation of a scheme for collection of convalescent sera with antibody profiles among recovered cases of COVID-19 discharged to the community
targetString: Gushyira mu bikorwa gahunda yo gukusanya amaraso arimo abasirikare b'umubiri mu bakize COVID-19 basubiye aho batuye

sourceString: We intend to capture the following.
targetString: Turateganya kubona ibikurikira.

sourceString: Clinical workload related to reports of COVID-19 using the codes created to flag cases, those being assessed and where the infection is located are excluded (Figures 2-​-44)
targetString: Inyandiko zo kwa muganga zijyanye na raporo kuri COVID-19 hakoreshejwe kode yashyizweho itagaragaza abanduye, abari gusuzumwa n'aho ubwandu buherereye (Igishushanyo cya 2-​-44)

sourceString: Foreign countries visited in the last 28 days
targetString: Ibihugu by'amahanga byasuwe mu minsi 28 ishize

sourceString: Existing codes that may have utility (Tables 1-​-3).3).
targetString: Kode zisanzweho zishobora kuba ari ingirakamaro (Imbonerahamwe za 1-​-3).3).

sourceString: Many GPs and primary care teams may not realize that important relevant data can be coded.
targetString: Abaganga benshi n'amatsinda atanga ubuvuzi bw'ibanze ashobora kutabona ko amakuru y'ingenzi yashyirwamo kode.

sourceString: There is also the potential during any pandemic to monitor the effectiveness of any transmission control measures.
targetString: Kandi hari n'amahirwe mu bihe by'icyorezo yo gukurikirana ko ingamba zo kurwanya ubwandu zikora neza.

sourceString: Reliable coding of letters and test results that will show an infection has become either confirmed or excluded
targetString: Kode zikoresha inyuguti n'ibisubizo by'ibizamini byizewe byerekana ubwandu ko byemejwe cyangwa bwakuwemo

sourceString: The methods will follow the approach used in the current influenza surveillance system and recent serology study, and includes five components: (1) primary care clinical surveillance; (2) virological surveillance; (3) population serological surveillance; (4) convalescent sera in cases; and (5) data curation.
targetString: Ubwo buryo bukurikiza uburi gukoreshwa mu kugenzura ibicurane n'ubushakashatsi ku gupima ubwandu buherutse gukorwa, bukaba bugizwe n'ibice bitanu: (1) ubugenzuzi bw'ubuvuzi bw'ibanze butangirwa mu mavuriro; (2) ubugenzuzi bw'ubwandu buterwa na virusi; (3) ubugenzuzi bw'abafashwe ibipimo by'ubwandu; (4) abakize ubwandu; no (5) gucunga amakuru.

sourceString: The NHS uses the Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms (SNOMED CT) system of coding, which is normally only updated twice annually.
targetString: Ikigo cya NHS gikoresha uburyo bwa SNOMED CT bwo gukora kode, ubusanzwe bukaba buvugururwa kabiri mu mwaka gusa.

sourceString: There was added complexity as some computerized medical record (CMR) suppliers use the Read coding systems (Read clinical terms version 3 – CTv3), which is no longer updated.
targetString: Hajemo ibisa nk'ibigoranye aho uburyo bwo gutanga amakuru y'ubuvuzi yabitswe muri mudasobwa (CMR) bukoresha uburyo bwo gukora kode bwa Read (Read ikoreshwa mu muga y'ubuvuzi, verisiyo ya 3 – CTv3), ikaba itakivugururwa.

sourceString: Additionally, there were no clinical codes to record COVID-19 in early February 2020.
targetString: Ikindi kandi nta kode zo mu buvuzi zifashishwaga mu kwandika ibyerekeye COVID-19 mu ntangiriro za Gashyantare 2020.

sourceString: Therefore, the two main GP system suppliers added the five terms shown in Table 4 as system-wide local codes.
targetString: Bityo, uburyo bubiri bwifashishwa n'abaganga bwongeyeho amuga atanu yerekanwe mu mbonerahamwe ya 4 nka kode zikoreshwa hose mu gihugu.

sourceString: A UK emergency release of SNOMED CT concepts for COVID-19 was also subsequently made available across all CMR systems (Table 4).

sourceString: We have the option to move to twice weekly surveillance reports with a scope to change this to daily reporting.

sourceString: We will continue virology sampling from our sentinel practices, rather than discontinuing as seasonal influenza declines.
targetString: Tuzakomeza gufata ibipimo bya virusi bivuye mu bikorwa dukora byo kurwanya virusi, aho kubihagarika kubera ko ibicurane biri gucika.

sourceString: Additionally, we will recruit more surveillance practices.
targetString: Kandi tuzashaka abandi bakozi bakora mu byo kugenzura virusi.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC virology practices will aim to undertake 200-300 nasopharyngeal swabs per week across the RCGP RSC sentinel network, collecting specimens across all age bands.
targetString: Ibikorwa byo kurwanya virusi by'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC bigamije gufata ibipimo byo mu mazuri 200-300 buri cyumweru ku mashami arwanya virusi y'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC, hakusanywa ibipimo by'abantu b'imyaka yose.

sourceString: In addition to the inclusion criteria for influenza virology surveillance (ILI, acute bronchitis/bronchiolitis), participating practices will take nasopharyngeal swab samples from any people showing acute symptoms of LRTI if the onset of symptoms is within 7 days.
targetString: Usibye kongera virusi itera ibicurane mu bigenzurwa [indwara zimeze nk'ibicurane (ILI), anjine y'ikigatu/anjine], abaganga bakora mu bugenzuzi bazajya bafata ibipimo byo mu mazuru by'abantu bagaragaza ibimenyetso bikomeye by'indwara yibasira inzira y'ubuhumekero (LRTI) niba ibimenyetso byaratangiye mu minsi 7.

sourceString: RCGP RSC research officers and practice liaison staff will manage practices to achieve a total national sample of 200-300 swabs per week.
targetString: Abakozi bakora mu by'ubushakashatsi b'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC n'abakozi bahuza ibikorwa barakorana kugira ngo babashe kubona ibipimo biturutse mu gihugu bingana na 200-300 ku cyumweru.

sourceString: This could be increased if PHE modelers require more samples.
targetString: Bishobora kwiyongera igihe abashyiraho ingamba ba PHE bakeneye ibindi bipimo.

sourceString: Samples from each practice would be spread across the following age groups: < 5 years, 5-17 years, 18-64 years, and 65 years and older
targetString: Ibipimo bifatwa na buri muganga bifatwa abantu bafite iyi myaka: bafite cyangwa barengeje imyaka 5, 5-17, 18-64 n'abafite imyaka 65 no kuzamura

sourceString: Samples (swabs or serum) collected will be sent via prepaid envelopes addressed to the appropriate PHE laboratory for analysis.
targetString: Ibipimo (byo mu mazuru cyangwa amaraso) byakusanyijwe byoherezwa mu ibahasha yateguwe iriho aderesi ya raboratwari ya PHE kugira ngo bisuzumwe.

sourceString: All samples collected will be tested for the presence of influenza and COVID-19.
targetString: Ibipimo byose byafashwe birasuzumwa harebwa niba birimo ibicurane na COVID-19.

sourceString: Additionally, PHE will retrospectively test any influenza virology samples collected between early and mid-February 2020 for COVID-19.
targetString: Kandi, PHE yongera igapima ibizamini by'ubwandu bw'ibicurane byafashwe mu ntangiriro no hagati ya Gashyantare 2020 harebwa ko harimo COVID-19.

sourceString: Practices will still follow the PHE protocol for COVID-19 with respect to people at risk of infection who should be signposted down the containment pathway, rather than physically attend their practice.
targetString: Abaganga bakomeza gukurikiza porotokore ya PHE mu gupima COVID-19, naho abantu bafite ibyago byo kwandura bagomba kugaragazwa bagapimwa aho kwigira kwa muganga ubavura.

sourceString: Direct testing of those who attend surgery remains permitted, but we have also rolled out self-swabbing at home.
targetString: Biracyemewe ko abagiye ku bagwa bapimwa, twanatanze udukoresho twifashishwa mu gupima ku buryo abantu babikorera aho baba.

sourceString: Summary of processes are detailed in Multimedia Appendix 3.

sourceString: Everyone with an ILI or a respiratory illness who contacts a GP (eg, phones for an appointment) should be asked specifically about recent travel to China and other countries flagged in current PHE advice, or if they have had contact with other people with COVID-19.

sourceString: If these screening enquiries are positive, the patient would be advised to not come to the practice but instead to follow the PHE flow sheet.
targetString: Mu gihe ibyo bipimo bigaragaje ko yanduye, umurwayi asabwa kutaza kwa muganga ahubwo agakurikiza ibikubiye mu nyandiko ya PHE.

sourceString: This will be followed by 800 samples monthly.

sourceString: We will develop a new request form for practices to capture recent travel and exposure to COVID-19.
targetString: Tuzashyiraho ifishi nshya yo gusaba amakuru kugira ngo abaganga babone abaheruka gukora ingendo n'abafite aho bahuriye na COVID-19.

sourceString: We will pilot a scheme for collecting convalescent serology from people with confirmed cases and who have had an acute virology sample at the time of their infection.
targetString: Tuzashyiraho uburyo bushya bwo gufata amaraso y'abakize akuwe mu bantu byemejwe ko barwaye banafashwe ibipimo by'ubwandu igihe banduragara.

sourceString: This is to identify a carrier state in patients who have recovered from the virus but may continue shedding the virus.
targetString: Ni mu rwego rwo kumenya imimerere yo kwanduza indwara mu barwayi bakize virusi ariko bakaba bashobora gukomeza kuyikwirakwiza.

sourceString: If there are a small number of cases, this may assist in developing a test kit for patients to take to their own GP and explore its acceptability to patients.
targetString: Igihe hari umubare muto w'abanduye, bishobora gufasha mu gukora ibikoresho byo gupima abarwayi bakabishyira abanganga babavura harebwa niba byemewe gukoreshwa n'abarwayi.

sourceString: If there are a large number of COVID-19 cases nationally, convalescent samples could be collected from RCGP RSC practices where there are confirmed cases, with the ability to link to the full medical record.
targetString: Niba hari umubare munini w'abanduye COVID-19 mu gihugu, ibipimo by'abakize bishobora gukurwa ku baganga bakorana n'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC aho byemejwe ko banduye, hariho n'ubushobozi bwo kubihuza n'amakuru y'ubuvuzi asesuye.

sourceString: This process may include checking pseudonymized NHS numbers for positive individuals at RCGP RSC practices, checking current PHE guidance regarding considerations of infectiousness for confirmed cases, and offering the patient an appointment following the previously mentioned process.
targetString: Iki gikorwa gishobora kuba kirimo gusuzuma mu ibanga imibare y'Ikigo cya NHS ku banduye bo mu baganga b'Ikigo c ya RCGP RSC, kugenzura amabwiriza ari gukurikizwa ya PHE ku bwandu bw'abemejwe ko banduye, no guha umuryango randevu hakurikijwe igikorwa cyagaragajwe.

sourceString: This needs to be carefully coordinated nationally across the network and may require PHE to ensure individuals are not contacted by multiple agencies.
targetString: Birasaba kubikurikirana neza ku rwego rw'igihugu mu bigo byose kandi bishobora gusaba ko PHE yizera neza abantu badahamagawe n'ibigo byinshi.

sourceString: RCGP RSC could provide a useful structure to channel the initial contact once PHE has made a request.
targetString: Ikigo cya RCGP RSC gishobora gutanga amabwiriza ya ngombwa mu gutanga amakuru ku barwaye bwa mbere igihe bisabwa na PHE.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC practices participating in the annual influenza virology surveillance have started sampling from patients showing symptoms of a LRTI.
targetString: Abaganga bakorana n'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC bakora mu bugenzuzi bwa virusi y'ibicurane buri mwaka batangiye gufata ibipimo by'abarwayi bagaragaza ibimenyetso bya LRTI.

sourceString: All samples received are being tested for influenza and COVID-19.
targetString: Ibipimo byose byakiriwe bisuzumwa niba barimo ibicurane na COVID-19.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC will explore ways to collect convalescent samples from any patients tested positive for COVID-19 through the extension of the virological surveillance.
targetString: Ikigo cya RCGP RSC gishaka uburyo bwo gukusanya ibipimo by'abakize by'abarwayi bapimwe bagasanga bafite COVID-19 binyuze mu bikorwa byagutse by'ubugenzuzi bw'ubwandu bwa virusi.

sourceString: From the start, we will be carefully curating data to ensure that it can be used for future studies.
targetString: Guhera ku ntangiriro, tuzacunga amakuru twitonze duharanira ko yakoreshwa mu bushakashatsi buzakorwa mu minsi iri imbere.

sourceString: Our clinical data will be linked to virology.
targetString: Amakuru yo mu mavuriro azahuzwa n'ibipimo by'ubwandu.

sourceString: We will curate our data using the Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable principles.
targetString: Tuzacunga amakuru yacu hakoreshejwe amahame yo kubika amakuru ashakishwa, aboneka, akoreshwa mu zindi sisitemu, yongera gukoreshwa.

sourceString: To facilitate this our data set is listed with Health Data Research UK and the European Health Data Evidence Network.
targetString: Kugira ngo bikunde, amatsinda y'amakuru yacu ari ku murongo w'amakuru y'ubushakashatsi mu buvuzi mu Bwongereza n'amakuru y'ubuvuzi yo mu Burayi.

sourceString: The statistical methodology is in support of a policy approach to widespread disease outbreak, where so-called nonpharmaceutical interventions (NPIs) are used to respond to an emerging pandemic to produce disease suppression.
targetString: Uburyo bw'ibarurishamibare bukorana n'amabwiriza yo kugera ku makuru y'indwara z'ibyorezo, kurwanya ubwandu hadakoreshejwe imiti (NPI) birakoreshwa mu rwego rwo guhangana n'ibyorezo bishya mu rwego rwo gukumira indwara.

sourceString: This policy aims to reduce contact rates in the population and thereby reduce transmission of the virus.
targetString: Izi ngamba zigamije kugabanya imibare y'abahura n'abanduye no kugabanya ikwirakwira rya virusi.

sourceString: To implement this the UK government has recently articulated the desire to implement population self-isolation measures.
targetString: Mu kubishyira mu bikorwa, leta y'Ubwongereza iherutse kugaragaza icyifuzo cyo kubahiriza amabwiriza yo kwishyira mu kato.

sourceString: By targeting the reproduction number (R) (the average number of secondary cases each case generates) and aiming to reduce the R to below 1, the policy seeks to reduce case numbers to low levels or (as seen in previous outbreaks with severe acute respiratory syndrome and Ebola) to eliminate human-to-human transmission.
targetString: Mu guhangana n'umubare w'ubwandu bushya (R) (impuzandengo y'umubare umuntu wanduye yanduza) hanagamijwe kugabanywa R ikagera munsi ya 1; gahunda igamije kugabanya umubare w'abandura ku rugero rwo hasi cyangwa (nk'uko byagaragaye mu byorezo byabanje bitera indwara z'ubuhumekero z'igikatu na ebola) mu kugabanya kwanduzanya hagati y'abantu.

sourceString: As the experience from the 2009 H1N1 pandemic has shown, NPIs can be a crucial component of pandemic mitigation.
targetString: Nk'uko ibyavuye mu cyorezo cya 2009 H1N1 bibigaragaza, NPI ishobora kuba ari ikintu cy'ingenzi mu kugabanya ikwirakwira ry'icyorezo.

sourceString: Key to the focus of our study will be the estimation of peak cases in the population and continual monitoring by data collection and modelling the potential growth and emergence of subsequent peaks in new cases as social distancing measures are relaxed.
targetString: Icyo ubushakashatsi bwacu bwibandaho ni kugereranya igihe abaturage bashobora kwandura ari benshi no gukomeza gukurikirana igikorwa cyo gukusanya amakuru no kugagaza ishusho y'uko hashobora kuboneka abantu bashya banduye mu gihe ingamba zo kwirinda kwegerana zorohejwe.

sourceString: There has already been publication of important disease epidemiological measures concerning the outbreak of COVID-19 in mainland China.
targetString: Hamaze gutangazwa inyandiko z'ingenzi ku ngamba zo kurwanya indwara z'ibyorezo ku byerekeye icyorezo cya COVID-19 mu Bushinwa.

sourceString: A further fundamental measure in pandemic dynamics is the length of time from infection to when a person is infectious to others and the mean duration of infectiousness.
targetString: Ikindi cyibanze cyifashishwa mu gupima uko icyorezo cyandura ni igihe kiri hagati y'ubwandu n'igihe umuntu yanduje abandi n'impuzandengo y'igihe ubwandu bumara.

sourceString: These factors, if estimated accurately, will give good predictions for the likely length of the pandemic, the final number of infected cases.
targetString: ibyo bipimo, igihe bibazwe neza, biba ari ingenzi mu gutenganya igihe icyorezo gishobora kumara, n'umubare ntarengwa w'abantu bazandura.

sourceString: We intend to apply approximate Bayesian inference (ABC) to (possibly spatially heterogeneous) Susceptible-Exposed- Infectious-Removed (SEIR) stochastic epidemic models.
targetString: Turizera gukoresha uburyo bwa Bayesian mu ibarurishamibare (ABC) hakoreshejwe uburyo bwa SEIR bwo gukurikirana ubwandu bw'icyorezo harebwa abashobora kwandura n'aho bandurira.

sourceString: Such techniques are highly parallelizable and have been successfully applied to many fields including disease transmission modelling.
targetString: Ubu buryo bushobora gukoreshwa bubangikanye cyane kandi bwarakoreshejwe bigenda neza mu bice bitandukanye harimo no kugaragaza ishusho y'uko indwara zandura.

sourceString: They are particularly suited to situations where likelihood functions are absent and where more traditional approaches such as Markov chain Monte Carlo are impractical.
targetString: By'umwihariko, zibereye gukoreshwa aho bigoranye kubona ibisa n'aho bidashoboka gukoresha uburyo busanzwe nka Markov Chain Monte Carlo.

sourceString: Such an approach has been demonstrated to work effectively on the ASPREN surveillance data, a network of sentinel GPs and nurse practitioners who report deidentified information on ILIs and other conditions, where issues such as missing data and the need to model the observation process itself has been successfully addressed.
targetString: Byagaragaye ko ubwo buryo bukora neza ku makuru y'ubugenzuzi bwa ASPREN, ihuriro ry'abaganga n'abaforomo barwanya indwara batanga raporo ikubiyemo amakuru y'ibanga ku ndwara zimeze nk'ibicurane n'izindi ndwara, aho ibibazo nk'amakuru abura no gukenera gushyiraho uburyo ngenderwaho bw'igikorwa cy'ingenzura ubwabyo biba byarekemuwe neza.

sourceString: Furthermore, peaks in new cases have been estimated by distributional methods.
targetString: Kandi, ukwiyongera gukabije kw'abandura bashya kwabazwe hakoreshejwe uburyo bwo bwo gukurikirana ubwandu.

sourceString: Estimates of the parameters of the SEIR model are tractable on large data sets because of parallelizability, and these methods have been implemented in several R libraries; we intend to use the libraries ABSEIR (deposited on GitHub: https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj) and abctools (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4) to estimate epidemic measures on a weekly basis.
targetString: Imibare y'amabwiriza ya modeli ya SEIR irakurikiranwa mu matsinda yagutse y'amakuru kubera ko ishobora kubangikanywa n'ubwo buryo bashyizwe mu bikorwa mu bubiko bwinshi bwa R; tukaba tugamije gukoresha ububiko bwa ABSEIR (bwashyizwe kuri GitHub: https://tinyurl.com/vqu35cj) na abctools (https://tinyurl.com/tfjavz4) kugira ngo habarwe imibare y'icyorezo buri cyumweru.

sourceString: Since we are fitting an SIR-epidemic model in the ABC routine, we anticipate that our results will be robust against weekly case data containing relatively small counts.
targetString: Mu gihe gushyira uburyo bwa SIR bwifashishwa mu gukurikirana icyorezo muri modeli ABC isanzwe, turateganya ko ibisubizo tuzabona bizaba bikomeye bigereranyijwe n'amakuru atangwa buri cyumweru arimo aba arimo imibare mito.

sourceString: For example, see for the ABC methodology applied to the Tristan da Cunha common cold data from 1967, where counts of I (number of infectious cases) and R (number of recovered cases) are in the tens at most.
targetString: Urugero: Reba uburyo bwa ABC bwakoreshejwe ku makuru y'ibicurane ya Tristan da Cunha mu 1967, aho imibare ya I (umubare w'abanduye) na R (umubare w'abakize) uba ubarirwa mu binyacumi.

sourceString: Finally, in addition to the above methodology we will employ the Kaplan-Meier method with two outcomes (death and recovery) to estimate the case fatality ratio.
targetString: Hanyuma, ku bindi byerekeye uburyo bukoreshwa bwavuzwe haruguru tuzakoresha uburyo bwa Kaplan-Meier butanga ibisubizo bibiri (abapfuye n'abakize) kugira ngo tubare igipimo cy'abapfa.

sourceString: This approach is independent of the ABC methodology and will allow comparisons between estimates from the two modelling approaches to judge robustness of results.
targetString: Ubu buryo ni uburyo bwigenga bwa ABC kandi butuma hakorwa igereranya hagati y'imibare y'uburyo bubiri hasuzumwa umwimerere w'ibyavuye mu bushakashatsi.

sourceString: RCGP RSC's surveillance with PHE is defined as Health Protection under Regulation 3 of The Health Service (Control of Patient Information) Regulations 2002.
targetString: Ubugenzuzi bw'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC gifatanyije na PHE busobanurwa nko kubungabunga ubuzima hakurikijwe ibwiriza rya 3 rigenga serivisi z'ubuvuzi (Igenzura ry'amakuru y'umurwayi) ryo mu Mategeko yo mu 2002.

sourceString: This has been confirmed by PHE's Caldicott Guardian's Office.
targetString: Byemejwe n'Ibiro bya Caldicott Guardian bya PHE.

sourceString: We do not see any increased risk to practices or practitioners taking part in this surveillance.
targetString: Nta byago tubona byiyongera ku baganga bari mu bikorwa by'ubugenzuzi.

sourceString: Infection prevention and control advice will follow extant national guidance.
targetString: Inama zo gukumira no kurwanya ubwandu bikurikiza amabwiriza y'igihugu ariho.

sourceString: Any cases identified will be managed according to the PHE/NHS guidance in force at the time, including advice for identified contacts.
targetString: Abanduye bose bagaragaye bagenzurwa hakurikijwe amabwiriza ya PHE/NHS akurikizwa icyo gihe, harimo inama ku kumenya abantu bahuye n'abanduye.

sourceString: However, our training will include reminders about safe handling of specimens and revision of infection control measures anticipated to be high in our practices.
targetString: Ariko, amahugurwa yacu azaba ibyo kwibutsa gufata neza ibipimo no kongera gusuzuma ingamba zo kurwanya ubwandu biteganyijwe ko biziyongera mu bikorwa byacu.

sourceString: It is a key part of Regulation 12 about safe care and treatment, periodically inspected by the Care Quality Commission.
targetString: Ni igice cy'ingenzi mu Ibwiriza rya 12 ryerekeye kwita ku barwayi no kuvura bitekanye, bigenzurwa mu gihe runaka na Komisiyo ishinzwe ubuziranenge mu buvuzi.

sourceString: Travel History and Clinical Descriptors of the COVID-19 Infections
targetString: Ingendo umuntu yakoze n'ibisobanuro byo mu rwego rw'ubuvuzi ku bwandu bwa COVID-19

sourceString: The RCGP RSC practices have been advised on the clinical coding that has been made available for COVID-19 across all CMR systems.
targetString: Abaganga bakorana n'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC bagiriwe inama ku gukoresha kode mu by'ubuvuzi ziboneka kuri COVID-19 muri sisitemu zose za CMR.

sourceString: This includes information on coding of clinical descriptors (Table 4) and any recent travel history.
targetString: Harimo amakuru yo gushyira kode ku bisobanuro byo mu rwego rw'ubuvuzi (Imbonerahamwe ya 4) n'abaherutse gukora ingendo.

sourceString: Establishment of Extended Virology Sampling
targetString: Ishyirwaho ryo gufata ibipimo by'ubwandu bwa virusi ku buryo bwagutse

sourceString: The RCGP RSC practices participating in the annual influenza virology surveillance have started sampling from patients showing symptoms of LRTI.
targetString: Abaganga bakorana n'Ikigo cya RCGP RSC bakora mu bugenzuzi bwa virusi y'ibicurane buri mwaka batangiye gufata ibipimo by'abarwayi bagaragaza ibimenyetso bya LRTI.

sourceString: All samples received are being tested for influenza and COVID-19.
targetString: Ibipimo byose byakiriwe bisuzumwa niba barimo ibicurane na COVID-19.

sourceString: This has led to initial early identification of background spread in low-risk patients.
targetString: Ibi byatumye hamenyekana hakiri kare amakuru ku barwayi bafite ibyago bike byo kwandura.

sourceString: As of March 7, 2020, the surveillance system has detected 2 cases of COVID-19 in low-risk patients with no history of travel through extended virological sampling.
targetString: Kugeza tariki ya 7 Werurwe 2020, sisitemu y'ubugenzuzi yatahuye abantu 2 banduye COVID-19 mu barwayi bafite ibyago bike byo kwandura batigeze bakora ingendo mu gikorwa cyagutse cyo gufata ibipimo by'ubwandu bwa virusi.

sourceString: This protocol describes how we have adapted a national influenza surveillance system to monitor community spread of an unexpected infection of COVID-19.
targetString: Iyi porotokore isobanura uko twahinduye sisitemu y'ubugenzuzi bw'ibicurane kutayikoresha mu kugenzura abaturage bandura icyorezo kitari cyitezwe cya COVID-19.

sourceString: We have rapidly created and incorporated new codes to allow data recording, and are collecting data to monitor the effectiveness of containment strategies.
targetString: Twashyizeho mu buryo bwihuse kandi bunoze kode nshya zidufasha kubika amakuru, none zikaba ziri gukusanya amakuru kugira ngo dukurikirane umusaruro w'ingamba zo kurwanya ubwandu.

sourceString: Through this surveillance, we intend to find out more about the epidemiology of COVID-19 in ambulatory care.
targetString: Hifashishijwe ubu bugenzuzi, tugamije kumenya ibindi byekereye icyorezo cya COVID-19 mu barwayi bavurwa bataha.

sourceString: In particular, its rate of spread, both temporal and geographical.
targetString: By'umwihariko, umuvuduko wo kwandura mu gice virusi igumamo by'igihe gito n'igihe kirekire.

sourceString: Our testing of low-risk patients will also inform whether the containment strategy that is based on virology testing of high-risk patients and their contacts plus self-isolation is effective.
targetString: Gusuzuma abarwayi bafite ibyago bike byo kwandura binatanga amakuru niba ingamba zo kurwanya ubwandu zishingiye ku gusuzuma virusi mu barwayi bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura n'abo bahuye na bo ndetse niba kwishyira mu kato bitanga umusaruro.

sourceString: Containment should slow the spread, and there may be benefits in the management of spread from intense surveillance.
targetString: Gukumira icyorezo bigomba kugabanya ubwandu, kandi hashobora kuba hari inyungu nyinshi mu kurwanya ubwandu zava mu gukora ubugenzuzi bukaze.

sourceString: However, there may come a point at which the virus spreads more widely into the population, as has happened in Italy.
targetString: Ariko, hari igihe virusi ishobora gukwirakwira cyane mu baturage, nk'uko byagenze mu Butaliyani.

sourceString: Surveillance of low-risk patients should inform when we reach this tipping point and when infection rates start to remit.
targetString: Ubugenzuzi bw'abarwayi bafite ibyago bike byo kwandura bugomba kuduha amakuru igihe tugeze kuri uru rwego n'igihe imibare y'ubwandu itangiye kugabanuka.

sourceString: The epidemiology of COVID-19 remains emergent.
targetString: Icyorezo cya COVID-19 gikomeje kwiyongera.

sourceString: The registration-based nature of UK primary care means that we will be able to create a complete picture of the cumulative incidence and duration.
targetString: Umuco wo kwandika w'inzego zitanga ubuvuzi bw'ibanze mu Bwongereza usobanuye ko tuzabasha kubona ishusho nyayo y'igihe ubwandu bwabereye n'igihe bwamaze.

sourceString: The surveillance system should be able to identify areas where COVID-19 spread is taking place that might be suitable for trials of antiviral therapy.
targetString: Sisitemu y'ubugenzuzi igomba kugaragaza aho ikwirakwira rya COVID-19 riri kubera hashobora kuba habereye gukorerwa igerageza ry'imiti igabanya ubukana.

sourceString: We could also follow up on the effectiveness or any adverse reactions to these medicines or vaccinations.
targetString: Dushobora kandi gukurikirana imikorere myiza cyangwa ingaruka zishobora guterwa n'iyo miti cyangwa inkingo.

sourceString: Finally, early detection of a confirmed COVID-19 case has exemplified the rapid implementation of this enhanced surveillance in the national network.
targetString: Hanyuma, gutahura hakiri kare abemejwe ko barwaye COVID-19, byatanze urugero rwiza rw'ishyirwamubikorwa ryihuse ry'ubu buryo bw'igenzura bunoze ku rwego rw'igihugu.

sourceString: Safety of practices is our primary concern.
targetString: Umutekano w'ibikorwa ni yo nshingano yacu y'ibanze.

sourceString: The RCGP RSC has operated for over 50 years and has been involved in collecting samples to monitor disease and vaccine effectiveness through the Hong Kong flu pandemic of 1968/69, the Russian flu of 1977/78, and the 2009 Swine flu pandemic.
targetString: Ikigo gishinzwe ubushakashatsi n'ubugenzuzi cya RCGP kimaze imyaka isaga 50 gikora kandi cyagiye kigira uruhare mu gukusanya ibipimo byo gukurikirana indwara n'imikorere myiza y'inkingo binyuze mu cyorezo cy'ibicurane cya Hong Kong cyo mu 1968/69, mu bicurane by'Uburusiya byo mu 1977/78 n'icyorezo cy'ibicurane by'ingurube mu 2009.

sourceString: We are not aware of any increased risk to practice staff or other patients from involvement in surveillance.
targetString: Ntabwo tuzi ibyago byiyongera ku bakozi bari mu kazi cyangwa abandi barwayi bashobora kugira uruhare mu bugenzuzi.

sourceString: Pandemic preparedness is part of the role of the RCGP RSC.
targetString: Kwitegura guhangana n'icyorezo cyo ku rwego rw'isi ni kimwe mu nshingano z'Ikigo gishinzwe ubushakashatsi n'ubugenzuzi cya RCGP.

sourceString: It is plausible that enhanced coding of information from contacts with the practices in RCGP RSC will reduce the likelihood of people who may be suspected COVID-19 cases being brought to the surgery inadvertently.
targetString: Birashoboka ko amakuru abitswe neza y'abakoranye n'Ikigo gishinzwe ubushakashatsi n'ubugenzuzi cya RCGP azagabanya abantu bashobora gukekwaho kuba barwaye COVID-19 bazanwa kubagwa batabishaka.

sourceString: Where cases are detected unexpectedly, it is probably helpful for that patient, their contacts, and the practice to know.
targetString: Aho abarwaye bagaragaye mu buryo butunguranye, birashoboka ko kubimenya byafasha uwo murwayi, abo yabonanye nabo, ndetse n'abakozi bita ku barwayi.

sourceString: The impact on practices has been to close for a day, if a case is found, for deep cleaning and then reopen.
targetString: Ingaruka byagize ku mikorere ni ugufunga umunsi umwe, igihe hagaragaye urwaye, kugira ngo hakorwe isuku yimbitse hanyuma bakongera gufungura.

sourceString: The principal limitations of our system are the number of data points.
targetString: Imbogamizi ikomeye y'imikorere yacu ni umubare w'ahaturuka amakuru.

sourceString: We are collecting serology and virology data from 100 sites, which covers a small group of the population.
targetString: Turi gukusanya amakuru y'ibipimo by'amaraso na virusi, byafatiwe ahantu 100, bikaba bigize itsinda rito ry'abantu.

sourceString: This has been satisfactory for monitoring influenza, but we are not certain if this is a sufficiently large sample for the COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: Ibi byabaye ibyo kwishimirwa mu gukurikirana ibicurane, ariko ntituzi neza niba iki ari igipimo ngero gihagije ku cyorezo cya COVID-19.

sourceString: Our sites (surveillance practices) are currently fixed, and it could be helpful to be able to rapidly onboard practices in regions where there are more cases.
targetString: Aho dukorera (ibikorwa by'igenzura) kuri ubu hari gutunganywa, kandi bishobora gufasha mu gutangira gukoreshwa mu buryo bwihuse mu duce twagaragayemo abarwaye benshi.

sourceString: Currently, we will be reporting weekly.
targetString: Kuri ubu, tuzajya dutanga raporo buri cyumweru.

sourceString: Our existing system can be enhanced to twice weekly, but maybe daily or hourly data should be our current approach.
targetString: Uburyo bwacu dusanzwe dukoresha bushobora kongerwa inshuro ebyiri mu cyumweru, ariko birashoboka ko ubu twakoresha uburyo bwo gutanga amakuru ya buri munsi cyangwa buri isaha.

sourceString: Opportunistic sampling for serology in children younger than 10 years might be limited due to the overall reduced rate of blood tests in children.
targetString: Gufata ibipimo ngero by'amaraso ku bana batagejeje ku myaka 10 bishobora kuba bidahagije bitewe n'igabanuka rusange ry'ibipimo by'amaraso mu bana.

sourceString: The extended surveillance using the RCGP RSC-PHE network for the emergent COVID-19 outbreak has been established rapidly.
targetString: Hashyizweho ku buryo bwihuse igenzura ryagutse ukoresheje umuyoboro wa RCGP RSC-PHE ku cyorezo cyateye cya COVID-19.

sourceString: The model of getting the appropriate informatics to enable capture of the required data has already been a success, with data recording starting the week the codes were created.
targetString: Uburyo bw'icyitegererezo bwo kubona amakuru akwiye kugira ngo budushoboze gufata amakuru asabwa bwamaze gukora neza, bushobora kubika amakuru, guhera mu cyumweru kode yashyiriweho.

sourceString: In addition, modifying the existing surveillance system to collect population data in a parallel way has also been effective.
targetString: Byongeye kandi, guhindura uburyo bwo kugenzura busanzweho kugira ngo hakusanywe amakuru y'abaturage mu buryo bukorerwa rimwe nabyo byagize akamaro.

sourceString: However, we are at present unsure as to whether the scale of this surveillance provides sufficient data to drive local containment strategies or if reporting infrequently meets the need of our information age.
targetString: Ariko, kuri ubu ntituramenya neza niba igipimo cy'iri genzura gitanga amakuru ahagije kugira ngo habeho ingamba zo gukumira icyorezo mu gihugu cyangwa niba gutanga raporo ku buryo budahoraho bihura n'amakuru ku myaka dukeneye.

sourceString: National Basketball Association suspends season due to COVID-19 concerns
targetString: Ishyirahamwe ry'umukino wa basiketi muri Amerika (NBA) ryahagaritse umwaka w'imikino kubera impungenge zatewe na COVID-19

sourceString: On Wednesday, the United States' National Basketball Association (NBA) suspended its professional basketball season due to concerns regarding COVID-19.
targetString: Ku wa gatatu, Ishyirahamwe ry'umukino wa basiketi muri Amerika (NBA) ryahagaritse umwaka w'imikino wa basiketi bitewe n'impungenge zijyanye na COVID-19.

sourceString: The NBA's decision followed a Utah Jazz player testing positive for the COVID-19 virus.
targetString: Icyemezo cya NBA cyafashwe nyuma y'uko umukinnyi wa Utah Jazz yapimwe bakamusangana virusi ya COVID-19.

sourceString: The NBA did not release the identity of the player in question in its announcement.
targetString: NBA ntiyigeze igaragaza umwirondoro w'uwo mukinnyi mu itangazo yashyize hanze.

sourceString: They did say he was not present at Chesapeake Energy Arena in Oklahoma City, where the Utah Jazz were to play against the Oklahoma City Thunder.
targetString: Ryatangaje ko atigeze aza ku kibuga cya Chesapeake Energy Arena mu mujyi wa Oklahoma, aho ikipe ya Utah Jazz yagombaga gukina na Oklahoma City Thunder.

sourceString: According to its press release, the NBA was "suspending game play following the conclusion of [Wednesday's] schedule of games until further notice."
targetString: Mu itangazo rigenewe abanyamakuru, NBA yatangaje ko ihagaritse imikino nyuma y'isozwa ry'imikino yose yari iteganyijwe kuba [yo ku wa gatatu] kugeza igihe hazatangazwa andi mabwiriza.

sourceString: The Jazz's game was cancelled, as was another NBA game Wednesday between the Sacramento Kings and the New Orleans Pelicans.
targetString: Umukino w'ikipe ya Jazz ntiwabaye, kimwe n'undi mukino wa NBA wagombaga kuba ku wa gatatu hagati ya Sacramento Kings na New Orleans Pelicans.
