sourceString: NOW, THEREFORE, I, GAVIN NEWSOM, Governor of the State of California, in accordance with the authority vested in me by the State Constitution and statutes of the State of California, and in particular, Government Code sections 8567, 8627, and 8665 do hereby issue the following Order to become effective immediately:
targetString: KUBERA IZI MPAMVU, NJYEWE, GAVIN NEWSOM, Guverineri wa leta ya California, nkurikije ububasha mpabwa n'Itegeko Nshinga rya leta n'amategeko ya leta ya California; cyane cyane Itegeko rigenga leta mu bice byaryo bya 8567, 8627 na 8665 ntanze Itegeko rikurikira kandi rigahita ritangira kubahirizwa:

sourceString: IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT:
targetString: BITEGETSWE KO:

sourceString: 1) To preserve the public health and safety, and to ensure the healthcare delivery system is capable of serving all, and prioritizing those at the highest risk and vulnerability, all residents are directed to immediately heed the current State public health directives, which I ordered the Department of Public Health to develop for the current statewide status of COVID-19.
targetString: 1) Habungwabungwa ubuzima rusange n'umutekano no guharanira ko ubuvuzi bugera kuri bose no gushyira imbere abafite ibyago byinshi n'intege nke kandi abaturage bose barasabwa guhita bubahiriza amabwiriza y'ubuzima rusange ya leta ariho nategetse Ishami ry'ubuzima gutegura nkurikije uko ibintu bimeze muri leta ku bijyanye n'icyorezo cya COVID-19.

sourceString: Those directives are consistent with the March 19, 2020, Memorandum on Identification of Essential Critical Infrastructure Workers During COVID-19 Response, found at: https://covid19.ca.gov/.
targetString: Ayo mabwiriza ajyanye n'inyandiko yo ku wa 19 Werurwe 2020, akaba ari Inyandiko yo kumenyesha abakora mu nzego za ngombwa mu kurwanya icyorezo cya COVID-19, iboneka kuri: https://covid19.ca.gov/.

sourceString: ORDER OF THE STATE PUBLIC HEALTH OFFICER
targetString: ITEGEKO RITANZWE N'UFITE UBUZIMA RUSANGE MU NSHINGANO ZE

sourceString: To protect public health, I as State Public Health Officer and Director of the California Department of Public Health order all individuals living in the State of California to stay home or at their place of residence except as needed to maintain continuity of operations of the federal critical infrastructure sectors, as outlined at https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.
targetString: Mu kurinda ubuzima rusange, njyewe nk'Ufite ubuzima rusange mu nshingano ze n'Umuyobozi Mukuru w'Ishami ry'ubuzima rusange muri California ntegetse abatuye bose muri leta ya California kuguma mu rugo cyangwa aho batuye keretse ari ngombwa mu gukomeza ibikorwa by'inzego za ngombwa zagenwe n'igihugu, nk'uko byasobanuwe muri https://www.cisa.gov/critical-infrastructure-sectors.

sourceString: In addition, and in consultation with the Director of the Governor's Office of Emergency Services, I may designate additional sectors as critical in order to protect the health and well-being of all Californians.
targetString: Kandi, maze kugisha inama Umuyobozi Mukuru w'Ibiro bya Guverineri bishinzwe ubutabazi bwihuse, nshobora gushyira izindi nzego mu nzego za ngombwa mu kurinda ubuzima n'imibereho by'abatuye bose muri California.

sourceString: Pursuant to the authority under the Health and Safety Code 120125, 120140, 131080, 120130(c), 120135, 120145, 120175 and 120150, this order is to go into effect immediately and shall stay in effect until further notice.
targetString: Hashingiwe ku bubasha mpabwa n'Itegeko rigenga ubuzima n'umutekano 120125, 120140, 131080, 120130(c), 120135, 120145, 120175 na 120150, iri tegeko rigomba guhita ritangira gukurikizwa kandi bigakomeza gutyo kugeza igihe hazatangwa andi mabwiriza.

sourceString: The federal government has identified 16 critical infrastructure sectors whose assets, systems, and networks, whether physical or virtual, are considered so vital to the United States that their incapacitation or destruction would have a debilitating effect on security, economic security, public health or safety, or any combination thereof.
targetString: Leta y'igihugu yagaragaje inzego za ngombwa 16 aho imitungo, imikorere n'ihuzamurongo ryazo yaba ifatika cyangwa idafatika bifatwa ko ari ngombwa n'Amerika kandi kudakora kwabyo cyangwa kwangirika kwabyo bikaba byagira ingaruka ku mutekano, ubuzimra rusange cyangwa umutekano cyangwa bibiri muri ibyo.

sourceString: I order that Californians working in these 16 critical infrastructure sectors may continue their work because of the importance of these sectors to Californians' health and well-being.
targetString: Ntegetse abatuye muri California bakora muri izo nzego za ngombwa uko ari 16 ko bagomba gukomeza gukora kubera ko ari inzego z'ingenzi ku buzima n'imibereho by'abatuye muri California.

sourceString: This Order is being issued to protect the public health of Californians.
targetString: Iri Tegeko rishyizweho mu rwego rwo kurinda ubuzima rusange bw'abatuye muri California.

sourceString: The California Department of Public Health looks to establish consistency across the state in order to ensure that we mitigate the impact of COVID-19.
targetString: Ishami ry'ubuzima rusange rya California rigamije gushyiraho amabwiriza akurikizwa kimwe muri leta yose mu rwego rwo kugabanya ingaruka z'icyorezo cya COVID-19.

sourceString: Our goal is simple, we want to bend the curve, and disrupt the spread of the virus.
targetString: Intego yacu irumvikana, turifuza kugabanya umubare w'abandura no gukumira ikwirakwira rya virusi.

sourceString: The supply chain must continue, and Californians must have access to such necessities as food, prescriptions, and health care.
targetString: Gutunganya no kugemura ibicuruzwa bigomba gukomeza n'abatuye muri California bagomba kubona ibikenerwa by'ibanze nk'ibiribwa, imiti n'ubuvuzi.

sourceString: When people need to leave their homes or places of residence, whether to obtain or perform the functions above, or to otherwise facilitate authorized necessary activities, they should at all times practice social distancing.
targetString: Iyo abantu bakeneye kuva mu rugo rwabo cyangwa aho batuye, yaba bagiye gusaba serivisi cyangwa gukora mu nzego zavuzwe haruguru cyangwa gufasha mu bikorwa bya ngombwa byemewe, igihe cyose bagomba kwirinda kwegerana.

sourceString: 2) The healthcare delivery system shall prioritize services to serving those who are the sickest and shall prioritize resources, including personal protective equipment, for the providers providing direct care to them.
targetString: 2) Inzego z'ubuvuzi zigomba gushyira imbere serivisi zo kuvura abarwaye cyane no gushyira imbere kubona ibikoresho bihagije, harimo imyenda y'ubwirinzi yabugenewe yo guha abatanga serivisi bita ku barwayi mu buryo butaziguye.

sourceString: 3) The Office of Emergency Services is directed to take necessary steps to ensure compliance with this Order.
targetString: 3) Ibiro bishinzwe ubutabazi bwihuse busabwa gufata ingamba za ngombwa mu guharanira ko hubahirizwa iri Tegeko.

sourceString: 4) This Order shall be enforceable pursuant to California law, including, but not limited to, Government Code section 8665.
targetString: 4) Iri Tegeko rigomba gushyirwa mu bikorwa hakurikijwe amategeko yo muri California, harimo ariko bitagarukiye gusa ku Itegeko rigenga leta igice cya 8665.

sourceString: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that as soon as hereafter possible, this Order be filed in the Office of the Secretary of State and that widespread publicity and notice be given of this Order.
targetString: HANATEGETSWE KO vuba bishoboka, iri Tegeko rigomba gushyirwa mu gitabo cy'amategeko cyo mu Biro by'Umunyamabanga wa leta kandi rigatangazwa hose.

sourceString: This Order is not intended to, and does not, create any rights or benefits, substantive or procedural, enforceable at law or in equity, against the State of California, its agencies, departments, entities, officers, employees, or any other person.
targetString: Iri Tegeko ntirigamije kandi ntiribereyeho, gutanga uburenganzira cyangwa ibyo abantu bagenerwa, kwifashishwa mu kugena ibigize ikirego cyangwa guca imanza, gukurikizwa mu byerekeye amategeko cyangwa mu by'imitungo, igihe biregwa leta ya California, ibigo byayo, amashami yayo, inzego zayo, abakorera mu biro bayo, abakozi bayo cyangwa undi muntu.

sourceString: IN WITNESS WHEREOF I have hereunto set my hand and caused the Great Seal of the State of California to be affixed this 19th day of March 2020.
targetString: BITYO nkaba mbishyizeho umukono n'Ikirangantego cya leta ya California kuri uyu wa 19 Werurwe 2020.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 virus is the cause of COVID-19 (coronavirus disease 2019), a contagious respiratory disease that was first identified in December 2019, in Wuhan, Hubei, China.
targetString: Virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ni yo itera COVID-19 (indwara ya koronavirusi yo mu 2019), ikaba ari indwara y'ubuhumekero yandura yagaragaye bwa mbere mu Ukuboza 2019, muri Wuhan, Hubei, mu Bushinwa.

sourceString: The disease is a type of coronavirus, the same family that includes SARS, MERS, and some varieties of the common cold.
targetString: Indwara ni ubwoko bwa koronavirusi, ikaba iri mu muryango umwe na SARS, MERS n'andi moko y'ibicurane.

sourceString: It was declared a pandemic by the World Health Organization (WHO) on 11 March 2020.
targetString: Ku ya 11 Werurwe 2020, ni bwo yatangajwe ko ari icyorezo n'Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye ryita ku buzima (OMS).

sourceString: While much about COVID-19 is still unknown, preliminary data suggests that it is more virulent and contagious than the seasonal flu, and less virulent but more contagious than SARS and MERS.
targetString: Mu gihe hari byinshi bitaramenyekana kuri COVID-19, amakuru y'ibanze agaragaza ko itera indwara kandi yandura cyane kurusha ibicurane biza mu gihe runaka kandi ikaba idatera indwara cyane ariko ikandura cyane kurusha SARS na MERS.

sourceString: Older people and those with underlying conditions are the most at risk of serious complications including death.
targetString: Abageze mu zabukuru n'abafite izindi ndwara ni bo bafite ibyago byinshi byo kuzahazwa na yo harimo no gupfa.

sourceString: Due to the spread of the disease, you are advised not to travel unless necessary, to avoid being infected, quarantined, or stranded by changing restrictions and cancelled flights.
targetString: Bitewe n'ukuntu iyi ndwara yandura, ugirwa inama yo kudakora ingendo zitari ngombwa, wirinda ko wakwandura, washyirwa mu kato, wahera ahantu rukana bitewe n'amabwiriza yahindutse n'ingendo z'indege zahagaritswe.

sourceString: Avoid crowded places whenever possible.
targetString: Irinde kujya ahantu hari abantu benshi igihe cyose bishoboka.

sourceString: This is not just to protect you, but also those you come in contact with.
targetString: Ntibigamije kukurinda wowe gusa, ahubwo binagamije kurinda abandi muhura.

sourceString: As it happens, you probably aren't missing much by staying home, as many attractions around the world are closing their doors to avoid spreading the disease.
targetString: Uko ibintu bimeze, birashoboka cyane ko kuguma mu rugo bitatuma hari byinshi uhomba, kuko ahantu henshi nyaburanga ku isi hafunzwe mu rwego rwo kwirinda ikwirakwira ry'indwara.

sourceString: If you do need to travel, take precautions as you would for other infections: wash your hands frequently, avoid touching your face, cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and avoid contact with sick people.
targetString: Niba ukeneye gukora ingendo, irinde kugira ngo utandura: karaba intoki kenshi, irinde kwikora mu maso, korora unitsamure ukoresheje mu mfuruka y'inkokora zawe cyangwa ukoreshe agatambaro unirinde kwegera abantu barwaye.

sourceString: Before traveling, read up on the extensive and fast-changing array of travel restrictions that have been imposed around the world.
targetString: Mbere yo gukora urugendo, soma amabwiriza yose agenda avugururwa ku ngendo yashyizweho ku isi yose.

sourceString: After travel, monitor your health and consider self-isolation for two weeks to avoid transmitting the disease to others.
targetString: Uvuye mu rugendo, genzura ubuzima bwawe kandi unatekereze kwishyira mu kato ibyumweru bibiri kugira ngo wirinde kwanduza abandi indwara.

sourceString: Transportation from long-distance passenger flights to local buses has been curtailed or completely shut down in many countries due to low demand or government orders.
targetString: Ingendo z'abagenzi bari mu ndege zijya kure bakavizamo bakajya mu mabisi zaragabanijwe cyangwa zirahagarikwa burundu mu bihugu byinshi bitewe n'uko abazikoresha babaye bake cyane cyangwa hakurikijwe amategeko ya leta.

sourceString: Many international and regional borders are closed.
targetString: Imipaka myinshi mpuzamahanga n'iyo mu karere irafunze.

sourceString: If you are away from home, and especially if you are in another country, consider returning home as soon as possible; this may get even more difficult as restrictions continue to change.
targetString: Niba utari mu rugo; by'umwihariko, niba uri mu kindi gihugu, shaka uko wasubira mu gihugu cyawe vuba bishoboka kuko bishobora kurushaho gukomera bitewe ni uko amabwiriza akomeza guhinduka.

sourceString: In some cases it may simply not be possible, even if you're healthy and meet the legal requirements for entry.
targetString: Hari aho bidashobora gushoboka, nubwo ufite ubuzima bwiza kandi wujuje ibisabwa n'amategeko kugira ngo winjire mu gihugu.

sourceString: If you can't find a way back to your country, contact your nearest embassy or consulate for assistance.
targetString: Igihe utabasha kubona uko wasubira mu gihugu cyawe, bimenyesha ambasade cyangwa konsira bikwegereye kugira ngo bigufashe.

sourceString: They may be able to organize an evacuation, identify non-regularly scheduled flights, or give you an emergency loan to pay for transport.
targetString: Bashobora gushyiraho gahunda yo gutahukana abaturage, bakaba bagushakira indege zikora ingendo zihutirwa cyangwa bakaguha inguzanyo y'ingoboka yo kwishyura urugendo.

sourceString: In case they can't, make preparations in case you need to stay where you are for an extended period.
targetString: Igihe batabishoboye, itegure mu gihe bibaye ngombwa ko uguma aho uri igihe kirekire.

sourceString: If you do find a way back home, be prepared that it may be expensive, inconvenient, and have unusual restrictions (such as no checked baggage).
targetString: Nutabona uko usubira mu rugo, itegure ko bishobora kuguhenda, kukugorakandi ukaba wanahabwa amabwiriza adasanzwe (nko kutemera imizigo itagenzuwe).

sourceString: As of early April 2020, the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 is approaching one million.
targetString: Kugeza mu ntangiriro za Mata 2020, umubare w'abemejwe ko banduye COVID-19 wenda gagusatira miriyoni imwe.

sourceString: Though the disease started in mainland China, it has spread around the world and China has fewer confirmed cases and deaths than several other countries.
targetString: Nubwo indwara yatangiriye mu Bushinwa, yakwiriye isi kandi Ubushinwa bugira umubare muto w'abemejwe ko banduye n'abapfuye kurusha mu bindi bihugu byinshi.

sourceString: Europe is the new epicenter of the pandemic.
targetString: Uburayi ni bwo bwabaye izingiro rishya ry'icyorezo.

sourceString: All but a handful of countries have reported at least one case, with the highest numbers of reported cases in the United States, Spain, Italy, Germany, France, mainland China, Iran, and the United Kingdom.
targetString: Ibindi bihugu bike na byo byatangaje ko byibuze bifite umuntu umwe wanduye, naho umubare munini w'abanduye wagaragaye muri Amerika, Esipanye, Ubutaliyani, Ubudage, Ubufaransa, Ubushinwa, Irani n'Ubwongereza.

sourceString: Local transmission is established in many countries in all major inhabited regions of the world except some Pacific island nations.
targetString: Kwanduzanya hagati y'abaturage byagiye bitangazwa mu bihugu byinshi mu bice bituwe cyane ku isi keretse bimwe mu bihugu byo mu birwa bya Pasifika.

sourceString: (See updates from the WHO.)
targetString: (Reba amakuru mashya yatangajwe na OMS.)

sourceString: The full extent of the spread is uncertain, due in part to limited testing.
targetString: Urugero virusi ishobora kwanduramo ntiruzwi bitewe ni uko gupima abantu bitaragera hose.

sourceString: Many countries are experiencing a severe shortage of test kits, and the authorities have not been able to test everybody who is at high risk, so the real number of cases is probably much higher than the official one.
targetString: Ibihugu byinshi biri guhura n'ibibazo by'ubuke bw'ibikoresho byo gupima kandi inzego z'ubuyubozi ntizabashije gupima buri muntu ufite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura, rero birashoboka cyane ko imibare nyayo y'abanduye iri hejuru kurusha itangazwa.

sourceString: Countries also differ in their testing and reporting practices, so comparisons of the number of reported cases do not tell the full story of how the epidemic has progressed in different areas.
targetString: Kandi ibihugu bitandukanye mu buryo bikoresha bipima abantu n'uburyo bitangazamo abanduye; rero kugerereranya imibare y'abanduye yatangajwe ntibigaragaza neza uko icyorezo cyagiye gikwira mu bice bitandukanye.

sourceString: The virus is transmitted through respiratory droplets and through objects.
targetString: Virusi yandura binyuze mu matembabuzi yo mu nzira z'ubuhumekero no gukora ku bintu n'ahantu byanduye.

sourceString: The coronavirus is a relatively large virus, meaning it is not truly airborne: it will settle down in respiratory droplets.
targetString: Koronavirusi ni virusi yandura cyane, nubwo itandurira neza neza mu mwuka, ariko yibera mu matembuzi yo mu nzira z'ubuhumekero.

sourceString: Staying two metres (six feet) away from other people is usually enough to prevent transmission through this route.
targetString: Kuguma muri metero ebyiri witaruye abandi bantu akenshi ni intera ihagije yo kwirinda ko wakwandura binyuze muri ayo matembabuzi.

sourceString: Transmission from objects can happen, for example, if someone sneezes, touches a doorknob, and then other people touch the doorknob and then touch their faces.
targetString: Biranashoboka ko wakwandura binyuze ku gukora ku bintu cyangwa ahantu handuye; urugero, iyo umuntu wanduye yitsamuye, akoze kuri serire y'urugi maze abandi bantu bagakora kuri ya serire y'urugi barangiza bakikora mu maso.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 virus may last on cardboard for up to 24 hours and on plastic for up to 3 days.
targetString: Virusi ya SARS-CoV-2 ishobora kumara ku ikarito igihe kigera ku masaha 24 no kuri purasitikie kugeza ku minsi 3.

sourceString: Transmission via the fecal–oral route may also be possible.
targetString: Biranashoboka ko yandura binyuze mu musarani.

sourceString: Evidence suggests that COVID-19 is contagious even without symptoms, though to what extent is still being investigated.
targetString: Ibimenyetso bigaragaza ko COVID-19 yandura uwayanduye atagaragaza ibimenyetso, nubwo ibyo bikigenzurwa.

sourceString: Common symptoms include a fever, dry cough, and fatigue.
targetString: Ibimenyetso rusange birimo umuriro, inkorora y'akayi n'umunaniro.

sourceString: Other less common symptoms include shortness of breath, a sore throat, headache, muscle pain, or sputum production.
targetString: Ibindi bimenyetso birimo kubura umwuka, kubabara mu muhugo, kuribwa umutwe, kubabara imikaya cyangwa kuzana igikororwa.

sourceString: Some patients have very mild symptoms, similar to a cold.
targetString: Abantu bamwe na bamwe bashobora kugira ibimenyetso byoroheje bisa nk'iby'ibicurane.

sourceString: Serious complications include pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, and multi-organ failure leading to disability or death.
targetString: Ibimenyetso bikomeye harimo umusonga, indwara y'ubuhumekero ikaze no kunanirwa gukora kw'ingingo nyinshi z'umubiri bituma uyirwaye amugara cyangwa agapfa.

sourceString: About 80% of infections result in mild symptoms, while the remaining may result in hospitalization.
targetString: Hafi 80% by'abanduye virusi bagaragaza ibimenyetso bidakomeye, mu gihe abasigaye bishobora kurangira bajyanwe mu bitaro.

sourceString: Case fatality rate is estimated at 1-3% of infected individuals, most of whom are elderly with underlying health conditions.
targetString: Igipimo cy'abicwa na virusi ni 1-3% by'abayanduye, aho abenshi mu bapfa biba bitewe n'izabukuru no kurwara inzindi ndwara.

sourceString: The fatality rate is much higher for those over 70 but significantly lower for those under 40.
targetString: Igipimo cy'abapfa kiri hejuru cyane ku barengeje imyaka 70 ariko kikaba kiri no hasi cyane ku batarangeje imyaka 40.

sourceString: Those most at risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications are the elderly and those with weakened immune systems or underlying health conditions like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer.
targetString: Abafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura COVID-19 n'abagira ibimenyetso bikomeye byayo baba ari abageze mu zabukuru n'abafite abasirikare b'umubiri bacitse intege cyangwa bakaba barwaye izindi ndwara nk'indwara y'umutima, diyabete, umuvuduko mwinshi w'amaraso, indwara y'ubuhumekero idakira na kanseri.

sourceString: Not many cases are reported in children and most of these are mild or moderate, though a significant fraction do get pneumonia.
targetString: Nta bwandu bukabije buvugwa mu bana kandi n'abanduye bagaragaza ibimenyetso byoroheje cyangwa bidakomeye cyane nubwo hari umubare w'abarwara umusonga.

sourceString: Occupationally, health care workers have higher risk compared to others with clusters of disease among workers and in health care settings.
targetString: Mu rwego rw'akazi, abakora mu nzego z'ubuvuzi ni bo bafite ibyago byinshi ugereranyije n'abandi bakozi banduye banakora mu nzego z'ubuzima.

sourceString: The time between being exposed to the virus and the emergence of symptoms (incubation period) is typically between 2 and 14 days, though there has been one reported case in China where symptoms appeared 27 days after exposure.
targetString: Igihe kiri hagati yo guhura na virusi no kugaragaza ibimenyetso (igihe gishira kugira ngo ibimenyetso bigaragare) akenshi ni hagati y'iminsi 2 na 14, nubwo hari uwavuzweho kwandura mu Bushinwa aho yagaragaje ibimenyetso mu minsi 27 amaze guhura na virusi.

sourceString: As of February 2020, the period of infectiousness is unknown, but is likely most significant when people are symptomatic.
targetString: Kugeza muri Gashyantare 2020, igihe cyo kwanduza virusi ntikizwi, ariko birashoboka cyane ko ari igihe abantu bagaragaje ibimenyetso.

sourceString: There is evidence of transmission from people who don't have symptoms, although to what extent is still being investigated.
targetString: Hari ibimenyetso byo kwanduza byavuye mu bantu batagaragaza ibimenyetso, nubwo bikiri kugenzurwa.

sourceString: It is unclear whether it is possible to be reinfected with the virus after recovering from it the first time around.
targetString: Ntibigaragara neza niba bishoboka ko wakongera kwandura virusi nyuma yo kuyikira bwa mbere.

sourceString: Long-term effects for people who have recovered remain unclear, but there is evidence of reduced lung capacity in some recovered patients.
targetString: Ingaruka z'igihe kirekire ku bantu bakize ntizirasobanuka neza, ariko hari ibimenyetso by'uko habaho igabanuka ry'ubushobozi bw'ibihaha ku barwayi bamwe na bamwe bakize.

sourceString: Testing for the virus usually consists of a swab inserted through the nose or a throat swab which is analysed in a laboratory for the virus.
targetString: Akenshi mu gupima virusi hifashishwa agakoresho kabugenewe kinjizwa mu izuru cyangwa mu muhugo maze ibikuwemo bigasuzumirwa muri raburatwari harebwa niba nta virusi irimo.

sourceString: The current "gold standard" test involves extracting the genetic material from the sample and analysing it for known genetic markers of the virus.
targetString: Uburyo bwo gupima bufatwa nk'"ubugenderwaho" ni ukuvana jene mu bipimo byafashwe maze igapimwa igereranywa n'ibiranga jene ya virusi.

sourceString: There is no established test assessing for the virus or antibodies in the blood, although tests are being developed.
targetString: Nta gupima mu buryo buhamye aho bapima virusi cyangwa abasirikare barwanya virusi mu maraso, nubwo ibikoresho byifashishwa gupima muri ubwo buryo biri gukorwa.

sourceString: There is no test to establish immunity to the virus.
targetString: Nta bipimo birakorwa ku buryo hakwemezwa ko hari ubudahangarwa buhari kuri iyi virusi.

sourceString: Many governments around the world have advised their citizens not to travel unnecessarily amid the pandemic.
targetString: Ibihugu byinshi ku isi byagiriye inama abaturage babyo zo kudakora ingendo zitari ngombwa mu gihe cy'icyorezo.

sourceString: Lots of airlines and package holidays are making it easy for you by waiving cancellation and change fees.
targetString: Amasosiyete y'indege menshi na gahunda z'ingendo z'ibihuruko biri korohereza abantu kuvanaho amafaranga yo guhagarikisha itike cyangwa yo kongeresha igihe cy'itike.

sourceString: Particularly avoid cruise ship travel.
targetString: By'umwihariko, irinde kugendera mu bwato butembereza ba mukerarugendo.

sourceString: Older travelers and those with underlying health conditions are most at risk and should avoid travel that puts them at risk, such as long plane flights, visits to crowded places, and especially cruises, even outside of severely affected areas.
targetString: Abageze mu zabukuru bakora ingendo n'abarwaye izindi ndwara bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura kandi bagomba kwirinda gukora ingendo zibashyira muri ibyo byago, nko gufata ingendo z'indege ndende, gusura ahantu hari abantu benshi by'umwihariko amato atembereza ba mukerarugendo no gutemberera hanze mu duce twashegeshwe na virusi.

sourceString: In affected areas, most experts recommend a practice known as social distancing.
targetString: Mu duce twashegeshwe na virusi, abenshi mu nzobere basaba ko abantu bakwirinda kwegerana.

sourceString: This means minimising contact with others by keeping a distance of six feet or two meters from them and avoiding gathering together in groups.
targetString: Bivuze ko ugomba kuguma mu ntera ya metero ebyiri utegereye abandi no kwirinda kujya mu matsinda y'abantu benshi bateranye.

sourceString: Some areas permit small groups; others prohibit all group gatherings.
targetString: Uduce tumwe na tumwe twemera ko abantu bake baterana, utundi tukabuza ko abantu uko baba bangana kose baterana.

sourceString: Measures you are encouraged to take include working from home whenever possible, avoiding crowds and avoiding leaving your home unless absolutely necessary.
targetString: Ingamba abantu basabwa gukurikiza harimo gukorera mu rugo aho bishoboka, kwirinda ahantu hari abantu benshi no kwirinda kuva mu rugo keretse igihe ari ngombwa gusa.

sourceString: If you must go out, try to stay at least 2 meters (6 feet) away from other people.
targetString: Iyo ugomba kujya hanze, ugerageza kuguma muri metero 2 akaba ari yo ntera usiga hagati yawe n'abandi bantu.

sourceString: In many places these measures are required.
targetString: Ahantu henshi ayo mabwiriza ni itegeko.

sourceString: Follow hygiene practices like for flu prevention.
targetString: Kubahiriza amabwiriza y'isuku ameze nk'ayo kwirinda ibicurane.

sourceString: Frequently wash your hands with soap and warm water, and then dry your hands on a clean towel.
targetString: Gukaraba intoki kenshi ukoresheje isabune n'amazi maze ukazihanaguza isume isa neza.

sourceString: As coronaviruses are enveloped viruses, washing your hands with soap kills the virus by disrupting the mostly fat-based viral envelope.
targetString: Mu gihe koronavirusi ari virusi iba iri mu kugara, gukaraba intoki byica virusi bikanica akugara ka virusi kagizwe n'ibisa n'amavuta.

sourceString: Effective hand washing requires rubbing your hands for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Koga neza intoki bisaba kuzikuba no kuzitsirima byibuze amasegonda 20.

sourceString: Drying your washed hands physically removes some germs from your skin (so don't skip that step, and don't share towels).
targetString: Kumutsa intoki zawe umaze gukarababikuraho udukoko ku ruhu rwaw (rero ntusibe kubikora kandi ntukoreshe isume yakoreshejwe n'abandi).

sourceString: If soap and water are not available, then use a >60% alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
targetString: Niba isabane n'amazi bidahari, koresha umuti wagenewe gusukura intoki urimo byibuze >60% by'arukoro.

sourceString: Alcohol is a quick germ-killer, but it's not quite instant, so this still requires the same 20 seconds of rubbing your hands together, making sure that every single scrap of skin gets wet, and then you have to wait about another minute, for the alcohol to completely dry.
targetString: Arukoro ni umuti wica vuba udukoko, ariko si ako kanya n'ubundi bigusaba ya masegonda 20 ukuba unatsirima intoki zawe ku zindi, ukora ku buryo usiga arukoro ku bice byose by'intoki maze ugategereza undi munota kugira ngo arukoro yiyumishe.

sourceString: Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with your hands.
targetString: Irinde gukora mu maso yawe, ku mazuru no mu kanwa ukoresheje intoki.

sourceString: Most people touch their faces every few minutes, all day long.
targetString: Abantu benshi bikora mu maso buri minota mike, umunsi wose.

sourceString: Try to do this less, and try to wash your hands before touching your face.
targetString: Gerageza kubigabanya kandi ukarabe intoki zawe mbere yo kwikora mu maso.

sourceString: Also, try to avoid touching surfaces you don't have to touch in the first place, at least with your bare hands.
targetString: Kandi unagerageza kwirinda gukora ahantu utakoze bwa mbere, nunahakora ntuhakoreshe intoki zawe ntakizitwikiriye.

sourceString: Cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and then immediately throw away the tissue and wash your hands.
targetString: Korora unitsamure ukoresheje imfuruka y'inkokora yawe cyangwa agatambaro maze uhite ujugunya ako gatambaro ahabugenewe uhite unakaraba intoki.

sourceString: Don't stand or sit near people who might be sick.
targetString: Ntuhagarare cyangwa ngo wicare iruhande rw'abantu bashobora kuba barwaye.

sourceString: Stay at least one meter – and ideally two meters (six feet) – away.
targetString: Siga byibuze intera ya metero imwe, ariko ibyiza ni metero ebyiri.

sourceString: As a quick way to eyeball this distance, imagine that you and the other person both reached your hands towards each other.
targetString: Kugira ngo ubashe kubona iyi ntera ku buryo bwihuse, ishyire mu mutwe ko wowe n'undi muntu mwembi muherezanya ibiganza.

sourceString: Could you touch the other person's hand without taking a step towards that person?
targetString: Mbese ushobora gukora ku kiganza cy'undi muntu nta ntambwe ugombye gutera umusanga?

sourceString: If the answer is yes, then you're too close.
targetString: Niba igisubizo ari yego, ubwo muregeranye cyane.

sourceString: Clean objects and surfaces that a lot of people touch, such as doorknobs, phones, and television remotes with regular household cleaner.
targetString: Sukura ibikoresho n'ahantu abantu benshi bakunda gukoraho, nka serire z'inzugi, amaterefoni, na terekomande ukoresheje umuti ukunda gusukuza mu rugo.

sourceString: Disinfect the surfaces with a suitable disinfectant, such as diluted household bleach.
targetString: Tera aho hantu umuti wabugenewe wica udukoko, nka odojaveri wafunguye.

sourceString: Stay home when you are sick, and avoid contact with other people until your symptoms are gone.
targetString: Guma mu rugo niba urwaye, kandi wirinde kubonana n'abandi bantu kugeza igihe ibimenyetso by'indwara byakugaragayeho bigendeye.

sourceString: Do not share personal items that come into contact with saliva, such as toothbrushes, eating utensils, drinks, water bottles, and towels.
targetString: Ntusangire ibikoresho byawe bwite n'abandi bantu bigira aho bihurira n'amacandwe yawe, nk'uburoso bw'amenyo, ibikoresho byo ku meza, ibinyobwa, amacumba y'amazi, n'ibitambaro byo kwihanaguza.

sourceString: The practice of serving yourself from a common plate with your own chopsticks, common in China, should be avoided.
targetString: Umuco wo kwiyarurira ubwawe n'uduti barisha ku iparato rusange, bikunze kuboneka mu Bushinwa, bigomba kwirindwa.

sourceString: Greet people without touching them.
targetString: Suhuza abantu utabakozeho.

sourceString: Avoid hugs, kisses, handshakes, fist bumps, and any other contact.
targetString: Irinde guhoberana, gusomana, guhana ibiganza, gukomanya ibipfunsi, n'ubundi buryo bwo gukoranaho.

sourceString: If it's impossible to avoid contact, then wash your hands both before and after.
targetString: Niba kwirinda gukoranaho bidashoboka, ubwo ni bwo mwembi mugomba gukaraba intoki mbere na nyuma.

sourceString: It won't protect you from the coronavirus, but it will partially protect you from the flu, which remains a greater risk than COVID-19 in many areas.
targetString: Ntibizagukingira coronavirus, ariko ku ruhande rumwe bizakurinda kwandura giripe, nayo ikomeza gushyira abantu mu kaga gakomeye kurusha COVID-19 ahantu henshi.

sourceString: This also saves you from unnecessary worry if you get the flu and think it might be the coronavirus.
targetString: Ibi kandi bigukiza guhangayika bitari ngombwa iyo ufashwe na giripe maze ugakeka ko ari coronavirus.

sourceString: If you are elderly or otherwise in a high-risk group and can be vaccinated for pneumonia, get that vaccination.
targetString: Niba usheshe akanguhe cyangwa uri mu itsinda ry'abantu bafite ibyago byinshi byo kwandura kandi ukaba ushobora gukingirwa umusonga, fata urwo rukingo.

sourceString: It won't protect you from viral pneumonia from COVID-19, but some COVID-19 patients have died of bacterial pneumonia that attacked their weakened lungs, so a pneumonia vaccination could save your life.
targetString: Ntibizagukingira virusi itera umusonga iterwa na COVID-19, ariko abarwayi bamwe ba COVID-19 bapfuye bazira bagiteri yo mu musonga yafashe impyiko zabo zacitse intege, ubwo rero urukingo rw'umusonga rwari kuba rwabatabaye.

sourceString: Wearing masks is recommended for those who are suspected of carrying of disease and those who are in close contact with those infected.
targetString: Kwambara agapfukamunwa ni inama nziza ku bantu bakekwa kuba baranduye no ku bantu begera bya hafi abantu banduye.

sourceString: For those who are asymptomatic, the WHO does not recommend masks, though some national governments do.
targetString: Ku bantu batagaragaza ibimenyetso by'indwara, Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye Ryita ku Buzima WHO ntabwo ribasaba kwambara agapfukamunwa, nubwo Leta zimwe z'ibihugu byabo zibibasaba.

sourceString: Wearing a mask of some kind is required in some countries and cities in an effort to reduce community transmission.
targetString: Ibihugu n'imigi imwe bisaba kwambara agapfukamunwa ubwoko ubwo ari bwo bwose mu gukora uko bashoboye kugira ngo bagabanye ko abaturage banduzanya hagati yabo.

sourceString: There are worldwide shortages of surgical masks.
targetString: Hari ibura ry'udupfukamunwa abaganga bambara babaga abarwayi ku rwego rw'isi.

sourceString: If you do wear a mask, make sure to use it correctly.
targetString: Niwambara agapfukamunwa, jya ugenzura neza ko ugakoresha mu buryo bukwiye.

sourceString: The mask should cover your nose and mouth and fit without gaps.
targetString: Agapfukamunwa kagomba gupfuka izuru n'umunwa byawe kandi kakagukwira ntihagire aho gasiga icyuho.

sourceString: Wash your hands before putting on the mask and avoid touching the mask while wearing it.
targetString: Karaba intoki mbere yo kwambara agapfukamunwa kandi wirinde gukora ku gapfukamunwa igihe urimo ukambara.

sourceString: If you do touch it, wash your hands immediately afterwards.
targetString: Niba ugakozeho koko, hita ukaraba intoki urangije.

sourceString: When the mask becomes damp, discard and replace it.
targetString: Mu gihe agapfukamunwa gatose, kajugunye maze ugasimbure.

sourceString: Remove it from the back, throw it away, and then wash your hands.
targetString: Gapfundurire inyuma, ugate, maze ukarabe intoki.

sourceString: Remember that masks are not a substitute for good hygiene: continue to wash your hands frequently.
targetString: Wibuke ko udupfukamunwa tudasimbura isuku iboneye: komeza uge ukaraba intoki kenshi.

sourceString: Don't stock up on masks if you don't need them.
targetString: Ntutindikire udupfukamunwa mu gihe utadukeneye.

sourceString: Mask shortages mean that healthcare workers are having trouble getting a hold of masks, which puts everyone at risk.
targetString: Ibura ry'udupfukamunwa risobanura ko abakozi bo mu buvuzi bari mu bibazo byo kubona udupfukamunwa bakoresha, ibyo bikaba byashyira mu kaga buri wese.

sourceString: That includes N95 respirators, which are not recommended for the general public – these are specialist equipment which must be fitted to be optimally effective.
targetString: Muri two harimwo inyunganizi z'ubuhumekero bita N95 respirators, rubanda rutagirwa inama yo kwambara – ibi ni ibikoresho byifashishwa n'abantu b'impuguke bigomba kuba bikwiriye nyir'ukubyambara kugira ngo bigire akamaro nyako.

sourceString: Leave them for healthcare workers.
targetString: Birekere abakozi bo mu buvuzi.

sourceString: Avoid crowded areas, especially enclosed areas without much air circulation, such as conferences, performances, shopping malls, public transportation, and religious services.
targetString: Wirinde kujya aho abantu benshi bateraniye, cyane ahantu hafunganye hatari umwuka mwinshi uhita neza, nko mu nama, ahabera imyidagaduro, amaguriro, mu modoka zitwara abagenzi, no mu nsengero.

sourceString: Events which involve a large scale gathering of people, from religious pilgrimages to music concerts, are being canceled worldwide, in an effort to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Ibikorwa bituma haba amakoraniro y'abantu benshi, guhera ku ngendo z'ahantu hatagatifu kugeza kuri konseri z'imiziki, birahagaritswe ku rwego rw'isi, mu gukora ibishoboka kugira ngo babuze virusi gukwira hose.

sourceString: Tourist attractions, businesses, and transportation may be closed, especially in affected countries.
targetString: Ahantu hakurura abakerarugendo, ibikorwa by'ubucuruzi, n'ibikorwa byo gutwara abantu n'ibintu bigomba gufungwa, hibanzwe cyane mu bihugu birimo abantu benshi banduye.

sourceString: Some canceled events, especially performances, sporting events, and classes, are being moved online, which means you can experience them without traveling.
targetString: Ibikorwa bimwe byahagaritswe, hibanzwe cyane ku myidagaduro, imikino, n'amashuri, byimukiye ku ikoranabuhanga, bisobanura ko bishobora kukugeraho nta rugendo ukoze.

sourceString: At petrol/gas stations, use gloves or wipe down the handle with a disinfectant wipe if you can.
targetString: Ku masitasiyo banywesherezaho lisansi/mazutu, ukoreshe udupfukantoki cyangwa uhanagure kimwe bafata ukoresheje umuti wica udukoko mu gihe ubishoboye.

sourceString: After filling up, clean your hands with hand sanitizer.
targetString: Nyuma yo kunywesha lisansi, karaba intoki wifashishe umuti usukura wabugenewe.

sourceString: The U.S. and Canadian governments recommend avoiding travel by cruise ship.
targetString: Guverinema ya Leta Zunze Ubumwe na Canada zigira inama abantu zo kwirinda ingendo mu bwato butembereza ba mukerarugendo.

sourceString: Infections spread easily on board, and medical care is limited.
targetString: Mu bwato indwara zikwira ku buryo bworoshye kandi uburyo bwo kubavura ntibuhagije.

sourceString: Amid a cruise ship outbreak, quarantines and docking are challenging partly due to the large number of people aboard.
targetString: Iyo icyorezo kigaragaye ubwato buri mu mazi, gushyira abantu mu kato no kwegereza ubwato umwaro bihura n'imbongamizi kubera ko ku ruhande rumwe mu bwato haba harimo abantu benshi.

sourceString: Even cruise ships without confirmed cases have been denied permission to dock due to virus fears, and in the high-profile case of the Diamond Princess in Japan, hundreds of people were infected on the ship.
targetString: N'ubwato butembereza ba mukerarugendo batasanzemo umuntu wemejwe ko yanduye bwimwe uruhushya rwo kwegerezwa umwaro bitewe n'ubwoba bafitiye virusi, kandi urugero rwamamaye mu binyamakuru ni urw'ubwato bwitwa Diamond Princess mu Buyapani, amajana y'abantu banduriye mu bwato.

sourceString: If you believe you may be infected, call a hospital or local emergency medical services instead of going in person to avoid infecting others.
targetString: Niba utekereza ko wanduye, terefona ku bitaro cyangwa serivisi zo kwa muganga zita ku ndembe zikorera hafi y'aho utuye aho kujya ubwawe kwa muganga kugira ngo wirinde kwanduza abandi.

sourceString: Mention your symptoms and travel history.
targetString: Vuga ibimenyetso ugaragaza n'aho wagiye hose.

sourceString: Wear a medical mask and follow the instructions of authorities and doctors.
targetString: Ambara agapfukamunwa kagukingira maze ukurikize amabwiriza y'abayobozi n'abaganga.

sourceString: See also: Flight and health
targetString: Reba akandi: Urugendo rwo mu ndege n'ubuzima

sourceString: On a plane, follow the same hygiene practices as anywhere else: wash hands frequently, or use alcohol-based hand sanitizer if it's not convenient to leave your seat, and avoid touching your face.
targetString: Mu ndege, kurikiza amabwiriza y'isuku nk'ahandi hose: karaba intoki kenshi, cyangwa ukoreshe umuti usukura intoki wabugenewe urimo arukoro nimba wumva ubangamiwe no guhaguruka mu ntebe wicayemo, kandi wirinde kwikora mu maso.

sourceString: Researchers have found that passengers in window seats have less risk of contact with sick people.
targetString: Abashakashatsi bavumbuyeko abagenzi bicaye mu myanya yegereye amadirishya bafite ibyago bike byo kubonana n'abantu barwaye.

sourceString: Try to book a window seat, and avoid moving around the cabin during the flight.
targetString: Gerageza gusaba ko bakubikira umwanya wegereye idirishya, kandi wirinde kugendagenda mu ndege mu gihe iri mu kirere.

sourceString: After washing your hands and before sitting down, use disinfectant wipes to wipe down the area around your seat.
targetString: Nyuma yo gukaraba intoki na mbere yo kwicara, koresha agatambaro gateye umuti kugira ngo uhanagure ahantu hakikije intebe yawe.

sourceString: Wipe hard surfaces, and if your seat is leather you can wipe that too.
targetString: Hanagura ahantu hagiye hakomera, kandi niba intebe yawe ikoze mu ruhu nayo ushobora kuyihanagura.

sourceString: Don't wipe a cloth seat, as the moisture can make transmission easier.
targetString: Ntuhanagure intebe ikoze mu mwenda, kuko uruhumbu rushobora gutuma kwandura indwara byoroha.

sourceString: When using disinfectant wipes, follow the instructions on the packaging.
targetString: Mu gihe ukoresha udutambaro duteye umuti, kurikiza amabwiriza yanditse ku gafuka dupfunyitsemo.

sourceString: And remember, viruses enter through your mouth, nose, and eyes – wiping down the area doesn't hurt, but it's not a substitute for proper hygiene.
targetString: Kandi wibuke ko, virusi zinjira ziciye mu kanwa, mu mazuru, no mu maso – guhanagura hasi ntacyo bitwara, ariko ntibisimbura isuku ikozwe mu buryo buboneye.

sourceString: Wash your hands and avoid touching your face.
targetString: Karaba intoki kandi wirinde kwikora mu maso.

sourceString: And use a tissue to touch the touch screen or other controls.
targetString: Kandi ukoreshe agatambaro k'isuku mu gukora kuri ekara ya telefoni yawe ya taci no ku yandi mabuto.

sourceString: When using the lavatory, use paper towels to turn off the faucet and open the door, then throw them away.
targetString: Mu gihe ukoresha lavabo, ifashishe udutambaro tw'isuku mu gihe ufungura robine no mu gihe ufungura umuryango, maze utujugunye.

sourceString: Airlines in affected areas are taking steps to reduce transmission and keep passengers safe.
targetString: Kompanyi z'indege zikorera mu turere twiganjemo ubwandu zirimo zirafata ibyemezo byo kugabanya ko abantu bandura iyi ndwara no kurinda umutekano w'abagenzi babo.

sourceString: For instance, these may include cleaning facilities more frequently, allowing flight attendants to wear masks, and serving prepackaged instead of freshly heated meals.
targetString: Urugero, muri ibyo harimo kugirira ibyumba by'indege isuku kenshi kurusha uko byari bisanzwe, kwemerera abakozi bo mu ndege kwambara udupfukamunwa, no guhereza abagenzi amafunguro yafunzwe mu mapaki kare aho kubaha ibiryo bikimara gushyushwa ako kanya.

sourceString: If a group of passengers is connecting from an area with a severe outbreak, the flight attendants may be able to seat them away from the rest of the passengers (and if you were recently in a high-risk area, consider telling the flight attendants for this reason).
targetString: Niba hari itsinda ry'abagenzi bafite aho bahurira n'ahantu indwara yazahaje, abakozi bo mu ndege bashobora kubicaza ukwabo kure y'abandi bagenzi (kandi niba uheruka mu gace yayogoje, reba ukuntu ubibwira abakozi bo mu ndege kubera iyi mpamvu).

sourceString: You may be prohibited from changing seats on the flight.
targetString: Ugomba kubuzwa guhindura ibyicaro mu ndege.

sourceString: This is so that, if someone on the flight turns out to be infected, the authorities can track down the people who were sitting near them for testing or quarantine.
targetString: Uko bimeze ni uko, niba umuntu uri mu ndege bigeze aho bikagaragara ko yanduye, abayobozi bagomba gushakisha abantu bose bari bicaye hafi ye kugira ngo bapimwe cyangwa bashyirwe mu kato.

sourceString: COVID-19 is treated by relieving symptoms and preventing complications.
targetString: Kuvura COVID-19 ni ukugabanya ibimenyetso bigaragara ku muntu wanduye no kumurinda ko byamuzahaza.

sourceString: There is no vaccine or specific treatment for the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Nta rukingo cyangwa umuti wihariye uvura indwara nshya ya coronavirus.

sourceString: Research into a vaccine or specific antiviral drug is underway.
targetString: Harimo harakorwa ubushakashatsi kugira ngo bayibonere urukingo cyangwa umuti wihariye uvura iyo virusi.

sourceString: There are a variety of trials using HIV medications and other novel antiviral medications for treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Hari amagerageza anyuranye akoresha imiti yifashishwa mu kuvura virusi itera sida HIV n'indi miti mishya yifashishwa mu kuvura virusi kugira ngo ibe yakwifashishwa mu kuvura COVID-19.

sourceString: Mild symptoms may be relieved by taking paracetamol (acetaminophen).
targetString: Ibimenyetso byoroheje bishobora kuvurwa na paracetamol (acetaminophen).

sourceString: If you are infected with COVID-19, countries will isolate you until several consecutive tests for COVID-19 are negative.
targetString: Niba waranduye COVID-19, mu bihugu byinshi bazagushyira ahantu hawenyine kugeza igihe bagupimye inshuro nyinshi COVID-19 bagasanga ntayo ugifite.

sourceString: If you have been in close contact with someone infected with COVID-19, many countries will quarantine you for 14 days since the last exposure and monitor you for signs and symptoms.
targetString: Niba warabonanye bya hafi n'umuntu wanduye COVID-19, mu bihugu byinshi bazagushyira mu kato mu gihe k'iminsi 14 babaze kuva igihe wahuriye n'umuntu wayanduye maze bagenzure ibimenyetso ugaragaza.

sourceString: Some countries will also test you even if you don't have symptoms.
targetString: Mu bihugu bimwe na bimwe ndetse baragupima kabone n'iyo waba utagaragaza ibimenyetso.

sourceString: In many countries, the healthcare system has been stretched to the point of not being able to handle the sheer number of patients, and there is a chance you may be refused treatment due to the lack of available medical staff, supplies or equipment.
targetString: Mu bihugu byinshi, sisitemu z'ubuvuzi zarisuganyije kugeza ubwo zitabasha kwakira umubare munini w'abarwayi, kandi hari ubwo utashobora kuvurwa bitewe no kubura abaganga, ibintu bikenewe by'ingenzi cyangwa ibikoresho.

sourceString: Many countries have shut down or severely limited flights, ships, and border crossings, especially to and from affected areas.
targetString: Ibihugu byinshi byahagaritse ingendo z'indege, iz'amato cyangwa izambukiranya imipaka cyangwa byarazigabanyije cyane, hibanzwe cyane ku ingendo ziva cyangwa zijya mu turere iyo ndwara yibasiye.

sourceString: Even more countries have imposed restrictions on arriving travelers, either barring entry (maybe with an exception for local citizens and permanent residents) or requiring you to be quarantined, typically for 14 days.
targetString: Ndetse ibihugu byinshi byashyizeho amategeko akumira abagenzi binjira, kwaba ari ukwanga ko binjira (birashoboka ko bemerera gusa abaturage babo bataha n'abanyamahanga bafite uruhushya rwo gutura burundu) cyangwa bakagusaba kujya mu kato, kemewe k'iminsi 14.

sourceString: Even if a mandatory quarantine is not imposed, you may be asked to "self-quarantine" by staying at home and not interacting with other people.
targetString: Ndetse n'iyo udashyizwe mu kato gategetswe, ushobora gusabwa "kwishyira mu kato" ukaguma imuhira kandi ntugire abandi bantu muhura.

sourceString: The most severe restrictions are on travellers who have recently been to affected areas, but increasingly many countries are applying them to incoming travellers overall.
targetString: Amategeko akaze y'ikumira yashyizwe ku bagenzi baheruka mu turere iyo ndwara yibasiye, ariko mu buryo bugenda bwiyongera ibihugu byinshi bashyira ayo mategeko ku bagenzi binjira muri rusange.

sourceString: Some countries have even prohibited all or almost all foreigners from entry or limited the ability of local citizens and residents to leave.
targetString: Ibihugu bimwe na bimwe ndetse byabujije abanyamahanga bose cyangwa hafi ya bose kwinjira cyangwa bikangira cyangwa bikagabanya abaturage babyo cyangwa abahatuye gusohoka.

sourceString: What are the affected areas?
targetString: Ni utuhe turere twibasiwe n'iyo ndwara?

sourceString: Well, this is a fast-changing situation, and each country/region/organization has its own list of what areas are subject to restrictions.
targetString: Nibyo, ibi ni ibihe bihindagurika vuba, kandi buri gihugu/buri karere/buri muryango gafite urutonde rwako rw'uturere tugomba gukumirwa.

sourceString: The city of Wuhan is on every list and the rest of mainland China is on most.
targetString: Umugi wa Wuhan uri kuri buri rutonde kimwe n'ahasigaye ku butaka bw'Ubushinwa bwo ku mugabane biri henshi.

sourceString: Other areas that are often included: France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, the United States, the Schengen Area as a whole, and sometimes various others.
targetString: Utundi turere dushyirwaho: Ubufaransa, Ubudage, Hong Kong, Irani, Ubutariyani, Ubuyapani, Macau, Singapore, Koreya y'Amagepfo, Esipanye, Tayiwani, Ubwongereza, Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika, Akarere ka Schengen muri rusange, hamwe n'utundi turere dutandukanye.

sourceString: Some countries have imposed restrictions based on citizenship or residency from severely affected areas.
targetString: Ibihugu bimwe na bimwe byashyizeho amategeko akumira ashingiye ku bwenegihugu cyangwa ku ruhushya rwo gutura ku bantu baturutse mu turere twibasiwe cyane n'iyo ndwara.

sourceString: A detailed list of entry restrictions is maintained by the IATA.
targetString: Urutonde rurambuye rwo gukumira abinjira rufitwe na Sosiyete ishinzwe iby'ubwikorezi bw'indege IATA.

sourceString: It doesn't cover all the restrictions, but it's still useful.

sourceString: For travel in the near future, consider making refundable reservations in case the changing situation forces you to change your plans.

sourceString: Flights may get canceled with little notice, either due to the disease's spread and ever-changing entry restrictions, or simply because fewer people are flying and airlines are having trouble filling seats.

sourceString: You might also be delayed for hours upon arrival waiting for temperature checks and related procedures and paperwork, or even get quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Ushobora kandi gukererezwa ugeze ku kibuga utegereje ko bagufata ibipimo by'umuriro uhinda n'ibindi bikorwa bifitanye isano kimwe n'ibyangombwa, cyangwa ndetse ukaba washyirwa mu kato k'ibyumweru bibiri.

sourceString: Be prepared for the possibility of disruption to your travel plans, especially if traveling internationally.

sourceString: Even if you're nowhere near affected areas there's a risk that you'll have to stay at the destination longer than planned if you've shared a building or vessel with an infected person.

sourceString: Some countries and regions, especially severely affected ones, are implementing emergency lockdowns and restrictions on people's movements and activities, even for those who haven't recently been abroad.

sourceString: These include the temporary reintroduction of some border controls, restrictions on travel within the country, closing or limiting service at restaurants and other establishments, banning large public events, and in the most severe cases prohibiting people from leaving the house except for essential reasons.

sourceString: The borders between Canada, the U.S., and Mexico are closed to non-essential travel, and in many areas bans on big gatherings are in effect (this means places like restaurants are closed, and events are canceled).
targetString: Imipaka hagati ya Canada, Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika, na Megizike irafunze ku ngendo zidakenewe cyane, kandi mu turere twinshi amategeko abuza abantu benshi gukoranira hamwe arubahirizwa (ibi bisobanura ko amazu nk'amaresitora afunze, kandi n'ibirori byagombaga kuba byahagaritswe).

sourceString: Numerous state, county, and municipal jurisdictions have issued stay-at-home orders that require all nonessential businesses to close.
targetString: Ubuyobozi muri Leta nyinshi, mu ntara, no mu makomini bwatanze amategeko yo kuguma mu rugo asaba ko ibikorwa by'ubucuruzi bidakenewe cyane bifunga.

sourceString: With lots of flights canceled, warnings issued, and restrictions imposed, flying in the time of coronavirus can be a challenge.
targetString: Hamwe n'ingendo z'indege nyinshi zarahagaritswe, amatangazo aburira abantu yarasohowe, n'amategeko akumira abantu ashyirwaho, gukora urugendo mu ndege mu gihe cya coronavirus bishobora kuba ingorabahizi.

sourceString: Some routes are not possible.
targetString: Inzira zimwe na zimwe ntizishoboka.

sourceString: Others will require more inconvenient connections than usual—multiple stops and long waits between flights.
targetString: Abandi biyambaza inzira zibagora kurusha uko bisanzwe—guhagararara ahantu henshi no gutegereza igihe kirekire hagati y'indege n'indi.

sourceString: In some cases that means more expensive tickets.
targetString: Hamwe na hamwe ibi bisobanura tike zihenze cyane.

sourceString: On the other hand, the good news is that many flights are cheaper than usual due to decreased demand, and there's a decent chance you'll get an empty seat next to you.
targetString: Ku rundi ruhande, inkuru nziza ni uko ingendo nyinshi z'indege zihendutse kuruta uko bisanzwe bitewe n'bagenzi bagabanutse, kandi hari amahirwe meza ko umwanya uba ukwegereye nta muntu uzaba uwicayemo.

sourceString: Build in extra time for your connections, especially if transferring from an international flight to a domestic flight and especially if your itinerary involves a country that's seriously affected.
targetString: Renzaho ku gihe ku cyo wateganyaga uzamara aho unyura, cyane iyo ugomba guhinduranya indege uva mu ndege ikora ingendo hagati y'ibihugu ujya mu ndege ikora ingendo hagati mu gihugu cyane iyo inzira wanyuzemo harimo igihugu kibasiwe n'iyo ndwara ku buryo bukabije.

sourceString: Screenings, temperature checks, extra paperwork, and the associated waiting around can add minutes or hours before you're allowed to continue on your journey.
targetString: Gusuzuma, gupima umuriro, ibyangombwa by'inyongera, n'igihe cyo gutegura gishamikiyeho bishobora gutuma iminota cyangwa amasaha byiyongera mbere y'uko wemererwa gukomeza urugendo rwawe.

sourceString: You may find it harder than usual to buy a ticket to or from a destination subject to warnings and restrictions.
targetString: Ushobora kubona ko kugura tike bikomeye kurusha uko bisanzwe ugana iyo ujya cyangwa utaha bitewe n'amabwiriza aburira abantu cyangwa abakumira.

sourceString: This is a real concern if you're trying to get out of an affected area.
targetString: Ibi biteye impungenge nyazo niba urimo ugerageza gusohoka mu karere kibasiwe n'iyo ndwara.

sourceString: For instance, most aggregators are not selling tickets from China to the United States (presumably to avoid falling afoul of restrictions and being on the hook for a passenger's flight out).
targetString: Urugero, abenshi mu bemerewe gucuruza amatike ntibacuruza amatike ku mugenzi uva mu Bushinwa yerekeza muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika (nta gushidikanya ni ukugira ngo birinde kugongwa n'amategeko akumira maze bagashoberwa mu gihe hagize indege ihagarikwa kugenda kandi umugenzi yaguze itike).

sourceString: To buy a ticket for an itinerary like this, you may have to contact the airline or use a lesser-known aggregator.
targetString: Kugura tike ugana mu kerekezo nk'iki, ugomba kubanza kuvugana na sosiyete y'indege cyangwa ukifashisha umucuruzi wemerewe gucuruza amatike utazwi cyane.

sourceString: Another possibility is to buy two separate tickets (for instance, a ticket from China to Cambodia and a second ticket from Cambodia to the U.S.), but be careful you won't get quarantined or lose your luggage in between.
targetString: Ubundi buryo bushoboka ni ukugura amatike atandukanye (urugero, itike yo kuva mu Bushinwa kugera muri Kamboji n'itike ya kabiri kuva muri Kamboji kugera muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika), ariko witonde ku buryo udashyirwa mu kato cyangwa ngo imizigo yawe ibure hagati y'izo ngendo.

sourceString: Connecting flights can be a problem.
targetString: Guhinduranya indege bishobora kuba ikibazo.

sourceString: The risk of getting stuck in the connection city is higher than usual right now, due to delays for screening and testing as well as extensive cancellations.
targetString: Ibyago byo kuba ubu wahagama mu mugi uhinduriramo indege biriyongera kurusha uko byari bisanzwe, kubera gutegereza gusuzumwa no kwipimisha no guhagarikwa kw'ingendo mu buryo bwagutse.

sourceString: Connecting in an affected area may lead to entry restrictions later on, and if you've been in an affected area recently some countries won't even let you change planes.
targetString: Guhinduranya indege mu karere kibasiwe n'indwara bishobora gutuma nyuma y'aho urebwa n'amategeko y'ikumira, kandi niba uheruka mu karere kibasiwe n'iyo ndwara ndetse mu bihugu bimwe na bimwe ntibazakwemerera guhindura indege.

sourceString: On certain itineraries there is a risk of getting quarantined somewhere along the way.
targetString: Mu byerekezo bimwe na bimwe uganamo hari ibyago byo gushyirwa mu kato ukiri mu nzira.

sourceString: So book a direct flight if you can, and if not, think carefully about where to connect.
targetString: Bityo rero saba ko bakubikira tike y'indege ikugeza iyo ujya itagize ahandi ica, na none bidakunze, tekereza witonze ku hantu uhindurira indege.

sourceString: In uncertain times, plans can change.
targetString: Mu bihe by'urujijo, gahunda zishobora guhinduka.

sourceString: Many embassies and consulates have evacuated nonessential staff, and some have shut down operations completely.
targetString: Ambasade na Konsila nyinshi byamaze gucyura abakozi badakenewe cyane, kandi zimwe na zimwe zahagaritse ibikorwa byazo ku buryo nta na kiimwe gikora.

sourceString: Emergency assistance should still be available, though it's possible you may have to contact a further-away consulate if your local one has shut down.
targetString: Ubufasha bwihutirwa bushobora gukomeza kuboneka, nubwo ugomba kuvugana na konsila ya kure mu gihe ikwegereye yaba yarafunze.

sourceString: If you have been stranded due to the pandemic, your nearest consulate may be able to help you find a flight home, arrange an emergency loan so you can buy a ticket, or provide an emergency passport.
targetString: Niba waraheze aho uri ukananirwa kuhava bitewe n'iki cyorezo, konsila ikwegereye ishobora kugufasha kubona indege igutahana, kumvikana ku buryo yagushakira inguzanyo yihuse kugira ngo ubashe kugura tike, cyangwa ikaguha pasiporo mu buryo bwihuse.

sourceString: At the very least they can keep you informed about the local situation and notify you about recently introduced travel requirements and restrictions.
targetString: Ikintu cyoroshye bashobora kugukorera bashobora gukomeza kuguha amakuru yerekeranye n'uko ibintu byifashe aho uri kandi bakakumenyesha ibisabwa birebana no gukora ingendo biheruka gushyirwaho hamwe n'amategeko mashya arebana n'ikumirwa.

sourceString: Ordinary consular services such as visa and passport processing may be suspended or restricted to urgent need, depending on the location and the consulate.
targetString: Serivisi zisanzwe za Konsila nko kwaka viza gusaba pasiporo bishobora guhagarikwa cyangwa bigaharirwa gusa ikintu kihutirwa gikenewe bitewe n'aho uri na konsila.

sourceString: Although some people call the disease "Wuhan pneumonia" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Wuhan disease", or "Chinese virus", the use of these terms is considered racist in China and by many people of Chinese origin.
targetString: N'ubwo bamwe bita iki cyorezo "Umusonga wa Wuhan" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Icyorezo cya Wuhan", cyangwa "Virusi Nshinwa", ikoreshwa ry'aya magambo rifatwa nk'ivanguramoko mu Bushinwa no mu bantu benshi bafite inkomoko mu Bushinwa.

sourceString: It is still common to refer the disease as "Wuhan pneumonia" or "Chinese virus" in places like Hong Kong and Taiwan.
targetString: Bikunze kubaho kwita iyi ndwara "umusonga wa Wuhan " cyangwa "virusi Nshinwa" mu turere nka Hong Kong na Taiwan.

sourceString: To be safe, use location-neutral terms when referring to the disease, such as "COVID-19", "novel coronavirus", or just "the virus" or "the pandemic".
targetString: Kugira ngo utekane, koresha amagambo atagira ahantu wiitirira iyi ndwara mu gihe ushaka gukomoza kuri cyorezo, nka "COVID-19", "indwara nshya ya coronavirus", cyangwa gusa "virusi" cyangwa "icyorezo".

sourceString: Particularly in developing countries where law enforcement are poorly trained, enforcement of curfew, lockdown or stay-at-home orders are often brutal, often using forces not proportionate against crowds.
targetString: Ku buryo bwihariye mu bihugu biri mu nzira y'amajyambere aho kubahiriza amategeko bitozwa ku buryo budahagije, abashinzwe kugenzura ko amasaha y'umukwabu, kudatembera cyangwa kuguma mu rugo byubahirizwa akenshi bahutaza abaturage, bagakoresha kenshi ingufu z'umurengera ku baturage.

sourceString: Comply with these orders, and avoid crowds in public.
targetString: Gukurikiza aya mategeko, no kwirinda aho abantu benshi bateranira.

sourceString: As a result of the coronavirus pandemic, xenophobia has risen in many countries, primarily but not exclusively targeting people perceived to be Chinese.
targetString: Bitewe n'icyorezo cya coronavirus, gutinya abanyamahanga no kubanga byarabyutse, ubwa mbere harebwaga abantu bafatwa nk'abashinwa ariko si bo bonyine.

sourceString: There has been a worldwide spike in racist incidents targeting people of East Asian origin, including in major cities such as New York, London and San Francisco.
targetString: Ibikorwa by'ivanguramoko byarazamutse ku rwego rw'isi biboneza ku baturage bafite inkomoko muri Aziya y'Iburasirazuba, harimo no mu migi minini nka New York, Londoni na San Francisco.

sourceString: In Hong Kong, Sinophobia, which was already high to begin with, has intensified as a result of the pandemic, with the result that many shops and restaurants are now denying service to mainland Chinese customers and banning Mandarin speakers from their premises (with the exception of Taiwanese).
targetString: Muri Hong Kong, gutinya no kwanga abashinwa, n'ubundi byari bisanzwe biri ku rwego rwo hejuru,byariyongereye bitewe n'iki cyorezo, icyo bitanga ni uko amaduka menshi n'amaresitora ubu yanga guha serivisi abakiriya b'abashinwa bafite inkomoko ku mugabane kandi bagaca abavuga ikirimi k'IkiMandarin aho bakorera (bagasonera gusa abaTaiwanese).

sourceString: Levels of xenophobia have also risen in East Asia, with some restaurants and other businesses in Japan and China refusing service to foreign customers.
targetString: Inzego zo gutinya no kwanga abanyamahanga zarazamutse no muri Aziya y'Iburasirazuba, aho amaresitora amwe n'amwe n'abandi bacuruzi mu Buyapani no mu Bushinwa bangaga guha serivisi abakiriya b'abanyamahanga.

sourceString: In China, there have been incidents of foreigners being refused rooms by hotel staff, and foreign residents, particularly black people, being kicked out of their apartments on short notice by their landlords.
targetString: Mu Bushinwa, habaye amahano yo kwanga guha abanyamahanga ibyumba byo kuraramo bikorwa n'abakozi ba hoteli, kandi n'abanyamahanga bahatuye, by'umwihariko abirabura, basohorwa mu mazu bakodeshaga na ba nyirayo babahaye integuza y'igihe kigufi cyane.

sourceString: A variety of misinformation and conspiracy theories about the virus are being promoted online and even by some government officials, so be careful which sources you check for information.
targetString: Hari amakuru menshi atari yo n'andi asobanura nabi virusi arimo yamamazwa kuri enterinete ndetse n'abayobozi bamwe na bamwe ba za Leta, bityo rero ugomba kwitondera isoko uvomamo amakuru.

sourceString: Ensure that all information and advice you receive has been backed by reputable doctors and scientists.
targetString: Reba neza ko amakuru yose wakira n'inama uhabwa byashyigikiwe n'abaganga n'abahanga muri siyansi bizewe.

sourceString: In a crisis, it's natural to want to keep following the latest updates, but it may be better for your mental health to moderate the amount of news that you look at, and stick to reliable news sources.
targetString: Mu gihe akaga kateye, gushaka gukurikira amakuru mashya agezweho biri muri kamere muntu, ariko ni byiza kugira ngo udahungabana mu mutwe kugabanya ingano y'amakuru ureba, kandi ukomere ku makuru afite inkomoko yizewe.

sourceString: If you normally watch the news twice per day then stick to this schedule and do something else, rather than having the 24-hour news on continuously.
