targetString: Coronavirus b'Bat yo mu bwoko bwa SARS- WIV1(Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), rimwe na rimwe kandi bita coronavirus yo mu bwoko bwa SARS WIV1, ni isoko y'Indwara y'igikatu ifata inzira z'ubuhumekero ifite aho ihurira na coronavirus (SARSr-CoV) yabonetse mu ducurama tw'ikigina tuboneka mu Bushinwa (Rhinolophus sinicus).

sourceString: Like all coronaviruses, virions consist of single-stranded positive-sense RNA enclosed within an envelope.
targetString: Kimwe na coronaviruses zose, virusi isohotse mu ngirabuzima igirwa na RNA igana mu kerekezo kijya imbere ifungiranye mu gafubiko.

sourceString: The discovery confirms that bats are the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Amakuru yavumbuwe yemeje ko uducurama ari indiri kamere ya SARS-CoV.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis shows the possibility of direct transmission of SARS from bats to humans without the intermediary Chinese civets, as previously believed.
targetString: Ubusesenguzi bugaragaza inkomoko bwerekana ko bishoboka kwandura mu buryo butaziguye SARS ivuye mu ducurama ikinjira mu bantu zitanyuze mu tunyamaswa dusa n'imishushwe bita civet abashinwa barya, nk'uko abantu babanje kubikeka mbere.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 drug development is the research process to develop a preventative vaccine or therapeutic prescription drug that would alleviate the severity of 2019-20 coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: gukora umuti wa b'COVID-19 ni ubushakashatsi bugamije kuvumbura urukingo cyangwa umuti ugabanya ubukana bw'icyorezo cya Koronavirusi (COVID-19).

sourceString: The International Clinical Trials Registry Platform of the WHO recorded 536 clinical studies to develop post-infection therapies for COVID-19 infections, with numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections under clinical research to be repurposed.
targetString: Ikigo gishinzwe ibijyanye n'igerageza ry'imiti ryashyizweho na WHO cyabaruye inyigo z'imiti zigera kuri 536 mu rwego rwo gukora umuti ushobora guhangana n'ingaruka za COVID-19, ugizwe n'uruvangitirane rw'indi miti isanzwe ivura izindi ndwara ziterwa na virusi kugira barebe ko yakwifashishwa mu guhangana n'iki cyorezo .

sourceString: In March, the WHO initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" in 10 countries, enrolling thousands of people infected with COVID-19 to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: Muri Werurwe, WHO yatangije icyo yise “ SOLIDARITY Tial” mu bihugu 10, aho yabaruye ibihumbi by'abantu barwaye COVID-19 kugira ngo bageragerezweho imiti ine isanzwe ikoreshwa mu kuvura indwara ziterwa na virusi kugira ngo harebwe niba hari uwashobora guhangana n'iki cyorezo.

sourceString: A dynamic, systematic review was established in April 2020 to track the progress of registered clinical trials for COVID-19 vaccine and therapeutic drug candidates.Vaccine and drug development is a multistep process, typically requiring more than five years to assure safety and efficacy of the new compound.
targetString: Muri Mata 2020 hashyizweho uburyo bwizewe kandi bwitondewe bwo kureba aho igerageza ryabaruwe ry'urukingo rwa COVID-19n'umuti ushobora guhangana nayo rigeze. Gukora urukingo n'umuti ni igikorwa kinyura mu nzira nyinshi, by'umwihariko gitwara imyaka irenze itanu kugira ngo hemezwe neza niba koko uwo muti mushya wujuje ubuziranenge kandi wizewe.

sourceString: Drug development is the process of bringing a new infectious disease vaccine or therapeutic drug to the market once a lead compound has been identified through the process of drug discovery.
targetString: Gukora umuti ni igikorwa gisaba ko urukingo ku bwandu bushya bw'icyorezo cyangwa umuti bigera ku isoko ari uko koko amahame yose agenga ubushakashatsi ku miti yubahirijwe nta rimwe rivuyemo.

sourceString: It includes laboratory research on microorganisms and animals, filing for regulatory status, such as via the FDA, for an investigational new drug to initiate clinical trials on humans, and may include the step of obtaining regulatory approval with a new drug application to market the drug.
targetString: Muri ibyo birebwa harimo kuba harakozwe ubushakashatsi muri laboratwari bukorewe ku binyabuzima bito no ku nyamaswa, kuzuza ibisabwa, urugero byagenzuwe n'ikigo gishinzwe ubuziranenge bw'ibiribwa n'imiti (FDA), kugeragereza uwo muti ku bantu, kandi uwo muti mushya ugomba kuba ufite uruhushya ruwemerera kujya ku isoko.

sourceString: Development of a COVID-19 vaccine or therapeutic antiviral drug begins with matching a chemical concept to the potential prophylactic mechanism of the future vaccine or antiviral activity in vivo.
targetString: Igikorwa cyo gukora urukingo rwa COVID-19 cyangwa umuti urwanya virusi bihera ku guhuza ibinyabutabire n'ibindi bintu bateganya gukuramo urukingo rushya cyangwa ibindi bintu birwanya virusi biba mu binyabuzima.

sourceString: New chemical entities (NCEs, also known as new molecular entities or NMEs) are compounds that emerge from the process of drug discovery to specify a vaccine or antiviral candidate.
targetString: Ibinyabutabire Bishya (NCEs, bizwi nka NMEs) ni urukomatane rw'imiti rurimo gukorwaho ubushakashatsi kugira ngo hakurwemo ibizavamo urukingo cg umuti wa virusi.

sourceString: These have promising activity against a biological target related to COVID-19 disease.
targetString: Ibi biratanga ikizere mu gikorwa cyo guhangana n'icyorezo cya COVID -19.

sourceString: At the beginning of vaccine or drug development, little is known about the safety, toxicity, pharmacokinetics, and metabolism of the NCE in humans.
targetString: Iyo ibikorwa byo gukora urukingo cyangwa umuti, nta makuru menshi abantu baba bafite agaragaza ingaruka zawo, uburozi buwurimo, n'uko bimera iyo ugeze mu mubiri w'umuntu.

sourceString: It is the function and obligation of drug development to assess all of these parameters prior to human clinical trials to prove safety and efficacy.
targetString: Ni akazi kandi ni n'inshingano z'abakora imiti kugenzura koi bi byose byakurijwe mbere y'uko umuti ugeragerezwa ku bantu ku gira ngo hemezwe niba ufite ubuziranenge kandi wizewe.

sourceString: A further major objective of drug development is to recommend the dose and schedule for the first use in a human clinical trial ("first-in-human" [FIH] or First Human Dose [FHD], previously also known as "first-in-man" [FIM]).
targetString: Indi ntego yo gukora umuti ni ukwerekana ingano y'ugomba gufatwa no gutangaza igihe uzatangira kugeragerezwa bwa mbere ku bantu ("first-in-human" [FIH] or First Human Dose [FHD], bimenyerewe ku izina rya "first-in-man" [FIM]).

sourceString: In addition, drug development must establish the physicochemical properties of the NCE: its chemical makeup, stability, and solubility.
targetString: Ikindi kiyongeraho, abakora imiti gushyiraho ibintu bigize uwo muti bya NCE: ibinyabutabire biwugize, imihindagurikire yawo ndetse n'uko bigenda iyo uvanzwe n'ibindi bintu.

sourceString: Manufacturers must optimize the process they use to make the chemical so they can scale up from a medicinal chemist producing milligrams, to manufacturing on the kilogram and ton scale.
targetString: Abafite inganda zikora imiti bagomba gukurikiza amabwiriza yose uko yakabaye mu gukora umuti ku buryo bashobora gutangirira ku ma miligarama kugeza kuri rwego rwo gukora kilogarama na za toni z'imiti.

sourceString: They further examine the product for suitability to package as capsules, tablets, aerosol, intramuscular injectable, subcutaneous injectable, or intravenous formulations.
targetString: Hanyuma bagenzura uburyo umuti ushobora gufunikwa nk'ibinini, mu buryo bwo guterwa mu mitsi, guhumekwa, guterwa mu buryo butandukanye bw'inshinge, cyangwa gukoreshwa binyuze mu maraso.

sourceString: Together, these processes are known in preclinical and clinical development as chemistry, manufacturing, and control (CMC).Many aspects of drug development focus on satisfying the regulatory requirements of drug licensing authorities.
targetString: ibi byose hamwe, ni uburyo buzwi mu rwego rwa mbere na nyuma y'ikorwa ry'umuti nko guhitamo ibinyabutabire bikenewe, kubijyana mu ruganda n'isuzuma (CMC). Ibyinshi mu bigize ikorwa ry'umuti byibanda ku gukurikiza amategeko n'amabwiriza atangwa n'inzego zishinzwe kwemeza imiti.

sourceString: These generally constitute tests designed to determine the major toxicities of a novel compound prior to first use in humans.
targetString: Ibi byose bigizwe n'ibipimo bigomba gukorwa mu rwego rwo kwerekana ingaruka umuti mushya wagira mbere yo kuwukoresha bwa mbere ku bantu .

sourceString: The Canadian government announced CA$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian universities, with plans to establish a "vaccine bank" of new vaccines for implementation if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Guverinoma ya Canada yatangaje ko yageneye miliyoni CA$275 agenewe imishinga 96 y'ubushakashatsi mu rwego rwo guhangana na COVID-19, harimo abantu batandukanye barimo gukora ku rukingo muri kaminuza za Canada, hagamijwe gushyiraho icyo bise “ vaccine bank” y'inkingo nshya mu rwego rwo kuzayikoresha igihe haba havutse ikindi cyorezo cya Koronavirusi.

sourceString: Clinical trial programs involve three, multiple-year stages toward product approval, and a fourth, post-approval stage for ongoing safety monitoring of the vaccine or drug therapy:
targetString: Gahunda zo kugerageza urukingo zikorwa mu byiciro bitatu harimo imyaka myinshi yo kwiga ku muti kugeza wemejwe, hanyuma icya kane kikaba gukurikirana imikorere y'umuti nyuma y'uko wemejwe hagamijwe kwiga ku ngaruka z'urukingo cg gukurikirana ubushobozi bw'umuti mu kuvura:

sourceString: Phase I trials, usually in healthy volunteers, determine safety and dosing.
targetString: Ikiciro cya I k'igerageza , ubusanzwe rikorerwa ku bakorerabushake mu buvuzi, kigaragaza ingaruka n'ingano y'umuti umuntu akwiye gufata

sourceString: Phase II trials are used to establish an initial reading of efficacy and further explore safety in small numbers of people having the disease targeted by the NCE.
targetString: Ikiciro cya II k'igerageza gikoreshwa mu kugaragaza iby'ibanze bigaragaza ubushobozi bw'umuti mu kuvura hanyuma hakarebwa ingarua zawo bikorewe ku mubare w'abantu bake bafite ubwandu burimo kwitabwaho na NCE.

sourceString: Phase III trials are large, pivotal trials to determine safety and efficacy in sufficiently large numbers of people with the COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Icyiciro cya III cy'igerageza kiragutse, gifite ibintu runaka kiba kigambiriye kureba mu rwego rwo kugena ingaruka n' ubushobi n'umuti, igerageza rigakorerwa ku mubare uhagije w'abantu bafite ubwandu bwa COVID-19.

sourceString: If safety and efficacy are adequately proved, clinical testing may stop at this step and the NCE advances to the new drug application (NDA) stage to begin marketing.
targetString: Iyo bigaragaye ko umuti ufite ubushobozi kandi wizewe, igerageza ry'umuti rishobora guhagarikwa kuri uru rwego hanyuma NCE igakurikizaho ikiciro gishya cyo gukoresha umuti (NDA) mu rwego rwo gutangira kuwugeza ku isoko.

sourceString: Phase IV trials are post-approval trials that may be a condition attached by the FDA, also called post-market surveillance studies.
targetString: Ikiciro cya IV kiza nyuma y'igeragezwa rya nyuma yo kwemeza umuti aho FDA ishobora gushyiraho ibisabwa, bizwi ku izina rya'inyigo ku bugenzuzi bwa nyuma yo gushyira umuti ku isoko.

sourceString: In addition to the tests required to move a novel vaccine or antiviral drug into the clinic for the first time, manufacturers must ensure that any long-term or chronic toxicities are well-defined, including effects on systems not previously monitored (fertility, reproduction, immune system, among others).
targetString: Uretse umubare w'igerageza usabwa kugira ngo urukingo rushya cyangwa umuti uvura virusi bijyanwe mu ivuriro kugira ngo utangire gukoreshwa, abafite inganda rikora imiti nib nta ngaruka z'igihe kirekire cyangwa karande zishobora kubaho, harimo nk'ingaruka ushibora kugira mu mikorere y'umubiri w'umuntu ( uburumbuke, kubyara, ubwirinzi bw'umubiri, n'ibindi).

sourceString: In the United States, this process is called a "new drug application" or NDA.
targetString: Muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika, ubu buryo bwitwa “ Ikoreshwa ry'umuti mushya” cyangwa NDA mu mpine y'icyongereza.

sourceString: A clinical trial design in progress may be modified as an "adaptive design" if accumulating data in the trial provide early insights about positive or negative efficacy of the treatment.
targetString: Uburyo igeragezwa ry'umuti ririmo gukorwa bushobora guhinduka “bugashingira ku bihari” mu gihe amakuru yavuye mu igerageza agaragaza ibindi bintu bishya byiza cyangwa bibi bijyanye n'ubushobozi bw'uwo muti mu kuvura.

sourceString: The global Solidarity and European Discovery trials of hospitalized people with severe COVID-19 infection apply adaptive design to rapidly alter trial parameters as results from the four experimental therapeutic strategies emerge.
targetString: Igeragezwa ryakozwe n'amatsinda ahuriweho ku isi yose ndetse n'Ibigo by' I Burayi bishinzwe ubushakashati ku barwayi bafite ibibazo bikomeye by'uburwayi bwa COVID-19 rikoresha uburyo bushobora guhindurwa hashingiye ku makuru ahari mu rwego rwo guhindura uko igerageza rikorwamo bijyanye n'ingamba enye zo gukora ubushakashatsi ku miti .

sourceString: Adaptive designs within ongoing Phase II-III clinical trials on candidate therapeutics may shorten trial durations and use fewer subjects, possibly expediting decisions for early termination or success, and coordinating design changes for a specific trial across its international locations.
targetString: Uburyo bushobora guhinduka bitewe n'ibihari burimo gukoreshwa mu byiciro bya II-III bijyanye n'imiti iri mu igeragezwa bugomba kugabanya igihe igeragezwa rigomba kumara no gukoresha ibintu bike, hakaba hanafatwa ibyemoze byo kurihagarika imburagihe cyangwa kubona ibisubizo byiza mu gihe cya vuba, no guhuza ibikorwa bijyanye n'impinduka z'ubwo huryo hagamijwe gukora igeragezwa runaka mu bice byose bigize isi.

sourceString: Most novel drug candidates (NCEs) fail during drug development, either because they have unacceptable toxicity or because they simply do not prove efficacy on the targeted disease, as shown in Phase II-III clinical trials.
targetString: Imiti myinshi iri mu igeragezwa (NCEs) ipfira mu gihe cyo kuyikora, bitewe wenda no kuba ifite ingaruka zitakwihanganirwa cyangwa se bigaragara ko nta bushobozi bwo kuvura icyorezo buhari , nk‘uko bivugwa mu byiciro bya II-III by'igeragezwa ry'imiti.

sourceString: The high failure rates associated with pharmaceutical development are referred to as an "attrition rate", requiring decisions during the early stages of drug development to "kill" projects early to avoid costly failures.
targetString: umubare munini w'ibituma umuti utaboneka ushingiye ku ikorwa ryawo, ibi bizwi ku izina ry'“ikigero cya byacitse”, aho haba hagomba gufatwa ibyemezo hakiri kare mu bijyanye no gukora umuti mu rwego rwo guhagarika imishinga hagamijwe kwirinda ibihombo.

sourceString: One 2010 study assessed both capitalized and out-of-pocket costs for bringing a single new drug to market as about US$1.8 billion and $870 million, respectively.
targetString: Inyigo imwe yo mu w'2010 yasanze amafaranga ashorwa n'andi yose ashorwa kugira ngo umuti mushya umwe ugere ku isoko angana n‘amadorari miliyari US$1.8 na miliyoni US$870, uko bikurikirana.

sourceString: A median cost estimate of 2015-16 trials for development of 10 anti-cancer drugs was $648 million.
targetString: Amafaranga yatanzwe mu igerageza ry'imiti ivura kanseri ryo mu myaka ya 2015-16 abarirwa mu madorari miliyoni $648.

sourceString: In a 2016 review of 106 drug candidates assessed through clinical trials, the total capital expenditure for a manufacturer having a drug approved through successful Phase III trials was $2.6 billion (in 2013 dollars), an amount increasing at an annual rate of 8.5%.
targetString: Mu igenzura ryakozwe mu w'2016 ku miti 106 yari mu igeragezwa, ikiguzi cyose hamwe cyayitanzweho mu byiciriro byose uko ari III byo gukora umuti cyari amadorari miliyari $2.6 ( mu gaciro k'idorari ryo mu w'2013), amafaranga agenda yiyongera ku kigero cya 8.5%.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating repurposed drugs already approved to treat malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine phosphate.
targetString: Amageragezwa arindwi yakorewe ku miti isanzwe yemewe mu kuvura Malaria, harimo ine ya “hydroxychloroquine” cyangwa “chloroquine phosphate”.

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with 9 Phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwo mu Bushinwa burimo kwibanda cyane ku miti isanzwe ivura indwara ziterwa na virusi, hakorwa igeragezwa mu byiciro III inshuro 9 ku muti witwa “remdesivir”, mu bihugu byinshi bitandukanye bitewe na raporo igomba gusohoka bitarenze impera za Mata.

sourceString: Led by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation with partners investing US$125 million and coordinating with the World Health Organization, the COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator began in March, facilitating drug development researchers to rapidly identify, assess, develop, and scale up potential treatments.
targetString: Ikigo cya Bill na Melinda Gates gifatanyije n'abafatanyabikorwa bacyo bashora amafaranga angana na miliyoni US$125 kandi ku bufatanye bw'Umuryango Mpuzamahanga wita ku Buzima, hatangiye ibikorwa byo gushaka umuti uvura COVID-19 muri Werurwe, hafashwa abashakashatsi kuri uwo muti kuwubona byihuse, kuwusuzuma, kuwukora no kuwukoresha mu kuvura abantu ku buryo bufatiaka .

sourceString: The COVID-19 Clinical Research Coalition formed to coordinate and expedite results from international clinical trials on the most promising post-infection treatments.
targetString: hashinze ihuriro ku bushakashatsi ku muti wa COVID-19 mu rwego rwo guhuzaibikorwa no kwihutisha kubona ibisubizo bivuye mu igeragezwa ry'imiti rikorwa ku isi hose ishobora kuvura ubwandu bw'iki cyorezo.

sourceString: In early 2020, numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections were being repurposed or developed in new clinical research efforts to alleviate the illness of COVID-19.
targetString: Mu ntangirio za 2020, hatangiwe ubushakashatsi ku miti inyuranye isanzwe ivura izindi ndwara mu rwego rwo kureba niba ishobora guhangana na COVID-19.

sourceString: For an already-approved drug (such as hydroxychloroquine for malaria), Phase III-IV trials determine in hundreds to thousands of COVID-19-infected people the possible extended use of an already-approved drug for treating COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Ku miti isanzwe yemewe mu buvuzi (nka “hydroxychloroquine” uvura malaria), igeragezwa ryo mu byiciro bya III-IV bigaragaza ko abantu amagana n'ibihumba bafite ubwandu bwa COVID-19 bashobora kuvurwa n'iyo miti yemewe isanzwe ivura izindi ndwara.

sourceString: As of early April 2020, 103 candidate therapeutics were in preclinical or a stage of Phase I-IV development, with trial results for 29 drug candidates expected during April.
targetString: Nko mu ntangiriro za Mata 2020, imiti igera ku 103 yari mu igeragezwa ry'ibanze cyangwa mu kiciro I-IV k'ikorwa ry'imiti, hitezwe nibura ko ibisubizo ku miti 29 byaba byabonetse muri Mata .

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization (WHO) launched the coordinated "Solidarity trial" in 10 countries to rapidly assess in thousands of COVID-19 infected people the potential efficacy of existing antiviral and anti-inflammatory agents not yet evaluated specifically for COVID-19 illness.
targetString: Muri Werurwe, Umuryango Mpuzamahanga wita ku Buzima(WHO) watangije ihuriro wise "Solidarity trial" mu bihugu 10, hakorerwa igeragezwa ku bihumbi by'abantu banduye COVID-19, mu rwego rwo gusuzuma byihuse niba imiti isanzwe ivura indwara ziterwa na virusi n'ubundi burwayi butwika umubiri ishobora kuvura indwara ya COVID-19.

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce mortality?
targetString: Ese haba hari umwe muri iyi miti ugabanya abantu bapfa bishwe n'iki cyorezo?

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce the time a patient is hospitalized?
targetString: Ese haba muri iyi miti harimo ushobora kugabanya igihe umuntu amara mu bitaro arwaye?

sourceString: Do the treatments affect the need for people with COVID-19-induced pneumonia to be ventilated or maintained in intensive care?
targetString: Ese iyi miti yaba igira uruhare mu gutuma uwanduye COVID-19 ufite ibibazo by'umusonga adakenera kongererwa umwuka cyangwa gushyirwa ahagenewe indembe?

sourceString: Could such drugs be used to minimize the illness of COVID-19 infection in healthcare staff and people at high risk of developing severe illness?Enrolling people with COVID-19 infection is simplified by using data entries, including informed consent, on a WHO website.
targetString: Ese birashoboka ko iyi miti ishobora gukoreshwa mu kugabanya uburwayi bwa COVID-19 ku baganga n'abandi bantu basanganywe uburwayi bukomeye? Kubarura abantu banduye COVID-19 byoroshywa no gukoresha amakuru yatanzwe, harimo n'ibyumvikanyweho, bisangwa ku rubuga rwa WHO.

sourceString: After the trial staff determines the drugs available at the hospital, the WHO website randomizes the hospitalized subject to one of the trial drugs or to the hospital standard of care for treating COVID-19.
targetString: Iyo abashinzwe igeragezwa ry'imiti bamaze gutangaza imiti irimo gukoreshwa mu bitaro, urubuga rwa WHO ruhitamo abarwayi bagomba kugeragerezwaho iyo miti cyangwa hagakoreshwa uburyo bwemewe bwo kuvura COVID-19.

sourceString: The trial physician records and submits follow-up information about the subject status and treatment, completing data input via the WHO Solidarity website.
targetString: Umuganga urimo gukora igerageza yandika kandi agatanga amakuru ajyanye nuko umurwayi agenda amererwa. Akagenda yuzuza inyandiko iri ku rubuga rw'ihuriro ryitwa “WHO solidarity”

sourceString: A global safety monitoring board of WHO physicians examine interim results to assist decisions on safety and effectiveness of the trial drugs, and alter the trial design or recommend an effective therapy.
targetString: Urwego rw'isi rushinzwe ubuziranenge rugizwe n'abaganga ba WHO rukora isuzuma ku byavuye mu igeragezwa mu rwego rwo gufasha mu ifatwa ry'ibyemezo ku buziranenge n'ubushobozi bw'umuti uri mu igeragezwa, no guhindura imitere yawo cyangwa gutanga inama y'igikwiye gukorwa kugira ngo hongerwe ubushobozi bw'umuti.

sourceString: A similar web-based study to Solidarity, called "Discovery", was initiated in March across seven countries by INSERM (Paris, France).During March, funding for the Solidarity trial reached US$108 million from 203,000 individuals, organizations and governments, with 45 countries involved in financing or trial management.
targetString: Hari indi nyigo isa n'iyakozwe n'ihuriro yitwa “Ubuvumbuzi” yatangiye gukorwa muri Werurwe, itangirira mu bihugu birindwi, ikorwa na INSERM (Paris, France). Muri Werurwe Ihuririo ry'igerageza ry'imiti ryahawe inkunga y'amafaranga agera kuri miliyoni US$108 itanzwe n'abantu ku giti cyabo bangana na 203.000, imiryango na za guverinoma, harimo n'ibihugu 45 byemeye gutanga amafaranga cyangwa gukurikirana icyo gikorwa.

sourceString: Numerous candidate drugs under study as "supportive" treatments to relieve discomfort during illness, such as NSAIDs or bronchodilators, are not included in the table below.
targetString: Imiti myinshi irimo kwigwaho ifatwa nk' “igomba gufasha” mu kugabanya kumererwa nabi n'iyi ndwara, nka “NSAIDs” cyangwa “bronchodilators”, ntiri ku rutande turi bubone hasi.

sourceString: Others in early-stage Phase II trials or numerous treatment candidates in Phase I trials, are also excluded.
targetString: Indi nayo igitangira ikiri mu cyiciro cya IIcy'igeragezwa cyangwa indi miti myinshi iri ku cyiro cya I cy'igeragezwa, nayo ntibariwemo.

sourceString: Drug candidates in Phase I-II trials have a low rate of success (under 12%) to pass through all trial phases to gain eventual approval.
targetString: Imiti iri mu kiciro cya I-II cy'igeragezwa ifite rwego rwo hasi rwo rw'icyizere ( munsi ya 12%) cyo kuba yanyura mu byiciro byose by'igeragezwa kugira ngo ibe yakwemerwa.

sourceString: Hydroxychloroquine is more commonly available than chloroquine in the United States.
targetString: Muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika umuti wa ”Hydroxychloroquine” uraboneka cyane kurusha “chloroquine”.

sourceString: Although several countries use chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine for treatment of persons hospitalized with COVID-19, as of March 2020 the drug has not been formally approved through clinical trials in the United States.
targetString: Nubwo ibihugu byinshi bikoresha umuti wa “chloroquine” cyangwa “hydroxychloroquine” mu kuvura abantu barwaye COVID-19, muri Werurwe 2020, uyu muti ntabwo wari wakemejwe ku mugaragaro mu igeragezwa ryakorewe muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika.

sourceString: Chloroquine has been recommended by Chinese, South Korean and Italian health authorities for the treatment of COVID-19, although these agencies and the US CDC noted contraindications for people with heart disease or diabetes.

sourceString: b'Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds.

sourceString: Symptoms in other species vary: in chickens, they cause an upper respiratory tract disease, while in cows and pigs they cause diarrhea.

targetString: Koronavirusi iri mu muryango wa Orthocoronavirinae, mu muryango wa Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, na realm Riboviria.

sourceString: They are enveloped viruses with a positive-sense single-stranded RNA genome and a nucleocapsid of helical symmetry.
targetString: Ni virusi zifunze mu turemangingo twa RNA hamwe n'ibyo bita nucleocapsid.

sourceString: The genome size of coronaviruses ranges from approximately 26 to 32 kilobases, one of the largest among RNA viruses.
targetString: Ingano y'akaremangingo ka za koronavirusi ibarirwa hagati ya kilobaze 26 na 32, ikaba ari zimwe muri virusi za RNA.

sourceString: They have characteristic club-shaped spikes that project from their surface, which in electron micrographs create an image reminiscent of the solar corona from which their name derives.
targetString: Zirangwa n'uduhembe tw'ibinure turi hejuru yazo , aho utuce twazo tukora ishusho ya korona yo ku zuba akaba ari naho izina ryazo rituruka.

sourceString: Coronaviruses were first discovered in the 1930s when an acute respiratory infection of domesticated chickens was shown to be caused by infectious bronchitis virus (IBV).
targetString: Virusi za korona zavumbuwe bwa mbere mu myaka yo mu 1930, ubwo hari hamaze kugaragazwa ko ubwandu bukomeye bwo mu buhumekero ku nkoko buterwa na virusi itera udusebe mu myanya y'ubuhumekero (IBV).

sourceString: In the 1940s, two more animal coronaviruses, mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) and transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), were isolated.Human coronaviruses were discovered in the 1960s.
targetString: Mu myaka ya za 1940, hagaragaye izindi ndwra ebyiri za koronavirusi yo mu nyanaswa, iyo mu bwoko bwataka impyiko z'imbeba (MHV) na virusi yandurira muri gazi yo mu gifu (TGEV). Koronavirusi yo mu bantu yagaragaye muri za 1960.

sourceString: The earliest ones studied were from human patients with the common cold, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.
targetString: iziheruka gukorwaho ubushakashatsi zari izisanzwe mu barwayi bafite ikibazo k'ibicurane, zahise zitwa koronavirusi zifata abantu zo mu bwoko bwa 229E na koronavirusi zo mu bantu zitwa OC43.

sourceString: They were first imaged by Scottish virologist June Almeida at St. Thomas Hospital in London.
targetString: Zagaragajwe bwa mbere n'umuganga wize ibijyanye na virusi wo muri Sikotilandi muri Kamena ahitwa Almeida mu bitaro byitiriwe Mutagatifu Thomas l byo muri London.

sourceString: Other human coronaviruses have since been identified, including SARS-CoV in 2003, HCoV NL63 in 2004, HKU1 in 2005, MERS-CoV in 2012, and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.
targetString: Guhera icyo gihe havumbuwe izindi koronavirusi, zirimo SARS-CoV muri 2003, HCoV NL63 muri 2004, HKU1 muri 2005, MERS-CoV muri 2012, na SARS-CoV-2 muri 2019.

sourceString: Most of these have involved serious respiratory tract infections.
targetString: Inyinshi muri izi zitera indwara zikomeye z'ubuhumero.

sourceString: The name was first used in 1968 by an informal group of virologists in the journal Nature to designate the new family of viruses.
targetString: Izina ryakoreshejwe bwa mbere mu mwaka wa 1968, rikoreshejwe n'itsinda ritazwi ry'abaganga b'indwara ziterwa na virusi mu kinyamakuru kitwa Nature bashaka kuvuga ubwoko bushya bwa virusi.

sourceString: The name refers to the characteristic appearance of virions (the infective form of the virus) by electron microscopy, which have a fringe of large, bulbous surface projections creating an image reminiscent of a crown or of a solar corona.
targetString: Izina risobanura ibiranga virusi bigaragarira amaso (agace gafite ubushobozi bwo kwanduza virusi) biboneka hakoreshejwe mikorosikopi, ifite impande zagutse, ifite isura y'uruziga bituma igaragara nk'ifoto y'izuba .

sourceString: This morphology is created by the viral spike peplomers, which are proteins on the surface of the virus.
targetString: Iyi sura igaragazwa n'amahembe, akaba ari intungabuzima ziba ziri inyuma kuri virusi.

sourceString: Coronaviruses are large pleomorphic spherical particles with bulbous surface projections.
targetString: Za koranavirusi ni utubumbe tunini dufite amahembe.

sourceString: The envelope of the virus in electron micrographs appears as a distinct pair of electron dense shells.The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer where the membrane (M), envelope (E) and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.
targetString: ishusho ya Virusi nshya muri mikorosikopi igaragara nk'uduce duto twishyize hamwe. Virusi igizwe n'ikinure cy'imirasire ibiri aho intungabuzima z'igice k'inyuma (M), igice gikurikira igice k'inyuma(E)n'igisamahembe (S) ahaba hari intungamubiri.

sourceString: The lipid bilayer envelope, membrane proteins, and nucleocapsid protect the virus when it is outside the host cell.
targetString: Ikinure cy'imirasire ibiri, intungabuzima z'igice k'inyuma hamwe n'ik'imbere birinda virusi iyo isohotse mu kinyabuzima cyayanduye .

sourceString: Coronaviruses contain a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.
targetString: Koronavirusi ifite uturemangingo twa RNA dufite ubuzima kandi tugiye umujyo umwe.

sourceString: The genome size for coronaviruses ranges from 26.4 to 31.7 kilobases.
targetString: Ingano y'uturemangingo twa koronavirusi iri hagati ya kilobaze 26.4 na 31.7.

sourceString: The genome size is one of the largest among RNA viruses.
targetString: Iyi niyo virusi ifite uturemangingo tunini ugereranyije n'izindi zo mu bwoko bwa RNA.

sourceString: The open reading frames 1a and 1b, which occupy the first two-thirds of the genome, encode the replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.
targetString: Ibice bya mbere 1a na 1b , bikaba bifata umwanya ungana na bibiri bya gatatu bya virusi yose, bituma habaho iyororoka/ ikura ry'intungabuzima zitandukanye za virusi.

sourceString: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein self cleaves to form nonstructural proteins.The later reading frames encode the four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.
targetString: Iyororoka/ ikura ry'intungabuzima zitandukanye ryikora kugira ngo habeho imiterere y'intungabuzima. Ibishashi bya nyuma bigizwe n'ibice bine by'ingenzi by'intungabuzima: Ihembe, igice k'inyuma,uruhu n'igice k'imbere.

sourceString: Interspersed between these reading frames are the reading frames for the accessory proteins.
targetString: Ihuzwa ry'ibi bice rikorwa mu buryo butuma byose bishobora kubona uko zihura.

sourceString: The number of accessory proteins and their function is unique depending on the specific coronavirus.
targetString: Umubare w'uduce duhuza ibyo bice n'akamaro katwo urihariye bitewe na koronavirusi runaka.

sourceString: Infection begins when the viral spike (S) glycoprotein attaches to its complementary host cell receptor.
targetString: Ubwandu butangira kubaho iyo ihembe rya virusi (S) rihuye n'akaremangingo k'umubiri w'uwakira virusi .

sourceString: After attachment, a protease of the host cell cleaves and activates the receptor-attached spike protein.
targetString: Nyuma yo guhura, akaremangingo k'uwakiriye virusi kicamo ibice hanyuma kagatuma habaho ikindi gice gishya gifite amahembe mu mubiri .

sourceString: Depending on the host cell protease available, cleavage and activation allows the virus to enter the host cell by endocytosis or direct fusion of the viral envelop with the host membrane.On entry into the host cell, the virus particle is uncoated, and its genome enters the cell cytoplasm.
targetString: Bitewe n'uturemangingo turi mu mubiri w'ikinyabuzima cyakira, ishwanyagurika n'itangira ryo gukorwa kwa virusi bituma virusi yinjira mu mubiri ishongera cyangwa ihita yinjira mu mubiri w'uyanduye. Ikimara kwinjira mu mubiri, virusi iba idatwikirye kandi uturemangingo twayo twinjira mu kinyabuzima.

sourceString: The host ribosome translates the initial overlapping open reading frame of the virus genome and forms a long polyprotein.
targetString: Akaremangingo kakiriye virusi gahindura imiterere yayo kakayihinduramo ikinure kirekire.

sourceString: The polyprotein has its own proteases which cleave the polyprotein into multiple nonstructural proteins.
targetString: Icyo kinure gifite uturemangingo twacyo bwite dushwanyaguza icyo kinure kikavamo uturemangingo dutandukanye.

sourceString: A number of the nonstructural proteins coalesce to form a multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).
targetString: Umubare w'uturemangingo dutandukanye turiyegeranya tugakora ikintu kimwe gishobora kororoka no gukura (RTC).

sourceString: The main replicase-transcriptase protein is the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).
targetString: Ikinyabuzima gishobora kororoka no gukura gishingiye kuri RNA igizwe n'uturemangingo twayo dutandukanye (RdRp).

sourceString: It is directly involved in the replication and transcription of RNA from an RNA strand.
targetString: Ihita ako kanya yinjira mu iyororoka n'ikura rya RNA yavuye mu ishwanyuka rya RNA.

sourceString: The other nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription process.
targetString: Utundi turemangingo dutandukanye tugira uruhare mu iyororoka n'ikura .

sourceString: The exoribonuclease nonstructural protein, for instance, provides extra fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function which the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks.One of the main functions of the complex is to replicate the viral genome.
targetString: Uturemangingo tw'inyuma, urugero, two dukurikirana igikorwa cy'iyororoka tukareba icyo uturemangingo twa RNA twaba tubura. Akamaro katwo k'ibanze ni korora uturemangingo twa virusi.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense genomic RNA from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: RdRp ihuza ako kanya uturemangingo duteye nabi n'uduteye neza.

sourceString: This is followed by the replication of positive-sense genomic RNA from the negative-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: Ibi bikurikirwa n'iyororka ry'uturemangingo twa RNA duteye neza twari duyeye nabi mbere.

sourceString: The other important function of the complex is to transcribe the viral genome.
targetString: Akandi kamaro k'ingenzi k'iryo tsinda ni uguhindagura akaremangingo ka virusi.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: RdRp ihuza ako kanya uduce tw'uturemangingo duteye nabi twavuye uduteye neza.

sourceString: This is followed by the transcription of these negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules to their corresponding positive-sense mRNAs.
targetString: Ibi bikurikirwa n'ihindagurika ry'utu duce tw'uturemangingo twa RNA duteye nabi tugahuzwa n'uduteye neza twa mRNAs.

sourceString: The replicated positive-sense genomic RNA becomes the genome of the progeny viruses.
targetString: Uturemangingo twaturutse mu iyororoka duhinduka tumwe mu tugize virusi.

sourceString: The mRNAs are gene transcripts of the last third of the virus genome after the initial overlapping reading frame.
targetString: uturemangingo twa mRNAs ni udutce tw'utunyangingo tugize icya gatatu k'ikinure cya virusi cya mbere.

sourceString: These mRNAs are translated by the host's ribosomes into the structural proteins and a number of accessory proteins.
targetString: Utu turemangingo twa mRNA duhindurirwa imiterere n'ikinyabuzima cyatwakiriye tugahita natwo dukora ikinyabuzima cyatwo kigizwe n'uturemangingo dutandukanye.

sourceString: RNA translation occurs inside the endoplasmic reticulum.
targetString: Ihinduka rya RNA ribera mu gice k'imbere k'ikinyabuzima.

sourceString: The viral structural proteins S, E, and M move along the secretory pathway into the Golgi intermediate compartment.
targetString: uduce tugize virusi aritwo S, E na M tugendana n'ururenda rwatwo rugakora inzira mucyo bita Golgi.

sourceString: There, the M proteins direct most protein-protein interactions required for assembly of viruses following its binding to the nucleocapsid.
targetString: Aha, uduce tugize M tuyobora uduce ku tundi duce dukenewe na virusi bitewe n'imiterere y'igice k'imbere.

sourceString: Progeny viruses are then released from the host cell by exocytosis through secretory vesicles.
targetString: Uduce tugize virusi duhita noneho turekurwa tugasohoka mu kinyabuzima cyatwakiriye twifashishije ururenda.

sourceString: The interaction of the coronavirus spike protein with its complement host cell receptor is central in determining the tissue tropism, infectivity, and species range of the virus.
targetString: Ikorana ry'udutwe twa virusi hamwe n'akaremangingo k'ikinyabuzima cyayakiriye ni ikintu gishingirwaho mu kumenya imiterere , ubwandure, n'ibigize virusi.

sourceString: The SARS coronavirus, for example, infects human cells by attaching to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.
targetString: Koronavirusi ya SARS, urugero, igera mu turengingo tugize umubiri w'umuntu tuyihuza n'icyo bita “angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2)” mu cyongereza.

sourceString: The scientific name for coronavirus is Orthocoronavirinae or Coronavirinae.
targetString: Izina rya gihanga rya Koronavirusi ni “Orthocoronavirinae” cyangwa “Coronavirinae”.

sourceString: Coronaviruses belong to the family of Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
targetString: Koronavirusi ziri mu muryango wa “Coronaviridae”, “order Nidovirales”, na “realm Riboviria”.

sourceString: Genus Betacoronavirus; type species: Murine coronavirus
targetString: Genus Betacoronavirus; ubwoko : koronavirusi ya mu mbeba

sourceString: Species: Betacoronavirus 1 (Bovine Coronavirus, Human coronavirus OC43), Human coronavirus HKU1, Murine coronavirus, Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5, Rousettus bat coronavirus HKU9, Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, Hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)
targetString: Ubwoko: Betacoronavirus 1 (Coronavirus yo mu nka, coronavirus OC43 yo mu Bantu),coronavirus HKU1 yo mu bantu, coronavirus yo mu mbeba, coronavirus HKU5 yo mu ducurama two mu bwoko bwa Pipistrellus, coronavirus HKU9 yo mu ducurama two mu bwoko bwa Rousettus, Indwara ikomeye y'igikatu ya coronavirus ifata inzira y'ubuhumekero (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), coronavirus HKU4 yo mu ducurama two mu bwoko bwa Tylonycteris, Indwara iboneka mu Burasirazuba bwo Hagati ifitanye isano na coronavirus, coronavirus 1 (EriCoV) yo mu mbuni

sourceString: Species: Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, Infectious bronchitis virus
targetString: Ubwoko: Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, virusi itera buronshite

sourceString: The most recent common ancestor (MRCA) of all coronaviruses is estimated to have existed as recently as 8000 BCE, although some models place the common ancestor as far back as 55 million years or more, implying long term coevolution with bat and avian species.
targetString: Igisekuru (MRCA) cya nyuma cya za koronavirusi bivugwa ko kiri mu myaka 8000 mbere y'ivuka rya yezu, nubwo hari amwe mu makuru avuga ko igisekuru rusange gishyirwa mu myaka ya kera ahagana mu yaka miliyoni 55 cyangwa mbere yaho, bikavuga ko yamaraga igihe kinini mu gacurama n'ibindi biguruka.

sourceString: The most recent common ancestor of the alphacoronavirus line has been placed at about 2400 BCE, the betacoronavirus line at 3300 BCE, the gammacoronavirus line at 2800 BCE, and the deltacoronavirus line at about 3000 BCE.
targetString: Igisekuru giheruka cya alphacoronavirus gishyirwa mu myaka ya za 2400 mbere y'ivuka rya Yezu, betacoronavirus muri 3300 mbere y'ivuka rya Yezu, gammacoronavirus at 2800 mbere y'ivuka rya Yezu, naho deltacoronavirus ikabarirwa mu myaka ya za 3000 mbere y'ivuka rya Yezu.

sourceString: The large number of host bat and avian species, and their global range, has enabled extensive evolution and dissemination of coronaviruses.Many human coronavirus have their origin in bats.
targetString: Umubare munini w'uducurama n'ibiguruka byakira virusi, n' ikigererenyo cyabyo ku isi, watumye koronavirusi irushaho kororoka no gukwirakwira. Koronavirusi zandurwa n'abantu inyinshi zituruka mu ducurama.

sourceString: More recently, alpaca coronavirus and human coronavirus 229E diverged sometime before 1960.
targetString: Vuba aha, koronavirusi yo mu bwoko bwa alpaca na koronavirusi zandurwa n'abantu 229E zadutse mbere ya 1960.

sourceString: MERS-CoV emerged in humans from bats through the intermediate host of camels.
targetString: MERS-CoV yageze mu bantu iturutse mu ducurama inyuze mu ngamiya zayanduye.

sourceString: MERS-CoV, although related to several bat coronavirus species, appears to have diverged from these several centuries ago.
targetString: MERS-CoV, nubwo ifitanye n'ubwoko bwinshi bwa koronavirusi, isa nkaho yabayeho guhera mu binyejana byinshi byashize.

sourceString: The most closely related bat coronavirus and SARS-CoV diverged in 1986.
targetString: Koronavirusi ifitanye isano ya hafi n'agacurama hamwe na SARS-CoV zatangiye kubaho mu mwaka w' 1986.

sourceString: A possible path of evolution, of SARS coronavirus and keen bat coronaviruses, suggests that SARS related coronaviruses coevolved in bats for a long time.
targetString: uburyo bushoboka yagiye ikuramo, bijyanye na koronavirusi ya SARS n'iyo mu ducurama, bigaragara ko Koronavirusi zifitanye isano na SARS zagiye zikurana mu ducurama igihe kirekire.

sourceString: In the 1790s, equine coronavirus diverged from the bovine coronavirus after a cross-species jump.
targetString: mu myaka ya 1790, koronavirusi yo mu ndogobe yakomotse muri koronavirusi yo mu nyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inka nyuma yo kunyura mu binyabuzima bitandukanye.

sourceString: Later in the 1890s, human coronavirus OC43 diverged from bovine coronavirus after another cross-species spillover event.
targetString: Nyuma muri za 1890, koronavirusi yo mu bantu OC43 yakomotse muri koronavirusi yo mu nyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'inka coronavirus nyuma yo kunyura mu bindi binyabuzima bitandukanye.

sourceString: It is speculated that the flu pandemic of 1890 may have been caused by this spillover event, and not by the influenza virus, because of the related timing, neurological symptoms, and unknown causative agent of the pandemic.
targetString: Bivugwa ko icyorezo k'ibicurane cyo mu w'1890 cyaba cyaraturutse ku gikorwa cyo kwanduzanya, ko atari kuri virusi itera ibicurane, bitewe n'igihe, ibimenyetso byo mu bwonko, n'igitera icyo cyorezo kitazwi.

sourceString: Human coronavirus OC43 besides causing respiratory infections is also suspected of playing a role in neurological diseases.
targetString: Usibye kuba Koronavirusi yo mu bantu OC43 itera ibibazo byo mu buhumekero, bivugwa ko igira n'uruhare mu ndwara zo mu bwonko.

sourceString: In the 1950s, the human coronavirus OC43 began to diverge into its present genotypes.
targetString: Muri za 1950, Koronavirusi yo mu bantu OC43 yatangiye kubaho iteye uko tuyibona ubu.

sourceString: Phylogentically, mouse hepatitis virus (Murine coronavirus), which infects the mouse's liver and the central nervous system, is related to  human coronavirus OC43 and bovine coronavirus.
targetString: Hashingiwe ku isano iba hagati y'ibinyabuzima, virusi yo mu mbeba, ifata umwijima n'igice cyo hagati by'imbeba, ifitanye isano na Koronavirusi yo mu bantu OC43 ndetse n'iyo mu bimasa.

sourceString: Human coronavirus HKU1, like the aforementioned viruses, also has its origins in rodents.
targetString: Koronavirusi yo mu bantu HKU1, kimwe n'izindi viruse zavuzwe haruguru, ifite nayo inkomoko mu dusimba dufitanye isano n'imbeba.

sourceString: Coronaviruses vary significantly in risk factor.
targetString: Koronavirusi zigenda zigira ingaru zitandukanye.

sourceString: Some can kill more than 30% of those infected, such as MERS-CoV, and some are relatively harmless, such as the common cold.
targetString: Zimwe zishobora kwica 30% by'ibinyabuzima byazanduye, urugero nka MERS-CoV, izindi nazo wavuga ko ntacyo zitwaye, urugero nk'izitera kugira imbeho.

sourceString: Coronaviruses can cause colds with major symptoms, such as fever, and a sore throat from swollen adenoids.
targetString: Koronavirusi zishobora gutera gutengurwa gukabije kurangwa n'ibintu bitandukanye, nk'umuriro na kubabara mu muhogo kwatewe no kubyimba k'ibice byo mu muhogo.

sourceString: Coronaviruses can cause pneumonia (either direct viral pneumonia or secondary bacterial pneumonia) and bronchitis (either direct viral bronchitis or secondary bacterial bronchitis).
targetString: Koronavirusi zishobora gutera indwara zo kubura umwuka (bitewe na virusi yahise ijya mu myanya y'ubuhumekero cyangwa udukoko twahageze nyuma) ndetse n'indwara za bronshite (bitewe na virusi yahise ijyamu myanya y'ubuhumekero cyangwa udukoko twahageze nyuma).

sourceString: The human coronavirus discovered in 2003, SARS-CoV, which causes severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), has a unique pathogenesis because it causes both upper and lower respiratory tract infections.Six species of human coronaviruses are known, with one species subdivided into two different strains, making seven strains of human coronaviruses altogether.
targetString: Koronavirusi yo mu bantu yavumbuwe mu w' 2003, SARS-CoV, itera ibibazo bikomeye byo mu buhumekero (SARS), ifite imiterere yihariye kubera ko itera ibibazo byoroshye n'ibikomeye byo mu myanya y'ubuhumekero. Hari ubwoko butandatu buzwi bwa koronavirusi yo mu bantu, harimo bumwe bugabanyijemo utundi duce, ibi bigatuma umubare wa za koronavirusi zo mu bantu ugera kuri karindwi.

sourceString: Four of these coronaviruses continually circulate in the human population and produce the generally mild symptoms of the common cold in adults and children worldwide: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.
targetString: Bune mu bwoko bwa koronavirusi bukomeje gukwirakwira mu bantu kandi muri rusange bugira ibimenyetso byoroshye by'ibicurane mu bantu bakuze ndetse no mu bana ku rwego rw'isi kandi izo koronavirusi ni izi zikurikira: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.

sourceString: Coronaviruses cause about 15% of commons colds.
targetString: Koronavirusi zitera 15% z'indwara z'ibicurane.

sourceString: The majority of colds are caused by rhinoviruses.
targetString: Inyinshi mu ndwara z'indwara z'ibicurane ziterwa na virusi zo mu nkura ( rhinoviruses).

sourceString: The four mild coronaviruses have a seasonal incidence occurring in the winter months in temperate climates.
targetString: Koronavirusi enye zoroheje ziterwa n'ihindagurika ry'ikirere biba mu gihe cy'imvura (umuhindo) kirangwa n'ubukonje buringaniye.

sourceString: There is no preference towards a particular season in tropical climates.
targetString: Nta gihe kihariye kijyanye n'ikirere izi virusi zikunze kugaragaramo.

sourceString: The virus was officially named the SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV).
targetString: Virusi yahawe izina ku mugaragaro rya koronavirusi ya SARS (SARS-CoV).

sourceString: More than 8,000 people were infected, about ten percent of whom died.
targetString: Abantu barenga 8,000 bamaze kwandura, icumi ku ijana byabo baka baritabye Imana.

sourceString: In September 2012, a new type of coronavirus was identified, initially called Novel Coronavirus 2012, and now officially named Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
targetString: Muri Nzeri 2012, hagaragaye ubwoko bushya bwa koronavirusi, ku ikubitiro bwiswe izina rya “Novel Coronavirus 2012”, ubu ikaba yarahawe izina rya” Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV)”.

sourceString: The World Health Organization issued a global alert soon after.
targetString: Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye Ryita ku Buzima ryahise riburira isi .

sourceString: The WHO update on 28 September 2012 said the virus did not seem to pass easily from person to person.
targetString: Amakuru mashya ya WHO yo kuwa 28 Nzeri 2012 avuga ko virusi itapfa kuva byoroshye mu muntu umwe ijya mu wundi.

sourceString: However, on 12 May 2013, a case of human-to-human transmission in France was confirmed by the French Ministry of Social Affairs and Health.
targetString: Nyamara, kuwa 12 Gicurasi 2013, Minisiteri y'imibereho myiza n'ubuzima yo mu gihugu cy'Ubufaransa yemeje ko hari umuntu wandujwe iyi virusi n'undi muntu.

sourceString: In addition, cases of human-to-human transmission were reported by the Ministry of Health in Tunisia.
targetString: byongeye kandi, Minisiteri y'ubuzimo yo muri Tuniziya yatangaje ko hari abantu banduzanyije iyi virusi.

sourceString: Two confirmed cases involved people who seemed to have caught the disease from their late father, who became ill after a visit to Qatar and Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Babiri bagaragayeho ubwo bwandu barimo abandujwe iyi ndwara na papa witabye Imana, warwaye nyuma yo kugirira ingendo mu bihugu bya Qatar na Saudi Arabia.

sourceString: Despite this, it appears the virus had trouble spreading from human to human, as most individuals who are infected do not transmit the virus.
targetString: Nubwo byari bimeze gutya, bigaragara ko iyi virusi igorwa no kuva mu muntu ijya mu wundi, kubera ko abantu benshi bayanduye batayanduza.

sourceString: The final name for the virus is Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
targetString: Izina rya nyuma ry'iyi virusi ni “Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV)”.

sourceString: The only U.S. cases (both survived) were recorded in May 2014.In May 2015, an outbreak of MERS-CoV occurred in the Republic of Korea, when a man who had traveled to the Middle East, visited four hospitals in the Seoul area to treat his illness.
targetString: Abantu babiri gusa bo muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe z'Amerika (bombi ikaba itarabahitanye) nibo bagaragaye muri Gicurasi 2014. Muri Gicurasi 2015, MERS-CoV, iki cyorezo cyagaragaye mu Repubulika ya Koreya, igihe umugabo wari waragirye ingendo mu bihugu byo mu Burasirazuba bwo hagati, yagiye mu bitaro bine byo mu gace ko muri Seoul kwivuza.

sourceString: This caused one of the largest outbreaks of MERS-CoV outside the Middle East.
targetString: Ibi byatumye MERS-CoV ikwirakwira hanze y'ibihugu byo mu Burasirazuba bwo hagati .

sourceString: As of December 2019, 2,468 cases of MERS-CoV infection had been confirmed by laboratory tests, 851 of which were fatal, a mortality rate of approximately 34.5%.
targetString: Nko mu Kuboza 2019, ibizamini byo muri laboratwari byagaragaje abantu 2.468 banduye MERS-CoV, 851 muri bo bitabye Imana, ijanisha ry'imfu rikaba ribarirwa kuri 34,5%.

sourceString: In December 2019, a pneumonia outbreak was reported in Wuhan, China.
targetString: Mu Kuboza 2019, icyorezo gifata ibice by'ubuhumekero cyagaragaye muri Wuhan, Ubushinwa.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, the outbreak was traced to a novel strain of coronavirus, which was given the interim name 2019-nCoV by the World Health Organization (WHO), later renamed SARS-CoV-2 by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.
targetString: Kuwa 31 Kuboza 2019, icyorezo gishya cya koronavirusi , cyahise gihabwa n'Ishami ry'Umuryango w'Abibumbye Ryita ku Buzima(WHO) izina ry'agateganyo rya 2019-nCoV, nyuma cyaje guhabwa izina rya SARS-CoV-2 na Komite mpuzamahanga ikurikirana ibyorezo.

sourceString: Some researchers have suggested the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market may not be the original source of viral transmission to humans.As of 17 April 2020, there have been at least 153,822 confirmed deaths and more than 2,240,191 confirmed cases in the coronavirus pneumonia pandemic.
targetString: Bamwe mu bashakashatsi batanze igitekerezo ko iyi virusi yandurwa n'abantu itaturutse muri Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market. Kugeza ku wa 17 Mata 2020, nibura abantu 153.822 bari bamaze guhitanwa nayo naho abarenga 2.240.191 bari bamaze kwandura icyorezo cya koronavirusi.

sourceString: The Wuhan strain has been identified as a new strain of Betacoronavirus from group 2B with approximately 70% genetic similarity to the SARS-CoV.
targetString: Icyorezo cya Wuhan cyagaragajwe nk'ubwoko bushya bwa Betacoronavirus yo mu itsindarya 2 gifite imiterere isa n'iya SARS-CoV ku kigereranyo cya 70%.

sourceString: The virus has a 96% similarity to a bat coronavirus, so it is widely suspected to originate from bats as well.
targetString: Iyi virusi ifte ibyo ihuriyeho na koronavirusi yo mu gacurama ku kigero cya 96%, kubera ibyo rero birakekwa cyane ko nayo yaba ituruka ku ducurama.

sourceString: The pandemic has resulted in travel restrictions and nationwide lockdowns in several countries.
targetString: Iki cyorezo cyatumye ibihugu byinshi bifata ikemezo cyo guhagarika ingendo no gufunga ibikorwa byinshi.

sourceString: Coronaviruses have been recognized as causing pathological conditions in veterinary medicine since the 1930s.
targetString: Byamenyekanye ko Koronavirusi itera ibibazo bikomeye mu buvuzi bw'amatungo guhera mu myaka ya za 1930.

sourceString: Except for avian infectious bronchitis, the major related diseases have mainly an intestinal location.
targetString: Usibye buronshite iterwa n'ibiguruka, indwara nyisnhi bifitanye isano ziba ziri mu mara.

sourceString: Coronaviruses primarily infect the upper respiratory and gastrointestinal tract of mammals and birds.
targetString: Koronavirusi zibanza gufata ibice byo heju by'ubuhumekero no mu mara y'inyamabere ndetse n'inyoni.

sourceString: They also cause a range of diseases in farm animals and domesticated pets, some of which can be serious and are a threat to the farming industry.
targetString: Zitera kandi indwara zitandukanye mu matugo arara hanze ndetse n'abana n'abantu, zimwe muri zo zikaba zikaze cyane kandi zikaba ari umbogamizi ku bikorwa by'ubworozi.

sourceString: In chickens, the infectious bronchitis virus (IBV), a coronavirus, targets not only the respiratory tract but also the urogenital tract.
targetString: Mu nkoko, virusi ya buronshite (IBV), koronavirusi, ifata imyanya y'ubuhumekero ndetse n'imyanya myibarukiro.

sourceString: The virus can spread to different organs throughout the chicken.
targetString: Virusi ishobora gukwirakwira no mu bindi bice bigize inkoko.

sourceString: Economically significant coronaviruses of farm animals include porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus, TGE) and bovine coronavirus, which both result in diarrhea in young animals.
targetString: Koronavirusi zikunze kwibasira amatungo zirimo izo mu ngurube (TGE) no mu nka, zombi zikaba zitera impiswi amatungo akiri mato.

sourceString: Feline coronavirus: two forms, feline enteric coronavirus is a pathogen of minor clinical significance, but spontaneous mutation of this virus can result in feline infectious peritonitis (FIP), a disease associated with high mortality.
targetString: Koronavirusi yo mu nyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'injangwe: ubwoko bubiri, koronavirusi y'injangwe ni indwara igaragaza ubukana bworoheje, ariko ihindagurika rya buri kanya ryayo rishobora gutera ibibazo byo nda (FIP), indwara itwara ubuzima bw'abantu benshi.

sourceString: Similarly, there are two types of coronavirus that infect ferrets: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes a gastrointestinal syndrome known as epizootic catarrhal enteritis (ECE), and a more lethal systemic version of the virus (like FIP in cats) known as ferret systemic coronavirus (FSC).
targetString: Hari kandi ubundi bwoko bubiri bwa koronavirusi bufata inyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'amafuku: Koronavirusi yo mu mafuku itera uburwayi mu nyama zo mu nda buzwi ku izina rya epizootic catarrhal enteritis (ECE), na virusi yica (nka FIP yo mu njangwe) izi nka ferret systemic coronavirus (FSC).

sourceString: There are two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV), one that causes mild gastrointestinal disease and one that has been found to cause respiratory disease.
targetString: Hari ubwoko bubiri bwa koronavirusi y'imbwa (CCoV), imwe itera uburwayi bwoheje bwo munda n'indi byagaraye ko ifata imyanya y'ubuhumekero .

sourceString: Mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) is a coronavirus that causes an epidemic murine illness with high mortality, especially among colonies of laboratory mice.
targetString: Virusi y'imbeba (MHV) ni koronavirusi itera indwara ikomaka ku mbeba kandi ihitana abantu benshi cyane cyane ahantu hakunze hari za laboratwari nyinshi zipima imbeba nyinshi.

sourceString: Sialodacryoadenitis virus (SDAV) is highly infectious coronavirus of laboratory rats, which can be transmitted between individuals by direct contact and indirectly by aerosol.
targetString: Sialodacryoadenitis virus (SDAV) ni ubwoko bwa koronavirusi yandura cyane ikaba ituruka ku mbeba zo muri laboratwari ishobora kwandurira mu gukoranaho kw'abantu cyangwa mu buryo buziguye mu mwuka.

sourceString: Some strains of MHV cause a progressive demyelinating encephalitis in mice which has been used as a murine model for multiple sclerosis.
targetString: Zimwe mu ndwara za MHV gutuma udutsi two mu bwonko tw'imbeba yakoreweho igeragezwa duturika , .

sourceString: Significant research efforts have been focused on elucidating the viral pathogenesis of these animal coronaviruses, especially by virologists interested in veterinary and zoonotic diseases.
targetString: Ubushakashatsi bwinshi bwashyize imbara mu gusobanura imiterere y'izo koronavirusi, by'umwihariko abahanga mu bijyanye na virusi bibanze mu bijyanye n'amatungo.

sourceString: Porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus of pigs, TGEV).
targetString: Koronavirusi y'ingurube (ifata inyama zo munda y'ingurube, TGEV).

sourceString: Bovine coronavirus (BCV), responsible for severe profuse enteritis in of young calves.
targetString: Koronavirusi y'inka (BCV), izahaza cyane imitavu.

sourceString: Feline coronavirus (FCoV) causes mild enteritis in cats as well as severe Feline infectious peritonitis (other variants of the same virus).
targetString: Koronavirusi y'injangwe (FCoV) ituma injangwe ibyimba amara ndetse n'ibindi bibazo bikomeye byo kubyimba amara(ibindi bibazo biterwa n'iyi virusi).

sourceString: the two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV) (one causing enteritis, the other found in respiratory diseases).
targetString: Ubwoko bubiri bwa koronavirusi y'imbwa(CCoV) (bumwe butera kubyimba amara, ubundi bugatera ibibazo byo guhumeka).

sourceString: Turkey coronavirus (TCV) causes enteritis in turkeys.
targetString: Koronavirusi ya dendo (TCV) ituma dendo ibyimba amara.

sourceString: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes epizootic catarrhal enteritis in ferrets.
targetString: Koronavirusi yo mu nyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'amafuku ituma izo nyamaswa zibyima mu myanya y'ubuhumekero.

sourceString: Ferret systemic coronavirus causes FIP-like systemic syndrome in ferrets.
targetString: Koronavirusi yo mu nyamaswa zo mu bwoko bw'amafuku itera ibibazo bya FIP muri izo nyamaswa.

sourceString: Rabbit enteric coronavirus causes acute gastrointestinal disease and diarrhea in young European rabbits.
targetString: Koronavirusi yo mu nkwavu ifata imyanya yo munda igateran'impiswi ku nkwavu.

sourceString: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PED or PEDV), has emerged around the world.
targetString: Virusi y'ingurube itera impiswi (PED cyangwa PEDV), imaze gusakara ku isi hose.
